article_title: Xi-Putin Meet - Trump-Xi Call - Wang Huning's Message to KMT Vice Chair

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Phone call with US President Donald Trump, readout in People's Daily
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Over the past year, we have enjoyed sound communication and had a successful meeting in Busan. I attach great importance to this relationship. In the new year, I hope to work with you to steer the giant ship of China-U.S. relations steadily forward through winds and storms, and accomplish more big things and good things. Just as the U.S. has its concerns, China for its part also has concerns. If the two sides work in the same direction in the spirit of equality, respect and mutual benefit, we can surely find ways to address each other's concerns.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Phone call with US President Donald Trump, readout in People's Daily
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The two sides should follow the common understandings we have reached, enhance dialogue and communication, manage differences properly, and expand practical cooperation. We should make progress step by step to build mutual trust, find the right way to get along, and make 2026 a year where our two major countries advance toward mutual respect, peaceful coexistence, and win-win cooperation.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Phone call with US President Donald Trump, readout in People's Daily
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The Taiwan question is the most important issue in China-U.S. relations. Taiwan is China's territory. China must safeguard its own sovereignty and territorial integrity, and will never allow Taiwan to be separated. The U.S. must handle the issue of arms sales to Taiwan with prudence.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Inspection visit to Xi Jinping Thought on Diplomacy Research Center in Beijing
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The depth of change and the intensity of disorder in the current international situation are rare in history, and China's development is at a stage in which strategic opportunities coexist with risks and challenges, with uncertain and unpredictable factors increasing. The more complex and intricate the international situation becomes, the more the diplomatic front must study well, research well, and apply well Xi Jinping Thought on Diplomacy.

article_title: China-Uruguay Joint Statement - CPC-KMT Think Tank Forum - Wang Yi Meets Vietnam's Le Hoai Trung

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Meeting with Uruguayan President Yamandú Orsi, readout published in People's Daily
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The world is undergoing changes unseen in a century, the international situation is volatile and turbulent, and unilateral bullying practices are growing more rampant. China supports strengthening solidarity and cooperation across the Global South, jointly promote an equal and orderly multipolar world and a universally beneficial and inclusive economic globalization.

statements.speaker: Li Qiang
statements.context: Meeting with Uruguayan President Yamandú Orsi, Xinhua report
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China is ready to import more high-quality Uruguayan products and encourage competitive Chinese enterprises to invest in Uruguay. China fully supports Uruguay in its rotating presidencies of CELAC and Mercosur, and in chairing the Group of 77 and China for 2026. China will maintain close multilateral communication and coordination with Uruguay to safeguard multilateralism and free trade, defend the common interests of the Global South, and uphold international order, fairness and justice.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.speaker_title: Foreign Minister (implied from context of meeting with Vietnamese envoy)
statements.context: Meeting with Le Hoai Trung, special envoy of CPV General Secretary To Lam, Xinhua report
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: General Secretary Xi Jinping and General Secretary To Lam agreed that both countries should unite and cooperate to promote development. China is willing to work with Vietnam to follow important consensus between top leaders, grasp the strategic nature of bilateral relations, and strengthen high-level exchange. Both countries should unite and cooperate closely, coordinate development and security, and resolutely safeguard the international system with the UN at its core and the international order based on international law. Both countries should protect their own legitimate rights and interests and the common interests of the Global South, and work together to become forces for peace, stability and development.

statements.speaker: Song Tao
statements.speaker_title: Director of Taiwan Affairs Office of the CPC Central Committee
statements.context: Think tank forum between CPC and KMT research institutes, People's Daily report
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The two parties must unswervingly uphold the '1992 Consensus' and oppose 'Taiwan independence' as their common political foundation. We will show no leniency whatsoever in striking at die-hard 'Taiwan independence' elements and their hired thugs and accomplices, and we will tolerate absolutely no external forces that attempt to 'use Taiwan to contain China.' Compatriots on both sides should act as participants, contributors, and beneficiaries of national reunification and national rejuvenation.

article_title: China’s Vision of South Asian Order

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Symposium addressing at end of year 2025
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China's relations with states along its periphery were 'at their best since modern times', but regional dynamics were increasingly 'deeply affected by the changes in the international landscape' and 'maintaining prosperity and stability' across the periphery required 'persistent efforts'

statements.speaker: Chinese leadership/Central Committee
statements.context: First-ever Central Conference on Peripheral Work, April 2025
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The periphery was a 'vital foundation' for China's development and prosperity and needed to be viewed from a 'global perspective'

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Media address during visit to Islamabad, August 2025
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Described the region as 'an important direction for China to build a community with a shared future in its neighbourhood'. China would be a 'trustworthy partner and a strong support for South Asian countries' as they contended with 'unilateral and bullying acts' of the United States

article_title: PLA Daily Commentary on Anti-Corruption Pivots to Future Planning & Combat Effectiveness - Sergei Shoigu Opposes 'Japan’s Attempts to Accelerate Re-militarization'

statements.speaker: PLA Daily
statements.context: Front-page commentary on anti-corruption campaign
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The PLA steadfastly safeguards national sovereignty, security, and development interests. Its original aspiration of seeking happiness for the people and rejuvenation for the nation remains unchanged. Its conviction to listen to the Party and follow the Party remains as firm as a rock. Its will to devote itself to strengthening the military and march toward first-class remains unwavering.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with Sergei Shoigu, Russian Security Council Secretary
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The world is increasingly undergoing both changes and turbulence, with the post-war international order and norms governing international relations severely impacted, and the world faces a real risk of regressing to the law of the jungle. As major countries and permanent members of the UN Security Council, China and Russia have the responsibility and obligation to practice true multilateralism, safeguard the international system with the UN at its core, advocate an equal and orderly multipolar world and a universally beneficial and inclusive economic globalization.
statements.framing: accusatory (implicit critique of current international order)

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with Sergei Shoigu, Russian Security Council Secretary
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China and Russia are each other's largest neighbours and comprehensive strategic partners in the new era. They should maintain close communication on major issues concerning bilateral relations, increase mutual support on issues involving each other's core interests, and safeguard their respective and common interests. The leadership of the two heads of state is the greatest advantage and fundamental guarantee for the high-level development of China-Russia relations.

article_title: PLA Daily Commentary: Anti-Corruption Campaign Rectifying the Roots Politically; Cleansing the Poison Ideologically; & Generating New Flesh Organisationally

statements.speaker: PLA Daily
statements.context: Front-page commentary on anti-corruption investigations
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Political rectification is an important magic weapon for the PLA to strengthen its own construction politically, and a powerful weapon for comprehensively strengthening the Party's leadership and Party building within the PLA. The investigation and handling of Zhang Youxia and Liu Zhenli demonstrates the Party's clear attitude in firmly defending the political character of the PLA.

statements.speaker: PLA Daily
statements.context: Front-page commentary on anti-corruption investigations
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The history of the PLA is a history of moving toward strength through political rectification and innovation under the Party's leadership. Since the Party Congress, the Central Committee with Comrade Xi Jinping at its core has promoted political rectification, rectifying conduct, enforcing discipline, and fighting corruption with unprecedented determination and intensity, eliminating major political hidden dangers that affected the Party's absolute leadership over the military.

statements.speaker: PLA Daily
statements.context: Front-page commentary on anti-corruption investigations
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Political rectification is a baptism and tempering of the PLA from the inside out. The concentrated investigation and handling of corruption problems at present is not that 'the more one fights corruption, the more corruption there is,' but rather that 'the deeper one digs, the more is uncovered'. We must unswervingly carry the military anti-corruption struggle through to the end.

statements.speaker: PLA Daily
statements.context: Front-page commentary on anti-corruption investigations
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: A strong military must first be strong politically; political strength is the most fundamental strength. The Fourth Plenary Session of the 20th Central Committee proposed 'continuously deepening political rectification', which is a strategic deployment made by our Party with a view to building and grasping the military ideologically and politically. The entire military must persist in treating political rectification as a major political task.

statements.speaker: PLA Daily
statements.context: Front-page commentary on anti-corruption investigations
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The military is the one that holds the gun; within the armed forces, there must absolutely be no place for corrupt elements to hide. The current anti-corruption struggle is a continuation of the rectification of work style and anti-corruption efforts since the 18th Party Congress, and a deepening of the reshaping of the PLA. The entire military must maintain a high-pressure posture without wavering.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Politburo study session on future industries development, January 2026
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Cultivating and developing future industries is of great significance for seizing the commanding heights of science, technology, and industry and grasping the initiative in development, for developing new-quality productive forces and building a modern industrial system, for improving the quality of people's lives, and for promoting the all-round development of people and comprehensive social progress.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Politburo study session on future industries development, January 2026
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Future industries have characteristics such as being forward-looking, having strategic significance, and possessing disruptive potential; they require scientific planning and overall coordination. It is essential to focus on the main directions of China's future industrial development during the 15th FYP period, scientifically demonstrate technological routes, and enhance strategic foresight and judgment capability regarding frontier technologies.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Politburo study session on future industries development, January 2026
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The degree of scientific and technological breakthroughs, to a large extent, determines the speed, breadth, and depth of the development of future industries. It is necessary to fully leverage the advantages of the new national system, adhere to the principle of 'industry posing the questions, and science and technology providing the answers', increase efforts in tackling key core technologies in key domains.
statements.topic: technology, industrial policy, research and development

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Politburo study session on future industries development, January 2026
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The rise of many future industries relies on enterprises achieving breakthroughs step by step. It is necessary to fully leverage the principal role of enterprises, promote the agglomeration of all kinds of innovation resources toward enterprises, vigorously cultivate technology-leading enterprises and high-tech enterprises with leading core technologies and strong innovation capabilities.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Politburo study session on future industries development, January 2026
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Future industries have long cultivation cycles and significant market risks, requiring policy support and effective government services. It is necessary to improve fiscal, taxation, and other policies, vigorously develop science and technology finance, comprehensively do a good job in talent training, introduction, and utilisation, and create a strong atmosphere throughout society that encourages innovation.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Politburo study session on future industries development, January 2026
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The development of future industries involves a wide range of areas, requiring improvements in governance systems. It is necessary to coordinate development and security, explore scientific and effective regulatory methods, prevent related risks, ensure both 'releasing vitality' and 'managing well'. It is necessary to deepen international cooperation, actively promoting the joint development of standards, the joint discussion of rules, and the joint promotion of industries among all parties.
statements.topic: technology, industrial policy, governance, international cooperation

article_title: Keir Starmer's Visit to Beijing - Corruption in Chinese Football - Work Plan to Boost Service Consumption

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Meeting with British Prime Minister Keir Starmer in Beijing, reported in People's Daily
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China is always committed to peaceful development, has never started a war, and has never taken an inch of foreign land. No matter how strong and developed China becomes, it will never be a threat to other countries. Unilateralism, protectionism, and power politics are running rampant. International law can be truly effective only when all countries abide by it. Major countries in particular should set an example, otherwise the world will revert to the law of the jungle.

statements.speaker: Li Qiang
statements.context: Meeting with British Prime Minister Keir Starmer in Beijing, reported in People's Daily
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China is the world's second-largest economy and a major country with significant influence. Recently, unilateralism, protectionism, and hegemonic bullying have been rampant internationally. As permanent members of the UN Security Council, China and the UK should demonstrate their responsibilities as major powers, strengthen multilateral communication and coordination, uphold the authority of the United Nations, safeguard multilateralism and free trade, and promote the international order towards a more just and reasonable direction.

statements.speaker: Zhao Leji
statements.speaker_title: Chairman of the National People's Congress Standing Committee
statements.context: Meeting with British Prime Minister Keir Starmer in Beijing, reported by Xinhua
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: As the world today is undergoing both changes and turbulence, developing sound China-Britain relations is of great contemporary value and global significance. China stands ready to work with Britain to resume normal exchanges between the legislative bodies of the two countries.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with UK National Security Advisor Jonathan Powell, reported in People's Daily
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Amid a complex and volatile international landscape, both sides should all the more uphold the purposes and principles of the UN Charter, strengthen dialogue and cooperation, work together to address challenges, and jointly safeguard the international system with the UN at its core. The important common understandings reached between the leaders of both countries on developing a long-term and stable comprehensive strategic partnership between China and the UK will inject strong momentum into institutional exchanges and cooperation across various fields and open a new chapter in China-UK relations.

article_title: China-Finland Ties - Li Qiang Warns: Discipline Work Will Only Become Stricter - Henan Party Chief on Advancing 'High-Efficiency Governance' - China-Russia Defense Ministers' Call

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Meeting with Finnish Prime Minister Petteri Orpo in Beijing
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China and the EU are partners, not rivals, and their cooperation and common ground far outweigh their competition and differences. Expressed hope for Finland to play a constructive role in promoting healthy and steady development of China-Europe relations.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Meeting with Finnish Prime Minister Petteri Orpo in Beijing
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Pointing to a world facing various risks and challenges, major countries should take the lead in upholding equality, the rule of law, cooperation and integrity. China is ready to work with Finland to firmly uphold the U.N.-centered international system and the international order underpinned by international law.

statements.speaker: Li Qiang
statements.context: Meeting with Finnish Prime Minister Petteri Orpo in Beijing
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: At present, unilateralism and protectionism are on the rise around the world, and the global economy is being impacted. China and Finland should work together to safeguard an open and cooperative international economic and trade order, adhere to multilateralism and free trade, maintain the multilateral trading system with the WTO at its core.

statements.speaker: Zhao Leji
statements.speaker_title: Chairman of the National People's Congress
statements.context: Meeting with Senegal's Malick Ndiaye (President of Senegalese National Assembly)
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Senegal has publicly reaffirmed its steadfast adherence to the one-China principle, and China highly appreciates this. China will continue to support Senegal in pursuing an independent, autonomous development path.

statements.speaker: Dong Jun
statements.context: Video call with Russian Defense Minister Andrei Belousov
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Noting that this year marks both the 30th anniversary of the establishment of the China-Russia strategic partnership of coordination and the 25th anniversary of the signing of the China-Russia Treaty of Good-Neighborliness and Friendly Cooperation, expressed China's readiness to work with Russia to implement the important consensus reached by the two heads of state, enhance strategic coordination, enrich the content of cooperation, improve exchange mechanisms, and jointly enhance the ability to cope with various risks and challenges.

article_title: Xi Calls To Lam - Li Seeks Feedback on 15th FYP - National Sci-Tech Conference - Tackling 'Involution-style' Competition in Gov't Procurement - Japanese 'neo-militarism' is 'a Real Threat'

statements.speaker: Li Qiang
statements.context: Symposium on draft government work report and 15th Five-Year Plan
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The external environment is becoming more uncertain, and economic development still faces many risks and challenges. It is necessary to scientifically and accurately grasp the changing situation, confront difficulties, strengthen confidence, concentrate efforts on doing our own work well, implement more proactive and effective macroeconomic policies.

statements.speaker: Ding Xuexiang
statements.speaker_title: Director of the Central Science and Technology Commission
statements.context: National conference on science and technology
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The deeper the scientific and technological revolution and industrial transformation develop, the more it is necessary to strive to seize the commanding heights of international competition and firmly grasp the initiative in scientific and technological competition.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Phone call with To Lam, General Secretary of Communist Party of Vietnam
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The two sides should hold firm to their beliefs, uphold fundamental principles and break new ground, fend off and defuse various risks and challenges, jointly defend the cause of socialism, and preserve the political essence of China-Vietnam relations. Both sides should strengthen coordination and collaboration in international and regional affairs, jointly oppose hegemonism and bloc confrontation, and work together to promote the building of a community with a shared future for humanity.

statements.speaker: Han Zheng
statements.context: Meeting with OIC Secretary-General Hissein Brahim Taha in Beijing
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China appreciates the OIC's emphasis on its relationship with China, and hopes Islamic countries will continue to staunchly support China on the Taiwan question, Xinjiang-related issues, and other issues concerning China's core interests.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with OIC Secretary-General Taha
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Changes unseen in a century are accelerating across the world. China is ready to work with Islamic countries to safeguard the legitimate rights and interests of developing nations. China opposes a return of the world to the law of the jungle, and insists that the historical injustice of the rich getting richer and the poor staying poor must come to an end.

statements.speaker: People's Daily
statements.context: Zhong Sheng commentary on Japan's neo-militarism
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China's measures, taken in accordance with laws and regulations, to prohibit the export of all dual-use items to Japanese military users, for military purposes, and to all other end-users and uses involved in enhancing Japan's military capabilities, are a legitimate and necessary step to safeguard peace and security.

statements.speaker: People's Daily
statements.context: Zhong Sheng commentary on Japan's neo-militarism
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: For some time now, the Japanese side has continuously pushed to revise the 'Three Non-Nuclear Principles', and its politicians have repeatedly made public statements advocating nuclear armament. This not only constitutes a serious challenge to the international nuclear non-proliferation regime, but also completely deviates from Japan's self-proclaimed commitment of 'following the path of peaceful development', and has already triggered strong opposition and condemnation from the international community.

article_title: Thinking about What Zhang's Purge Could Mean for China's Leadership Succession

statements.speaker: PLA Daily
statements.context: Editorial published on the actions against Zhang Youxia and Liu Zhenli
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Zhang Youxia and Liu Zhenli seriously trampled upon and undermined the CMC Chairman Responsibility System, seriously fueled political and corruption issues that affect the Party's absolute leadership over the military and endanger the Party's ruling foundation, seriously affected the image and prestige of the CMC leadership team, and seriously impacted the political and ideological foundation of the unity and forge-ahead spirit of all officers and soldiers. They have caused immense damage to the military's political construction, political ecology, and combat capability construction.

article_title: Understanding 'Comprehensive, Deep & Accurate' Implementation of Building a Modern Industrial System - Interview with Housing Minister Ni Hong - MIIT Briefing on Tech-Industry Agenda

statements.speaker: People's Daily
statements.context: Front page commentary on Xi's speech at Party School
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China's development is characterized by coexistence of strategic opportunities and risks and challenges, with uncertainty and unpredictability increasing. The more complex and volatile the situation becomes, the more necessary it is to firmly hold onto the real economy and accelerate building a modern industrial system. This provides strong material support for achieving the second centennial goal and winning strategic initiative in increasingly fierce international competition.

statements.speaker: Wang Huning
statements.speaker_title: Chairman of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference (CPPCC)
statements.context: CPPCC symposium on macroeconomic situation
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The CPPCC should assist the Party and government in publicising policies, clarifying doubts, stabilising expectations, and strengthening confidence, guiding all sectors of society to comprehensively and dialectically view the economic situation and development trends, and tell the China story well.

statements.speaker: Ministry of Industry and Information Technology
statements.context: Press briefing on China's industrial economic development in 2025
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: We aim to build a batch of 'China exemplars' that represent the highest global level of intelligent manufacturing, blazing a trail and providing leadership for the overall upgrading of China's manufacturing sector. The first batch of 15 leading factories have made a collective debut at the 2025 World Intelligent Manufacturing Conference.

statements.speaker: Xie Cun
statements.speaker_title: Spokesperson of the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology and Director-General of the Information and Communications Development Department
statements.context: Press briefing on industrial development
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Currently, 4.838 million 5G base stations have been built, 5G-A covers over 330 cities; 42 10,000-card intelligent computing clusters have been established, with intelligent computing power exceeding 1590 EFLOPS, ranking among the top in the world. Research and development of 6G has completed the first phase of technical trials, resulting in more than 300 key technology reserves.

statements.speaker: Tao Qing
statements.speaker_title: Spokesperson of the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology and Director-General of the Operation Monitoring and Coordination Bureau
statements.context: Press briefing on industrial development
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The average renewable energy utilisation rate of national green computing power facilities in 2025 exceeded 70%. The next step will focus on bottlenecks such as flexible hydrogen production and intelligent operation of microgrids, promoting the transition of advanced and applicable technologies and equipment from demonstration applications to large-scale popularization.

statements.speaker: Guo Jiakun
statements.context: MFA press conference responding to CGTN question about EU cybersecurity package
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China noted relevant reports and expresses grave concern. Chinese companies have long been conducting lawful operation in Europe and are law-abiding and high-quality providers for the EU's telecom and digital sector. They are never a security threat to European countries. To forcefully limit or ban companies from the market without any evidence and based on non-technical standards seriously violates market principles and fair competition. This act of protectionism is yet another example of turning normal cooperation into political and security issues. We urge the EU to stop pursuing the wrong path of protectionism. China will do what is necessary to defend Chinese companies' lawful rights and interests.

article_title: Xi Addresses Key Provincial & Ministerial Officials on 15th FYP - Officials Hint at Fiscal Deficit Expansion; Announce New Support for Specific Sectors & Consumption - Chinese National Killed in Kabul

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Study session at the Central Party School (National Academy of Governance) for principal officials at provincial and ministerial levels
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China's development is in a period where strategic opportunities and risks and challenges coexist, and uncertain and unpredictable factors are increasing. When analysing the situation, we must consider all factors comprehensively and be adept at grasping some key factors, such as the new changes in the international situation and the new round of scientific and technological revolution and industrial transformation.

statements.speaker: CPC Central Committee
statements.context: Congratulatory message on the convening of the 14th National Congress of the Communist Party of Vietnam, reported by Xinhua
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The CPC and the government of China attach great importance to developing the relations between the two parties and countries, and are willing to work together with the Vietnamese side to adhere to the principles of 'long-term stability, future orientation, good-neighborly friendship and all-round cooperation', and the spirit of 'good neighbors, good friends, good comrades, good partners,' to implement the important consensus reached by the top leaders of the two parties and countries...the CPC and the government of China will join Vietnam to promote the continuous development and achieve fruitful results of the China-Vietnam community with a shared future that carries strategic significance.

statements.speaker: He Lifeng
statements.context: Speech at the World Economic Forum in Davos
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Economic globalization – driven by international specialization, collaboration, complementary strength and the pursuit of win-win – is a prevailing trend of history. It has benefited many countries, including China, and enabled them to achieve fast development. On the contrary, tariff and trade wars have no winners. Beyond driving up costs for production and trade, they fragment the world economy forward and disrupt the global distribution of resources.

statements.speaker: He Lifeng
statements.context: Speech at the World Economic Forum in Davos
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China advocates a universally beneficial and inclusive economic globalization. We are committed to building bridges, not walls. We will firmly support trade and investment, liberalization and facilitation, and continue to share development opportunities with the world.

statements.speaker: He Lifeng
statements.context: Speech at the World Economic Forum in Davos
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China is glad to see countries reach trade agreements that are mutually beneficial. But these agreements should comply with WTO rules and not undermine the interests of third parties.

statements.speaker: He Lifeng
statements.context: Speech at the World Economic Forum in Davos
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China is committed to fostering common prosperity with its trading partners through its own development, and making the pie bigger for the global economy and trade. We never seek trade surplus; on top of being the world's factory, we hope to be the world's market too. However, in many cases, when China wants to buy, others don't want to sell. Trade issues often become security hurdles.

statements.speaker: He Lifeng
statements.context: Speech at the World Economic Forum in Davos
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China and the US had managed to keep 'the economic and trade relationship generally stable' through dialogue last year. To be frank, it's normal for countries with different social systems, status development, histories and cultures to encounter divergences and frictions as they develop and interact. At times, these are just misunderstandings. The key is to uphold the spirit of equality, respect mutual benefits, build trust through dialogue, and to resolve disputes through consultation.

statements.speaker: He Lifeng
statements.context: Speech at the World Economic Forum in Davos
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Instead of looking for answers through confrontation or antagonism, we must find a way out through communication and consultation, and explore the path of win-win and all-win. China is a trading partner, not a rival, for other countries. China's development presents an opportunity, not threat, to the world economy.

statements.speaker: He Lifeng
statements.context: Speech at the World Economic Forum in Davos
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Over the past five years, China has imported more than $15 trillion of goods and services. Its overseas investment has generated over $300 million of tax revenue, created numerous jobs and boosted local economies. China's development has been achieved mainly through reform, opening up and innovation, rather than so-called government subsidy.

statements.speaker: He Lifeng
statements.context: Speech at the World Economic Forum in Davos
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Scientific and technology progress cannot be achieved without international cooperation, and innovation brings both opportunities and risks. China is ready to work with all other countries in a spirit of openness and cooperation to advance sci-tech innovation, empower the world economy and address global challenges in such areas as AI governance.

statements.speaker: Guo Jiakun
statements.context: MFA press briefing
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: A blast hit a Chinese restaurant in Kabul, Afghanistan yesterday and killed and injured many. One Chinese national was killed and five were wounded. China expresses deep condolences over the lives lost and heartfelt sympathies to the injured. China has made urgent representations with Afghanistan and has urged Afghanistan to make every possible effort to save and treat the injured, do more to keep Chinese nationals, projects and institutions safe, get to the bottom of the attack, and bring the perpetrators to justice as soon as possible.

statements.speaker: Guo Jiakun
statements.context: MFA press briefing
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China strongly condemns and firmly opposes any form of terrorism, and supports Afghanistan and regional countries in jointly fighting all forms of terrorist and violent activities.

article_title: 2025 Economic Data - Li Seeks Opinions on 15th FYP - Central Political and Legal Work Conference

statements.speaker: Li Qiang
statements.context: Symposium with experts, entrepreneurs, and representatives from education, science, culture, health, and sports on draft Government Work Report and 15th Five-Year Plan
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Over the past year, under the strong leadership of the Party Central Committee with Comrade Xi Jinping at its core, we implemented more proactive and effective macro policies, calmly responded to external shocks, and our country's economy pressed ahead under pressure. The external situation remains complex and volatile with increasing uncertain and unpredictable factors, but the supporting conditions and basic trend of our country's economy improving over the long term have not changed, and the prospects for high-quality development are broad. As long as we remain confident, face the problems head-on, and concentrate our efforts on managing our own affairs well, we will certainly be able to continuously consolidate and expand the momentum of steady economic growth.
statements.framing: resilient and assertive in face of external challenges

statements.speaker: Zhao Leji
statements.speaker_title: Chairman of the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress
statements.context: Meeting with Sardar Ayaz Sadiq, speaker of the National Assembly of Pakistan
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China stands ready to work with Pakistan to implement the important consensus reached by leaders of the two countries, accelerate the development of an even closer China-Pakistan community with a shared future in the new era, and bring greater benefits to the two peoples. China is willing to strengthen the alignment of its 15th Five-Year Plan with Pakistan's National Economic Transformation Plan for 2024-2029. China is ready to advance the construction of the upgraded Version 2.0 of the China-Pakistan Economic Corridor and to deliver further achievements in key areas such as industry, agriculture, mining, transportation and people's livelihoods. China supports Pakistan's resolute efforts to combat terrorism.
statements.topic: bilateral relations (China-Pakistan), not directly about US

statements.speaker: Chen Wenqing
statements.speaker_title: Director of the Central Committee for Comprehensively Deepening Reform and member of the Politburo Standing Committee
statements.context: Central Political and Legal Work Conference in Beijing
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The political and legal front must persist in taking Xi Jinping Thought on Socialism with Chinese Characteristics for a New Era as guidance and deeply study and implement Xi Jinping Thought on the Rule of Law and the Overall National Security Concept.
