statements.speaker: Ministry of National Defense
statements.context: Official statement through spokesperson Zhang Xiaogang regarding US arms sales to Taiwan
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The arms sales seriously violate the one-China principle and the three China-U.S. joint communiques, grossly interfere in China's internal affairs, undermine China's sovereignty and security interests, and send a gravely wrong signal to 'Taiwan independence' separatist forces. We are strongly dissatisfied with and firmly opposed to this, and have lodged solemn representations with the U.S. side.
statements.topic: Taiwan, US arms sales, US-China relations

statements.speaker: Ministry of National Defense
statements.context: Official statement through spokesperson Zhang Xiaogang regarding US arms sales to Taiwan
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Any attempt to aid 'Taiwan independence' with military means will only invite trouble upon oneself, and the scheme to 'use Taiwan to contain China' is doomed to fail. We urge the U.S. side to immediately stop its wrongful actions of arming Taiwan so as to avoid harming the development of the relations between the two countries and the two militaries.
statements.topic: Taiwan, US arms sales, US-China relations

statements.speaker: Ministry of National Defense
statements.context: Official statement through spokesperson Zhang Xiaogang regarding Taiwan authorities
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: We warn the Democratic Progressive Party authorities that squandering the hard-earned money of people in Taiwan to purchase weapons is nothing but a dead end, and that any attempt to seek independence by relying on external forces or resist reunification with arms is destined to fail.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.speaker_title: State Councilor and Minister of Foreign Affairs
statements.context: Meeting with Syrian Minister of Foreign Affairs Asaad Hassan al-Shibani in Beijing; official readout
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China appreciates Syria's commitment to upholding the one-China principle, and hopes that Syria will continue to staunchly support the Chinese people's just cause of opposing 'Taiwan independence' separatism and striving for national reunification, so as to jointly safeguard the political foundation of bilateral relations.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.speaker_title: State Councilor and Minister of Foreign Affairs
statements.context: Meeting with Syrian Minister of Foreign Affairs Asaad Hassan al-Shibani in Beijing; official readout
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The Eastern Turkistan Islamic Movement is designated by the United Nations Security Council as an international terrorist organization. Syria has pledged not to allow any entity to use Syrian territory to undermine China's interests. China appreciates this promise and hopes that Syria will take effective measures to implement it, so as to remove security obstacles to the sound and steady development of China-Syria relations.

statements.speaker: He Lifeng
statements.speaker_title: Vice Premier of the State Council
statements.context: Co-chairing the fourth China-Germany High-Level Financial Dialogue with German Vice Chancellor and Federal Minister of Finance Lars Klingbeil in Beijing; reported by Xinhua
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China is willing to work with Germany to implement the important consensus reached by the leaders of the two countries, and to make new contributions to the stability and growth of the global economy.

article_title: Zhang Youxia Outlines Roadmap for Military Modernisation during 15th FYP period

statements.speaker: Zhang Youxia
statements.context: Article in People's Daily following Fourth Plenum
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: We must resolutely oppose hegemonism and power politics, resolutely defend international fairness and justice, actively fulfill our responsibilities and obligations commensurate with our international status, and contribute to building a community with a shared future for mankind. We must always remain a steadfast force for maintaining world peace.
statements.framing: assertive opposition to perceived threats to international order

statements.speaker: Zhang Youxia
statements.context: Article in People's Daily following Fourth Plenum
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: It is necessary to adhere to self-reliance and controllability, seize upon high-level scientific and technological self-reliance and self-strengthening, vigorously promote independent innovation and original innovation, and properly resolve the 'chokepoint' problems of key technologies.

statements.speaker: Zhang Youxia
statements.context: Article in People's Daily following Fourth Plenum
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Research and build more 'assassin's mace' type weapons and equipment that can restrain the powerful and overcome the powerful.

article_title: Fujian Aircraft Carrier Enters Service - EV Charging Facilities Goal for 2027 - Wang Yi's Call with Yvette Cooper - Li Shulei Outlines China's Vision for Cultural & Discourse Power

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Briefing on Hainan Free Trade Port construction in Sanya
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The strategic goal of building the Hainan FTP is to make it an important gateway leading China's opening-up in the new era. It is necessary to remain steadfast in this strategic goal, expand institutional opening-up, improve trade and investment liberalization and facilitation, deepen opening-up of commodity and factor flows, build a more open talent mechanism, and create a first-class business environment that is market-oriented, law-based, and internationalized.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Briefing on Hainan Free Trade Port construction in Sanya
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The greater the opening up, the more important it is to coordinate development and security, and firmly safeguard the bottom line of security. The pace and progress of opening up should be scientific and orderly, risk identification and prevention should be strengthened, and advance steadily and surely.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.speaker_title: Foreign Minister (implied from context of call with British Foreign Secretary)
statements.context: Phone call with British Foreign Secretary Yvette Cooper
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The current international situation is intertwined with turbulence and transformation, and China–UK relations, if they do not advance, will retreat. Both sides should strengthen strategic communication, and promote the sustainable development of bilateral relations along a healthy, mutually beneficial, and stable track. China firmly upholds the purposes and principles of the UN Charter, safeguards the leading role of the UN in the international system, respects the sovereignty and territorial integrity of all countries, advocates resolving disputes through peaceful means, supports global free trade and WTO rules, and ensures the stability of global production and supply chains.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Phone call with British Foreign Secretary Yvette Cooper
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China and the UK are both major countries and permanent members of the UN Security Council, and bear important international responsibilities for world peace, stability, and development. On major international issues, China and the UK have broadly consistent positions, which constitutes an important connotation of deepening the strategic cooperative relationship between the two countries. China is willing to work together with the British side, join hands to address global challenges, and promote world peace and development.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Phone call with British Foreign Secretary Yvette Cooper
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China and the UK have different histories and cultures, and it is normal for differences to exist between the two sides. However, they should, on the basis of mutual respect, strive to enhance mutual understanding, providing a solid guarantee for the stability of bilateral relations. Regarding occasional discordant voices and interference, it is especially important to maintain a clear head, handle them actively and prudently, and maintain the main theme of the development of bilateral relations.

statements.speaker: Ding Xuexiang
statements.speaker_title: Vice Premier (implied from context of high-level visit to Brazil)
statements.context: Visit to Brazil, meeting with President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China's readiness to work with Brazil to strengthen political mutual trust, firmly support each other on issues concerning their respective core interests and major concerns, and jointly oppose unilateralism, protectionism and hegemonism. China is firmly committed to promoting high-quality development and higher-level opening up, which will create more opportunities for deepening practical cooperation between China and Brazil. China stands ready to expand practical cooperation across various fields and upgrade cooperation so as to achieve more landmark and exemplary outcomes.

statements.speaker: Ding Xuexiang
statements.context: Visit to Brazil, meeting with President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Under the strategic guidance of Xi and Lula, the building of a China-Brazil community with a shared future and the alignment of the two countries' development strategies have got off to a good start. China-Brazil cooperation has become a model for collaboration between major developing countries, with its strategic, comprehensive and long-term significance increasingly evident.

statements.speaker: Ding Xuexiang
statements.context: Visit to Brazil, meeting with President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China calls on the two sides to strengthen coordination and collaboration in multilateral arenas, advance the reform and improvement of global governance, and safeguard the interests of the developing countries. China will enhance cooperation on poverty reduction and implement the Global Development Initiative to deliver more benefits to both peoples and the people of the world. China supports Brazil in playing its active role as a major country in the region, safeguarding peace and stability in Latin America and the Caribbean.

statements.speaker: Zhang Guoqing
statements.context: 2025 BRI Ministers' Meeting on Natural Disaster Prevention and Emergency Management in Sanya
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Through practical measures such as dispatching international rescue teams and providing disaster relief material assistance, China has contributed its strength to international cooperation in natural disaster prevention and control. China is willing to work with all parties to actively implement the Global Development Initiative, Global Security Initiative, Global Civilization Initiative, and Global Governance Initiative, continuously promote the building of relevant cooperation mechanisms, join hands in deepening disaster prevention capabilities, strengthen technological empowerment for disaster reduction, and enhance international responses to major disasters.

article_title: Li Qiang: Economic Development Remains China's 'Central Task' - Invoking Zou Taofen’s 'Patriotic Spirit' for Journalists - Wang Jiang on Financial Sector Policy Direction

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Congratulatory message to Fijian President on 50th anniversary of diplomatic relations, reported by Xinhua in People's Daily
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China and Fiji have always respected each other, treated each other as equals and pursued win-win cooperation. China attaches great importance to the development of China-Fiji relations and stands ready to strengthen political mutual trust, expand cooperation across various fields, and elevate the China-Fiji comprehensive strategic partnership to a higher level.

statements.speaker: Ding Xuexiang
statements.context: Meeting with Uruguayan President Yamandu Orsi and Vice President Carolina Cosse during visit to Uruguay
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China is willing to work with Uruguay under the strategic guidance of the two heads of state to continue the traditional friendship, continuously enrich the connotation of the China-Uruguay comprehensive strategic partnership, and make greater contributions to world peace and development.

statements.speaker: Ding Xuexiang
statements.context: Meeting with Uruguayan Vice President Carolina Cosse
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China appreciates Uruguay's long-term, firm adherence to the one-China principle and believes that both sides will continue to firmly support each other on issues concerning their respective core interests and major concerns.

statements.speaker: Ding Xuexiang
statements.context: Meeting with Uruguayan Vice President Carolina Cosse
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China has always viewed its relations with Latin American and Caribbean countries from a strategic height and a long-term perspective. China stands ready to work with Uruguay and other Latin American countries to implement five programs ranging from solidarity, development and civilization to peace and people-to-people connectivity, and jointly build a China-Latin America community with a shared future.

statements.speaker: Li Qiang
statements.context: Remarks at opening of China International Import Expo (CIIE)
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The reason the CIIE has been increasingly successful is because it adheres to the principle of 'seeking shared benefits with the world'. In contrast, some unilateralist and protectionist actions in the international arena are severely impacting the international economic and trade order and disrupting the global economy.

statements.speaker: Li Qiang
statements.context: Remarks at opening of China International Import Expo (CIIE)
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: We must adhere to equal and mutually beneficial cooperation, embrace free trade, and promote the resolution of contradictions and problems through joint development. We should balance righteousness and interests, work together, and help each other. China is willing to work with all parties to actively promote the implementation of the Global Governance Initiative in the international economic and trade field and reform and improve the multilateral trading system with the WTO at its core.

statements.speaker: Li Qiang
statements.context: Remarks at opening of China International Import Expo (CIIE)
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China will adhere to taking economic development as its central task and focus its efforts on advancing high-quality development. China will make new and important contributions to global economic growth. China will unswervingly promote high-level opening-up and steadily expand institutional opening-up.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Phone call with Iranian Foreign Minister Seyed Abbas Araghchi, reported by Xinhua
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China attaches great importance to the development of China-Iran relations. Chinese President Xi Jinping and Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian reached important consensus on and provided strategic guidance for deepening bilateral ties. China is readiness to work with Iran to implement the consensus reached between the two heads of state, seek development and rejuvenation of the two countries and deepen their mutually beneficial cooperation.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Phone call with Iranian Foreign Minister Seyed Abbas Araghchi, reported by Xinhua
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China appreciates Iran's active support for the four major global initiatives proposed by Xi, and is willing to work with Iran and the rest of the international community to make positive contributions to building a more just and equitable global governance system.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Phone call with Iranian Foreign Minister Seyed Abbas Araghchi, reported by Xinhua
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China has always maintained an objective and impartial position on the Iranian nuclear issue. The current political settlement process has reached a deadlock, which is not in the common interests of the international community. China hopes that all parties will maintain dialogue and communication to bring the Iranian nuclear issue back to the track of dialogue and negotiation.

statements.speaker: Dong Jun
statements.context: Meeting with Serbian Defense Minister Bratislav Gasic, reported by Xinhua
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China and Serbia are iron-clad friends who have stood together through thick and thin. China is ready to work with Serbia to implement the important consensus reached between the two heads of state on building a community with a shared future for the new era.

statements.speaker: Ministry of Commerce
statements.context: Official statement on easing tariff measures against the US, reported by Xinhua
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: To implement the consensus of the China-U.S. Kuala Lumpur economic and trade talks, China has decided that related measures against 15 U.S. entities will be lifted on Nov. 10, 2025, while related measures against 16 U.S. entities will remain in suspension for one year.

statements.speaker: Customs Tariff Commission of the State Council
statements.context: Official announcement on suspension of tariff measures against the US
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China will continue to suspend the 24-percent additional tariff on imports from the United States for one year while retaining the 10-percent rate. The move aims to implement the outcomes and consensus reached in the China-U.S. economic and trade talks. The continued suspension of certain additional tariffs will help promote the sound, stable and sustainable development of bilateral economic and trade relations, bring benefits to the people of both countries, and contribute to global prosperity.

statements.speaker: Customs Tariff Commission of the State Council
statements.context: Official announcement on termination of tariff measures against the US
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China will terminate the additional tariff measures on certain imports originating from the United States including chicken, wheat, corn, cotton, sorghum, soybeans, pork, beef, aquatic products, fruits, vegetables and dairy products. The termination serves the fundamental interests of both countries and their people, meets expectations of the international community, and will help advance bilateral economic and trade relations to a higher level.

article_title: Xi Meets Russian PM - Li Meets PMs of Georgia & Serbia - Wang Yi's Article on China post-Fourth Plenum Approach to Foreign Affairs

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Meeting with Russian Prime Minister Mikhail Mishustin, reported in People's Daily
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China-Russia relations have navigated a turbulent external environment with composure, aiming for higher-level development. Both sides should maintain close coordination, expand cooperation in traditional areas like energy and aerospace, explore new business models in AI and digital economy, and strengthen people-to-people exchanges.

statements.speaker: Zhao Leji
statements.speaker_title: Chairman of the National People's Congress Standing Committee
statements.context: Meeting with participants of Seminar for Representatives from Pacific Island Countries in Beijing, reported in Xinhua
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China has always been a trustworthy friend and reliable partner to Pacific island countries. China is willing to enhance political mutual trust, expand cooperation, strengthen alignment of Belt and Road Initiative and 2050 Strategy for Blue Pacific Continent, and implement four major global initiatives.

statements.speaker: Li Qiang
statements.context: Meeting with Serbian Prime Minister Djuro Macut in Shanghai, reported in Xinhua
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Under strategic guidance of two heads of state, China-Serbia relations have maintained steady development. China is willing to provide firm mutual support for each other's core interests, promote in-depth cooperation, enhance alignment with Serbia's development plan, and explore cooperation in sci-tech innovation, green economy, biomedicine and artificial intelligence.

statements.speaker: Li Qiang
statements.context: Meeting with Speaker of the House of Representatives of Nigeria Abbas Tajudeen, reported in Xinhua
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China and Nigeria are good brothers and partners. China is ready to join hands with Nigeria on the path of advancing modernisation, enhance synergy of development strategies, expand comprehensive cooperation in trade, investment, agriculture, mining, infrastructure, and emerging industries like clean energy and artificial intelligence.

statements.speaker: Li Qiang
statements.context: Meeting with Georgian Prime Minister Irakli Kobakhidze, reported in Xinhua
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China and Georgia have always respected and understood each other and firmly supported each other's core interests. China is willing to be a true friend and good partner, strengthen strategic communication, expand practical cooperation, strengthen alignment of development strategies, promote high-quality Belt and Road cooperation, deepen cooperation in trade, investment, connectivity, digital economy, new energy and artificial intelligence.

statements.speaker: Han Zheng
statements.speaker_title: Vice Chairman of the National Committee of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference (former State Councilor)
statements.context: Speech at Second World Summit for Social Development in Qatar, reported in People's Daily
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: President Xi's concept of building a community with a shared future for mankind and four global initiatives have pointed the way for global social development. China will promote high-quality development in next five years, ensuring fruits benefit all people more equitably, injecting positive energy into global development. Advocated four suggestions: people-centered approach, focus on common development goals, principle of inclusiveness and equitable access, and spirit of solidarity and cooperation.
statements.topic: global development, social development, international cooperation

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with Estonian Foreign Minister Margus Tsahkna, reported in Xinhua
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Building a mature, stable, mutually respectful, and win-win China-Estonia relationship aligns with shared interests of both countries. China has always followed principle of equality between major and minor countries. No major unresolved issues or fundamental conflicts exist between the two countries. China will further advance deep reforms, high-level opening-up, and innovation-driven development, creating opportunities for other countries' development. Regarding Taiwan issue: Taiwan is an inseparable part of China's territory. Urged Estonia to understand and support China's legitimate position fully and uphold one-China policy through concrete actions.
statements.tone: cooperative with assertive tone on sovereignty

statements.speaker: He Lifeng
statements.speaker_title: Director of the National Development and Reform Commission
statements.context: Meeting with David Solomon, Chairman and CEO of Goldman Sachs Group, reported in Xinhua
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The heads of state of China and the United States recently held a successful meeting in Busan, Republic of Korea, charting the course for the next phase of bilateral economic and trade relations. The two sides should work together to act on important common understandings reached by the two heads of state, which will provide greater predictability for businesses from both countries and promote steady, sound and sustainable development of China-U.S. trade and economic relations, contributing to global economic stability. China welcomes Goldman Sachs Group to continue investment and business operations in China.
statements.topic: US-China relations, economic and trade relations

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Article on spirit of Fourth Plenum published in People's Daily, Page 6
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Building a community with a shared future for mankind is a major original concept and core idea of Xi Jinping Thought on Diplomacy. It follows laws of human society development, conforms to trend of peaceful development, embodies original aspiration and mission of Communist Party of China, and has garnered broad international consensus. China should advocate for equal and orderly world multipolarity and universally beneficial inclusive economic globalisation. Must deepen integration of development with periphery, maintain overall stability in major-country relations, deepen solidarity with developing countries, implement four global initiatives, and promote building of five worlds (lasting peace, universal security, common prosperity, openness and inclusiveness, cleanliness and beauty).
statements.topic: diplomacy, global development, international order, China's foreign policy

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Article on spirit of Fourth Plenum published in People's Daily, Page 6
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: On major-country relations: China has deepened China-Russia comprehensive strategic partnership of coordination for new era, forging new path for major countries through mutual respect and win-win cooperation. Based on principles of mutual respect, peaceful coexistence, and win-win cooperation, China has eliminated interference, overcome obstacles, and strived for healthy, stable, and sustainable development of China-US relations. China has promoted China-Europe comprehensive strategic partnership with global influence. Positive interaction among major countries helps maintain global strategic stability.
statements.topic: major-country relations, China-US relations, China-Russia relations, China-Europe relations

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Article on spirit of Fourth Plenum published in People's Daily, Page 6 - section on struggle
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: We must maintain strategic resolve, strengthen confidence in certain victory, actively identify and respond to changes, courageously face major tests amid high winds and turbulent waves or even tempestuous storms, and through tenacious struggle open up new horizons. We must enhance awareness of potential dangers, establish bottom-line thinking, with a combat-ready posture of an arrow on the bowstring and firm will that fears no powerful forces, resolutely safeguard our country's sovereignty, security, and development interests. We must strengthen ability to struggle, use multilateral mechanisms and rules, take clear stand in opposing hegemonic, domineering, and bullying conduct.
statements.topic: strategic competition, struggle, national interests, international order

article_title: China-Russia Dialogue - Ding Xuexiang's post-Fourth Plenum Assessment - Xi's ROK visit Showcased 'Major Country Responsibility' - Wang-Wadephul Call - Beijing Hosts 15th World Socialism Forum

statements.speaker: Li Qiang
statements.context: 30th regular meeting of Chinese and Russian heads of government in Hangzhou
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: President Xi Jinping and President Putin have met twice this year, guiding China-Russia relations forward at a high level. China is willing to work with Russia to use the important consensus reached between their two heads of state as a fundamental guideline, strengthen strategic communication, deepen cooperation in various fields, and safeguard common development and security interests.

statements.speaker: Ding Xuexiang
statements.context: Article in People's Daily on 15th Five-Year Plan
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: During the 15th FYP period, China's development environment will face profound and complex changes, with strategic opportunities and risks coexisting and uncertainties and unpredictable factors increasing. We must concentrate our efforts on managing our own affairs well, gain strategic initiative in fierce international competition, and forge ahead bravely towards the goal of basically realising socialist modernisation.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Phone call with German Foreign Minister Johann Wadephul
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The Taiwan question is China's internal affair and concerns China's core interests, sovereignty and territorial integrity. The one-China principle is the most important political foundation of China-Germany relations. China has given its unconditional support to Germany's reunification and hopes that Germany, having experienced the pain of division itself, can fully understand and support China's efforts to safeguard national sovereignty and territorial integrity, and oppose all forms of 'Taiwan independence'.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Phone call with German Foreign Minister Johann Wadephul
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The important experience drawn from the development of China-Germany relations is that both respect each other, the guiding principle should be win-win cooperation and the proper positioning of bilateral ties is partnership. Given the differences in history, culture, and social systems between China and Germany, divergences are inevitable. The two sides should maintain communication and dialogue, enhance mutual understanding, dispel misunderstandings and strengthen mutual trust, while avoiding 'microphone diplomacy' and unfounded accusations that run counter to facts.

statements.speaker: Zhao Leji
statements.speaker_title: Chairman of the National People's Congress
statements.context: Meeting with Marko Lotric, president of the National Council of Slovenia
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China-Slovenia relations are on a steady, healthy development track, with close exchange at all levels. China is willing to work with Slovenia to continue on as trustworthy friends and partners, and to deepen mutual political trust and pragmatic cooperation to bring bilateral relations to a higher level.

statements.speaker: Wang Huning
statements.context: Meeting with Marko Lotric, president of the National Council of Slovenia
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Under the strategic guidance of their two heads of state, China and Slovenia have held frequent exchanges and dialogues at all levels and in various fields since the beginning of this year, effectively enhancing mutual understanding and trust. China appreciates Slovenia's adherence to the one-China principle and is willing to work with Slovenia to enhance exchange across the board.

statements.speaker: People's Daily (Héyīn commentary)
statements.context: Commentary article on Xi Jinping's visit to South Korea
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Major-country responsibility is embodied in steering the development of China–US relations. As one of the most important bilateral relationships in the world, stable, healthy, and sustainable development of China–US relations is the aspiration of the peoples of both countries and the expectation of all countries in the world. President Xi Jinping and President Trump met again after six years, engaging in in-depth communication on major issues concerning bilateral relations and world peace and development, reaching a series of important consensus. China and the United States can absolutely achieve mutual success and common prosperity. The two countries can be partners and friends; this is a lesson from history and a necessity of reality.

statements.speaker: Zhang Youxia
statements.speaker_title: Vice Chairman of Central Military Commission
statements.context: Military meeting at Bayi Building in Beijing on studying Fourth Plenum spirit
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Studying, publicising, and implementing the spirit of the plenary session should be taken as a major political task. It is necessary to deeply and thoroughly explain the spirit in close connection with the practice of building a strong military, focusing on consolidating political advantages and implementing strategic tasks, ensuring the timely achievement of the centenary goal of the military and the high-quality advancement of national defense and military modernisation.

article_title: Cai Qi: Party's Strict & Comprehensive Governance of 'Utmost Importance' for 15th FYP Period - Wang Yi on Gains from Xi's South Korea Visit - Jan-Sept. FDI Tumbles 10.4%

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.speaker_title: State Councilor and Minister of Foreign Affairs
statements.context: People's Daily article summarizing Xi Jinping's visit to South Korea
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Faced with the countercurrent of protectionism, China promotes common prosperity through inclusiveness and upholds fairness and justice with a sense of responsibility. Its influence and shaping power over the international order and Asia-Pacific regional cooperation are increasing by the day.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.speaker_title: State Councilor and Minister of Foreign Affairs
statements.context: People's Daily article on APEC summit
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China will vigorously promote the Asia-Pacific Free Trade Area, expand practical cooperation in connectivity, the digital economy, and artificial intelligence, inject greater vitality and impetus into Asia-Pacific development, and better benefit the people of the Asia-Pacific region.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.speaker_title: State Councilor and Minister of Foreign Affairs
statements.context: People's Daily article on China-US relations
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Head-of-state diplomacy has always been the cornerstone of China-US relations. Since the beginning of this year, President Xi Jinping and President Trump have spoken three times, reaching a series of important consensus, pointing the way and setting the tone for stabilizing and improving China-US relations.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Busan meeting with President Trump, reported in People's Daily
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China and the US can absolutely achieve mutual success and common prosperity. Being partners and friends is a lesson from history and a necessity of reality.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Busan meeting with President Trump, reported in People's Daily
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Facing winds and waves and challenges, the two heads of state, as helmsmen, should maintain the right direction and steer the overall course, so that the great ship of China–US relations can move forward smoothly.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Busan meeting with President Trump, reported in People's Daily
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Trade and economic cooperation should continue to be the ballast (anchor) and engine (driving force) of China-US relations, not a stumbling block or point of friction. Both sides should think big and recognize the long-term benefit of cooperation, and must not fall into a vicious cycle of mutual retaliation. They should continue to negotiate based on the principles of equality, respect, and mutual benefit, continuously reducing the list of problems and expanding the list of cooperation.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Busan meeting with President Trump, reported in People's Daily
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China and the US should also interact positively on the international and regional stage. The world today faces many challenges, and China and the US can jointly demonstrate their responsibility as major powers and work together to accomplish more significant, practical, and beneficial things for both countries and the world. Next year, China will host APEC, and the US will host the G20 summit. Both sides should support each other and strive for positive outcomes at both summits.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.speaker_title: State Councilor and Minister of Foreign Affairs
statements.context: People's Daily article on China-US relations
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The Busan meeting between the Chinese and US leaders was a historic moment in US-China relations and a landmark event in international relations. This year, US-China relations have experienced ups and downs, but China's policy towards the US has maintained continuity and stability, consistently adhering to the three principles of mutual respect, peaceful coexistence, and win-win cooperation.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.speaker_title: State Councilor and Minister of Foreign Affairs
statements.context: People's Daily article on China-US relations
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: At this Busan meeting, President Xi Jinping, with foresight and personal involvement, once again guided the ship of US-China relations through turbulent waters, demonstrating the confidence, composure, and sense of responsibility of a leader of a major power. Facts have proven that dialogue is better than confrontation, zero-sum games lead nowhere, and win-win cooperation is the right path.

statements.speaker: Han Zheng
statements.context: Visit to Kuwait, reported by Xinhua
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China is ready to work with Kuwait to deepen political mutual trust, implement the bilateral cooperation documents signed in the presence of the two heads of state, and strive for substantive progress at an early date, so as to achieve in-depth and solid development of the China-Kuwait strategic partnership.

statements.speaker: Dong Jun
statements.context: ASEAN Defence Ministers' Meeting Plus platform, reported in People's Daily
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China and ASEAN are neighbours living side by side. China most hopes to see peace and tranquility in the region and has played an important role toward that end. We firmly support ASEAN's central role in the regional architecture and are willing to work with regional countries to actively assume responsibility for maintaining regional peace, bridge differences through dialogue and consultation, enhance the level of openness and cooperation, and firmly act as a predictable stabilising force.
statements.topic: regional security, diplomacy, peace and stability

statements.speaker: He Lifeng
statements.context: 29th session of committee for regular meetings between Chinese and Russian heads of government, reported by Xinhua
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China is willing to work with Russia to follow the important consensus reached between the two heads of state, continue giving play to the role of the committee for regular meetings between the Chinese and Russian heads of government, promote bilateral mutually beneficial cooperation further in various fields, oppose unilateralism and trade protectionism, and safeguard the multilateral trade system.
statements.topic: trade, US policy (protectionism), multilateralism, Russia relations

article_title: US Factsheet Outlines China’s Pledges as Part of Trump-Xi Deal - Xi's APEC Agenda - China-ROK Agreements - Xi-Takaichi Sanae Meeting

statements.speaker: Ministry of Commerce
statements.context: Official statement on US-China trade deal following Trump-Xi meeting
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The U.S. will cancel 10% fentanyl tariffs and suspend 24% reciprocal tariffs for one year. China will make corresponding adjustments to countermeasures. Both sides agreed to continue extending tariff exclusion measures. The U.S. will suspend new entity-list export restrictions for one year, and China will suspend relevant export control measures for one year. The U.S. will suspend Section 301 measures targeting maritime, logistics and shipbuilding industries for one year, and China will correspondingly suspend countermeasures. Both sides reached consensus on fentanyl cooperation, agricultural trade expansion, and enterprise case handling.

statements.speaker: Dong Jun
statements.context: Meeting with US Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The defense departments of both countries should take concrete actions to implement the consensus reached by the two heads of state, and work toward building a military-to-military relationship based on equality and respect, peaceful coexistence, and stable, positive development. Expressed hope that the U.S. will honor its commitment not to seek to contain China and pursue conflict, take a clear stance against Taiwan independence, and work with China to inject positive energy into regional and global peace and security.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Speech at APEC CEOs summit
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The world faces a choice between solidarity, cooperation and mutual benefit versus hegemonism and the law of the jungle; multilateralism, openness and inclusiveness versus unilateralism and protectionism. Hegemonism causes only war and disaster. Confrontation breeds estrangement; win-win cooperation is the right way. Unilateralism causes division; multilateralism is viable for tackling global challenges. China rejects assertions that strong countries inevitably seek hegemony, denounces winner-takes-all practices, and opposes power politics. China has proposed Belt and Road Initiative and Global Development, Security, Civilization, and Governance Initiatives as solutions based on Chinese wisdom.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Speech at APEC CEOs summit on economic development
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China provides fertile soil for global investors. China is an ideal, safe and promising destination for investors. Only 29 items remain on China's negative list for foreign investment, zero in manufacturing. China is fostering market-oriented, law-based business environment. China is universally recognized as one of the safest countries. China grants visa exemptions to 76 countries. China is developing AI, quantum technologies, humanoids, new-energy vehicles, and biomedicine. Whoever establishes presence in Chinese market will stay ahead in international competition.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Speech at APEC CEOs summit on environmental commitments
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China has the largest renewable energy system and biggest new energy industrial chain. Afforestation in China accounts for quarter of world total. Committed to meeting carbon peaking and neutrality targets. Supporting free flow of quality green technologies and products and providing assistance to developing countries.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Speech at first session of APEC leaders meeting
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Must practice true multilateralism and enhance WTO authority. Should stick to WTO reform direction, uphold MFN and nondiscrimination principles, and update rules to protect developing countries' interests. Should promote trade and investment liberalization, deepen fiscal and financial cooperation, and push regional economic integration. RCEP and CPTPP should align and progress together. Should keep supply chains stable and support open development. Should advance digital and green transformation of trade and expand cooperation in green industries and clean energy. Should adhere to people-centered development and foster inclusive, sustainable economic globalization.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Speech at second session of APEC leaders meeting
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Should harness new technologies, seize opportunities of digital, smart and green development, and nurture new quality productive forces. Should spark data into life as basic resource and engine for innovation, promote safe and orderly data flow, and accelerate digital economy development. Should deepen cooperation on open source technologies and build open, competitive innovation ecosystem. AI should contribute to well-being of all countries while being beneficial, safe and fair. China proposed World Artificial Intelligence Cooperation Organization to provide public goods on AI. China ready to work with APEC members to enhance AI literacy and bridge digital and AI divide.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Speech at second session of APEC leaders meeting on climate and sustainability
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Should stay committed to green and low-carbon development and build sustainable development paradigm. Should enhance synergy between green development strategies, promote free flows of quality green technologies, accelerate green and low-carbon transition, and tackle climate change. Should ensure true fulfillment of common but differentiated responsibilities and urge developed economies to provide necessary support to developing economies. Since announcing carbon peaking and neutrality goals, China established world's largest renewable energy system. China submitted 2035 Nationally Determined Contributions and will implement dual control over carbon emissions. China funded APEC Support Fund sub-fund on digitalization for green transitions.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Speech at second session of APEC leaders meeting on sustainable development
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Should always put people first and strengthen policy communication and cooperation to implement UN 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development, eliminate poverty, and promote shared prosperity. Should leverage APEC's traditional strength in economic and technical cooperation and encourage Asia Pacific economies to pilot WTO Agreement on Electronic Commerce. Should deepen cooperation in SMEs, human resources, food security, energy transition, and health to facilitate balanced growth in developing economies.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Bilateral meeting with South Korean President Lee Jae Myung
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China and ROK are important close neighbors that cannot be moved away and cooperation partners that cannot be separated. Since establishing diplomatic relations 33 years ago, the two countries have transcended differences in social systems and ideologies and achieved mutual success and common prosperity. Promoting sound and steady development of China-ROK relations serves fundamental interests of both peoples and conforms to trend of times. China values relations with ROK and maintains continuity and stability in ROK policy. China stands ready to work with ROK to enhance communication, deepen cooperation, expand common interests, meet challenges together, and inject positive energy into regional peace and development.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Bilateral meeting with South Korean President - strategic points
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: First, strengthen strategic communication and consolidate foundation of mutual trust through long-term perspective, mutual respect, and win-win cooperation while seeking common ground and shelving differences. Second, deepen mutually beneficial cooperation and tighten bonds of interests by speeding up second phase of China-ROK FTA negotiations and tapping cooperation potential in AI, biomedicine, green industries and silver economy. Strengthen cooperation on combating online gambling and telecom fraud. Third, strengthen friendship between peoples through media communication, cultural exchanges, cross-border travel facilitation, and youth, media and think tank exchanges. Fourth, enhance coordination in multilateral fora to jointly promote peace and development, practice true multilateralism, uphold multilateral trading system, and make global governance more just and equitable.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Bilateral meeting with Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China and Japan are separated by only a strip of water and are important neighbors. Sustained, sound and steady development of China-Japan relations meets expectations of both peoples and international community. China will work with Japan to uphold principles in four China-Japan political documents, maintain political foundation of bilateral relations, move strategic relationship of mutual benefit forward, and build constructive and stable China-Japan relationship fit for new era. China-Japan relationship currently faces both opportunities and challenges. China hopes new cabinet will establish correct perception of China, honor dedication of older generations of leaders, and stay committed to general direction of peace, friendship and cooperation.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Bilateral meeting with Japanese Prime Minister - specific points
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: First, two countries should truly honor important common understandings and take concrete actions to implement political consensus to 'promote strategic relationship of mutual benefit' as 'partners, not threats' and 'learn lessons from history and look ahead.' Clear provisions in four political documents on history and Taiwan must be strictly followed. Second, stay committed to win-win cooperation with significant potential in advanced manufacturing, digital economy, green development, fiscal policies, finance, medical and elderly care services, and third-party markets. Third, foster greater people-to-people ties through continued government, political party and legislature communication and expanded people-to-people and subnational exchanges. Fourth, enhance coordination in multilateral affairs upholding good neighborliness, equality, mutual benefit, and non-interference. Fifth, properly handle differences by focusing on big picture, seeking common ground while reserving differences, and ensuring relationship is not defined by problems.

statements.speaker: Xinhua
statements.context: Report on China's response to Japanese PM's Taiwan-related comments during APEC
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China expressed firm opposition and made serious démarches and protests to Japan over Japanese leader's wrongful comment and action concerning Taiwan. PM Takaichi posted on social media photos and comments about meeting with personnel of authorities of China's Taiwan region, referring to person as 'Senior Advisor to the Presidential Office of Taiwan.' This sent gravely wrong signal to Taiwan independence forces. Those actions are egregious in nature and impact.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Bilateral meeting with Canadian official Mark Carney
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: This year marks 55th anniversary of China-Canada diplomatic relations and 20th anniversary of China-Canada strategic partnership. Through joint efforts, China-Canada relationship is beginning to recover and improve, which is in line with common interests of both countries. China attaches importance to Canadian side's stated desire to improve bilateral relations in pragmatic and constructive manner. Meeting provides opportunity for bringing bilateral relations back to right track of sound, stable and sustainable development. China and Canada should develop objective and rational perception of one another and advance bilateral relations in light of common and long-term interests. Two sides should uphold mutual benefit and expand practical cooperation in economy, trade, and energy. Should increase people-to-people and cultural exchanges and strengthen coordination in UN and multilateral frameworks to bring about more just and equitable global governance system and uphold international fairness and justice.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Bilateral meeting with Thai Prime Minister Anutin Charnvirakul
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China stands ready to synergize development strategies with Thailand and share development experience. Two sides should accelerate China-Thailand Railway construction, enhance cooperation in agricultural trade, green economy, digital innovation. Two sides should deepen people-to-people exchanges in tourism and youth and at subnational levels, and hold successful activities for 50th anniversary of diplomatic ties. Should step up fight against transnational crimes such as online gambling and telecom fraud to create safe environment for bilateral exchanges. Facing transforming and turbulent world, China ready to work with Thailand on implementation of Global Governance Initiative, uphold international fairness and justice, and safeguard common interests of Global South.

article_title: Xi's Explanation & Recommendations for 15th FYP - Wang Yi Speaks to Japan's Motegi - China & ASEAN Upgrade FTA - NPCSC Revises Maritime Law & Cybersecurity Law

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Explanation of 15th Five-Year Plan Proposal document released by People's Daily
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Over the next five years, China will see a notable rise in uncertainties and unforeseen factors, which will make the task of ensuring both development and security much harder. Unilateralism and protectionism are on the rise, and hegemonism and power politics pose greater threats.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Explanation of 15th Five-Year Plan Proposal document
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: At present and for some time to come, we must work to strengthen the domestic economy and boost domestic economic flows, so as to leverage the stability of the domestic economy as a hedge against uncertainties in the international economy.

statements.speaker: CPC Central Committee
statements.context: 15th Five-Year Plan Proposal document (fourth plenum)
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Relations between major countries have an important bearing on the international landscape...Meanwhile, the changes we see in the world are intertwined with disturbances, turmoil continues to mount, and geopolitical conflicts flare up all too easily and frequently. Unilateralism and protectionism are on the rise, and hegemonism and power politics pose greater threats. The international economic and trade order is facing grave challenges, and global economic growth lacks steam. Major-country rivalry is becoming more intricate and intense than ever.

statements.speaker: Li Qiang
statements.context: 28th China-ASEAN Summit remarks
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Unilateralism and protectionism are buffeting the international economic and trade order, external interference in our region is on the rise, and many countries are slapped with unwarranted high tariffs...In the face of power politics and economic bullying, we will gain nothing from disunity and confrontation, and will only end up divided and conquered by external forces.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Chat with Japanese Foreign Minister Toshimitsu Motegi
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China has maintained consistency and stability in its policies toward Japan, and is willing to work with the country to continue observing the principles and following the direction set in the four political documents between the two nations...The historical and Taiwan issues concern the foundation of the bilateral relationship and the basic trust between the two sides. It is hoped that Japan will work with China to maintain the political foundation of China-Japan relations.

article_title: Unpacking Wang Yi's Speech on Global Governance at Lanting Forum

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Speech at the 23rd Lanting Forum in Beijing
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Unilateralism is resurfacing, and global challenges are emerging one after another. The international community must reform and improve global governance to better adapt to the arrival of a multipolar world.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Speech at the 23rd Lanting Forum in Beijing
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Xi's Global Governance Initiative is China's response to the challenge of our times, representing an innovation in understanding global governance and a transcendence of traditional international relations theory.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Speech at the 23rd Lanting Forum in Beijing
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: If one blindly worships strength and indulges in power politics and bullying, it will only push the world into a jungle of the strong preying on the weak, shaking the foundations of the international system and its rules.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Speech at the 23rd Lanting Forum in Beijing
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Countries must not use international rules when they serve them and abandon them when they do not; they must not willfully try to strangle the UN.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Speech at the 23rd Lanting Forum in Beijing
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: We call for an end to the politicization of economic and trade issues, an end to artificially splitting global markets, and an end to frequently provoking trade wars and tariff wars.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Speech at the 23rd Lanting Forum in Beijing
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China will adhere to equal consultation, treat different viewpoints with an open mind, absorb useful suggestions with an inclusive attitude, while adhering to upholding integrity and pursuing innovation rather than starting from scratch in reforming the international system.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Speech at the 23rd Lanting Forum in Beijing
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Frequently withdrawing from groups and breaking treaties, and being keen on weaving camp-based small circles, has caused multilateralism to suffer unprecedented challenges.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Speech at the 23rd Lanting Forum in Beijing
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: AI should benefit all of humanity, not become the exclusive domain of a few countries, let alone be maliciously abused.

article_title: Li's Singapore Visit - Zhong Sheng on China-US Talks - Xi's Concept of 'Political Ability' Goes beyond 'Western Competency Model' on Governance - Commentary on 4th 15th FYP's Tech Agenda

statements.speaker: Li Qiang
statements.context: Meeting with Singaporean Prime Minister Lawrence Wong in Singapore
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: At present, the multilateral trading system is suffering severe challenges. The Chinese side is willing to work together with the Singaporean side to implement the major global initiatives put forward by President Xi Jinping, strengthen communication and coordination within mechanisms such as the UN, oppose unilateralism and protectionism, safeguard free trade and economic globalization, and promote the development of the international order toward a more just and reasonable direction.

statements.speaker: Li Qiang
statements.context: Meeting with Singapore's Acting President Eddie Teo
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The world is entering a new period of turbulence and transformation. China stands ready to strengthen high-level exchanges and strategic communication with Singapore, support each other's core interests and major concerns, deepen political mutual trust, expand mutually beneficial cooperation, and promote the sustained and steady development of China-Singapore relations.

statements.speaker: Li Qiang
statements.context: China-Singapore business roundtable
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China will firmly promote high-level opening-up, further ease market access, continuously optimize business environment and actively address enterprises' reasonable concerns.

statements.speaker: He Lifeng
statements.context: Economic and trade talks with US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and USTR Jamieson Greer in Kuala Lumpur
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The essence of China-US economic and trade relations is mutual benefit and win-win results. Cooperation benefits both sides, while conflict hurts both. Maintaining the stable development of China-US economic and trade relations serves the fundamental interests of both countries and their peoples, and also meets the expectations of the international community. Regarding differences and frictions arising in economic and trade cooperation, both sides should adhere to the principles of mutual respect, peaceful coexistence, and win-win cooperation, and find ways to properly address each other's concerns through equal dialogue and consultation.

statements.speaker: He Lifeng
statements.context: Economic and trade talks with US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and USTR Jamieson Greer in Kuala Lumpur
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The hard-won outcomes of China-US economic and trade consultations require joint efforts to safeguard them. He expressed hope that the US and China would work together to implement the important consensus reached in previous phone calls between the two heads of state and the outcomes of all economic and trade consultations held this year, further build mutual trust, manage differences, expand mutually beneficial cooperation, and elevate bilateral economic and trade relations to a higher level.

statements.speaker: Pan Gongsheng
statements.context: Report to the 18th Session of the 14th NPCSC on financial work
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Implement and refine in detail the moderately loose monetary policy, creating a suitable monetary and financial environment for consolidating and expanding the momentum of economic recovery and improvement; further strengthen and perfect financial supervision, continuously enhancing supervision quality and effectiveness; highlight key directions of financial services for the real economy, focusing on providing high-quality financial services; continuously deepen supply-side structural reform of finance; advance high-level two-way opening of finance, safeguarding national financial security; prevent and resolve financial risks in key areas, holding fast to the bottom line of preventing systemic financial risks.

statements.speaker: People's Daily
statements.context: Zhong Sheng commentary on China-US trade talks
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The two sides engaged in candid, in-depth, and constructive discussions on a range of key economic and trade issues, reaching a basic consensus on arrangements to address their respective concerns. This hard-won achievement once again demonstrates that while it is normal for two major countries like China and the United States to have differences on economic and trade issues, by sitting down and engaging in equal-footed consultation and constructive approaches, they can properly address their differences and find a way to coexist.

statements.speaker: People's Daily
statements.context: Zhong Sheng commentary on China-US trade talks
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China and the US share long-standing interests and concerns on these issues, but neither side allowed them to obscure their focus. Instead, both adopted a problem-solving orientation, persisted in giving play to the role of the economic and trade consultation mechanism, and continued to carry out equal dialogue and consultation to create conditions for the ultimate resolution of issues.

statements.speaker: People's Daily
statements.context: Zhong Sheng commentary on China-US trade talks
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: For China and the US to properly handle differences and advance cooperation, the most important thing is to implement the important consensus reached by the two leaders. Since the beginning of this year, President Xi Jinping and President Trump have held several phone calls, setting the tone and charting the course for improving and developing China-US relations. It is precisely under the guidance of this important consensus reached by the two leaders that the economic and trade teams of the two countries have held five rounds of consultations and reached a positive consensus.

statements.speaker: People's Daily
statements.context: Zhong Sheng commentary on China-US trade talks
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: To ensure that the two giant ships of China and the US move forward together without deviation or loss of speed, we must unwaveringly adhere to the strategic guidance of the two leaders, uncompromisingly implement the important consensus reached by the two leaders, and unwaveringly uphold the three principles of mutual respect, peaceful coexistence, and win-win cooperation.

statements.speaker: People's Daily
statements.context: Zhong Sheng commentary on China-US trade talks
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The essence of China-US economic and trade relations is mutual benefit and win-win results. Cooperation benefits both sides, while conflict harms both. This is a truth repeatedly verified by the development of bilateral relations over the past decades. Maintaining the overall stability and development of China-US economic and trade relations serves the fundamental interests of both countries and their peoples and meets the expectations of the international community.

statements.speaker: People's Daily
statements.context: Zhong Sheng commentary on China-US trade talks
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China as a responsible major country has demonstrated the resolve and wisdom of a major power. It has consistently advocated that China and the US should demonstrate a broad perspective and take on greater responsibility, and has consistently opposed 'decoupling' and 'disrupting supply chains' to jointly maintain the security and stability of the global supply chain. The US has also repeatedly stated that 'the US has no intention of decoupling from China' and that 'the US-China economic and trade relationship is the most influential bilateral relationship in the world.'

statements.speaker: People's Daily
statements.context: Zhong Sheng commentary on China-US trade talks
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: On its path to modernisation, China insists on expanding high-level opening up, which will provide more opportunities for countries around the world, including the US. The just-concluded Fourth Plenary Session of the 20th Central Committee of the CPC reviewed and approved the proposals for the 15th FYP, outlining China's development blueprint for the next five years. China's pursuit of socialist modernization is a historical process of step-by-step progress and continuous development. By adhering to the principle of seeking progress while maintaining stability, China will be able to respond to any external challenges with the certainty of its own development.
statements.topic: US relations, trade, opening-up, economic development

statements.speaker: People's Daily
statements.context: Zhong Sheng commentary on China-US trade talks
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: When dialogue replaces confrontation, and when cooperation transcends differences, China and the US can find appropriate ways to address each other's concerns, promote the healthy, stable, and sustainable development of China–US economic and trade relations, and bring greater benefits to the peoples of both countries and the peoples of the world.

article_title: Interpreting the Spirit of the Fourth Plenum & Wang Huning's Carrot & Stick Message on Taiwan

statements.speaker: State Council Party Leadership Group
statements.context: Party Leadership Group meeting readout, State Council
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The State Council must take studying and implementing the spirit of the plenum as a major political task, align thoughts and actions with General Secretary Xi Jinping's important speech and plenum arrangements, and do solid work in economic and social development during the 15th FYP period.

statements.speaker: National People's Congress Standing Committee Party Leadership Group
statements.context: Party Leadership Group meeting readout, NPCSC
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: It is necessary to perfect legal systems in market economy and scientific-technological innovation, strengthen legislation in key fields, emerging fields, and foreign-related fields, and provide legal guarantees for accelerating establishment of new development pattern and promoting high-quality development.

statements.speaker: National People's Congress Standing Committee Party Leadership Group
statements.context: Party Leadership Group meeting readout, NPCSC
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The NPC should consciously adhere to the centralized and unified leadership of the Party Central Committee, support the Two Establishments and achieve the Two Safeguards through practical actions, ensure that Party Central Committee decisions are fully implemented in NPC work.

statements.speaker: Li Xi
statements.speaker_title: Secretary of Central Commission for Discipline Inspection
statements.context: CCDI Standing Committee meeting, remarks by Li Xi
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Discipline inspection and supervisory organs must thoroughly study and implement the spirit of the fourth plenum, more firmly uphold the Two Establishments and resolutely achieve the two safeguards, and provide strong guarantee for achieving economic and social development goals of the 15th Five-Year Plan period.

statements.speaker: Li Xi
statements.speaker_title: Secretary of Central Commission for Discipline Inspection
statements.context: CCDI Standing Committee meeting, remarks by Li Xi
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Discipline inspection and supervision agencies must unwaveringly forge ahead in the direction guided by General Secretary Xi Jinping, rectify work styles, strengthen discipline, and combat corruption to clear obstacles and safeguard high-quality development.

statements.speaker: Wang Huning
statements.context: Speech marking Commemoration Day of Taiwan's Restoration
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The One-China principle will never tolerate 'Taiwan independence' separatism. No person or force attempting to meddle in China's internal affairs or to distort and challenge United Nations General Assembly Resolution 2758 will ever succeed.

statements.speaker: Wang Huning
statements.context: Speech marking Commemoration Day of Taiwan's Restoration
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: We will adhere to the policy of 'peaceful reunification and one country, two systems', and are willing on the basis of the one-China principle and the 1992 Consensus to conduct dialogue and consultations with people from all walks of life in Taiwan regarding cross-Strait relations and national reunification.

statements.speaker: Wang Huning
statements.context: Speech marking Commemoration Day of Taiwan's Restoration
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: After peaceful reunification, with a strong motherland as backing, Taiwan's economic development, energy and resource security, infrastructure construction, security guarantees, and external exchanges will all be better. Taiwan compatriots will share the dignity and glory of the great nation and usher in a bright future of prosperity and stability.

statements.speaker: Wang Huning
statements.context: Speech marking Commemoration Day of Taiwan's Restoration
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The development and progress of the motherland's mainland, and the unity and strength of the nation, determine the future and destiny of Taiwan. The public will to achieve complete reunification of the motherland is immensely firm, the foundation is immensely solid, and the power is immensely strong.

article_title: Breakdown of Press Conference on 15th Five-Year Plan

statements.speaker: Jiang Jinquan
statements.speaker_title: Director of the Central Policy Research Office
statements.context: Press conference on Fourth Plenum and 15th Five-Year Plan
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Facing a complex international environment, China's Politburo has coordinated advancement of various undertakings, promoted sustained economic recovery, and advanced Chinese-style modernisation. The 15th FYP is needed for effectively responding to new changes in the complex and severe external environment and for winning strategic initiative in fierce international competition.

statements.speaker: Han Wenxiu
statements.speaker_title: Deputy Director of the Central Financial and Economic Affairs Commission
statements.context: Press conference on Fourth Plenum and 15th Five-Year Plan
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: From the international perspective, the great changes unseen in a century are accelerating, and the balance of international power is undergoing profound adjustment. China enjoys many favorable factors in taking initiative in engagements in international space. Meanwhile, major-power competition is becoming more complex and fierce, and the uncertainty and instability of the external environment are increasing. Yet, within crises lie opportunities.

statements.speaker: Wang Wentao
statements.context: Press conference on Fourth Plenum and 15th Five-Year Plan
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China is committed to openness, cooperation, and mutual benefit. Despite the rise of unilateralism and protectionism, economic globalisation remains a historical trend. During the 14th FYP period, China's imports of goods and services are expected to exceed $15 trillion. Its outbound investment has contributed over $300 billion in tax revenue to host countries. General Secretary Xi Jinping has emphasised that in the past, our opening-up was about 'running behind/following', but now our opening-up must 'take the lead'.

statements.speaker: Zheng Shanjie
statements.speaker_title: Director of the National Development and Reform Commission
statements.context: Press conference on Fourth Plenum and 15th Five-Year Plan
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The Chinese economy was built upon the real economy, and it must also rely on the real economy to move toward the future. Major economies are driven primarily by domestic demand. In today's world, the market is the scarcest of all resources. A strong domestic market is the strategic foundation for Chinese-style modernisation.

statements.speaker: Yin Hejun
statements.context: Press conference on Fourth Plenum and 15th Five-Year Plan
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: During the 14th FYP period, China's scientific and technological strength leaped to a new level. In 2024, total R&D investment in China exceeded 3.6 trillion yuan, a 48% increase from 2020. The number of papers published in high-level international journals and the number of international patent applications have ranked first in the world for five consecutive years. China's modernisation must be underpinned by the modernisation of science and technology. During the 15th FYP period, we must seize the historic opportunity presented by the new round of scientific and technological revolution and industrial transformation, and accelerate high-level scientific and technological self-reliance and self-strengthening.
statements.topic: science and technology, innovation, technological self-reliance

statements.speaker: Lei Haichao
statements.speaker_title: Director of the National Health Commission
statements.context: Press conference on Fourth Plenum and 15th Five-Year Plan
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The Proposal clearly states the need to implement a health-first development strategy, improve the policy and institutional framework for health promotion, enhance the effectiveness of the Patriotic Health Campaign, and improve life expectancy and public health. We will strengthen public health capacity and prevent and control major infectious diseases.

article_title: What's the Vision for China's 15th FYP? Breakdown of the Readout of the Fourth Plenum

statements.speaker: Xinhua
statements.context: Official communique from Fourth Plenum of 20th Central Committee
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China's development environment faces profound and complex changes; development is in a period in which strategic opportunities coexist with risks and challenges, and uncertain and unpredictable factors are increasing.

statements.speaker: Xinhua
statements.context: Official communique from Fourth Plenum of 20th Central Committee
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Safeguard the multilateral trading system, expand international circulation, promote reform and development through opening up, and share opportunities and achieve common development with all countries in the world.

statements.speaker: Xinhua
statements.context: Official communique from Fourth Plenum of 20th Central Committee
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Actively expand independent opening up, promote innovative development in trade, expand space for two-way investment cooperation, and jointly build the Belt and Road Initiative with high quality.

statements.speaker: Xinhua
statements.context: Official communique from Fourth Plenum of 20th Central Committee
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Comprehensively enhance independent innovation capabilities, seize the commanding heights of scientific and technological development, and continuously stimulate the generation of new-quality productive forces. Must strengthen original innovation and tackle key core technologies.

statements.speaker: Xinhua
statements.context: Official communique from Fourth Plenum of 20th Central Committee
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Accelerate the integrated development of mechanization, informatization, and intelligentization, and enhance the strategic capabilities for safeguarding national sovereignty, security, and development interests.
