statements.context: Meeting with UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres in New York
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China will, as always, firmly uphold the United Nations' status and authority, and support countries in making full use of the United Nations as a platform to strengthen dialogue and cooperation and take coordinated and effective actions.

statements.speaker: Li Qiang
statements.context: Meeting with Bill Gates in New York
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The sound and stable development of China-U.S. relations benefits not only the two countries but the world at large. With mounting global challenges, both countries should maintain close cooperation, strengthen and improve global governance, and jointly promote global stability, development and prosperity.

statements.speaker: CPC Central Committee, NPCSC, State Council, CPPCC, and Central Military Commission
statements.context: Congratulatory message to Xinjiang on 70th anniversary, published in People's Daily
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Practice has proven that the Party Central Committee's major policies and guidelines for Xinjiang are completely correct, and that the path of resolving ethnic issues with Chinese characteristics is entirely correct.

article_title: Xi: Xinjiang Policy is Correct, Scientific & Effective - 5-year GDI Vision - New AI+ Cooperation Initiative - China Won't Seek New Special & Differential Treatment in WTO Talks - Taking BeiDou Global

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.speaker_title: General Secretary of the Communist Party of China / President
statements.context: Speech at United Nations Climate Summit
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: While some country is acting against the trend of green and low-carbon transition, the international community should stay focused on the right direction. Developed countries should take the lead in fulfilling emission reduction obligations and provide more financial and technological support to developing countries. Greater international coordination in green technologies and industries is needed to address shortfalls in green production capacity.

statements.speaker: Li Qiang
statements.context: Speech at high-level meeting on the Global Development Initiative in New York
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Decoupling, severing supply chains and bloc confrontation would only hurt the global economy, disrupt global order and create greater risks. Certain developed countries are reluctant to fulfill their pledges of development financing, and even cut off funding to global development institutions, which has seriously undermined North-South cooperation. We should oppose moves such as putting up walls and barriers and blocking the flow of technology.

statements.speaker: Li Qiang
statements.context: Meeting with European Commission President Ursula von der Leyden in New York
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China hopes the EU will honor its commitment to keeping trade and investment markets open, adhere to fair competition and WTO rules, and avoid politicizing economic and trade issues or overstretching the concept of security.

statements.speaker: Li Qiang
statements.context: Meeting with Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney in New York
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China hopes the Canadian side can adopt a correct perception of China, and respect each other's core interests and major concerns. China hopes Canada will provide a fair and non-discriminatory business environment for Chinese companies. With the rise of unilateralism and protectionism and proliferation of trade restrictions, the international community should enhance solidarity and join hands in responding to risks and challenges.

statements.speaker: Li Chenggang
statements.context: Press briefing by Ministry of Commerce
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Currently, the rules-based multilateral trading system faces severe challenges, hegemonism, unilateralism, and protectionism are rampant. Individual countries have successively launched trade wars and tariff wars, seriously damaging the legitimate interests of WTO members, seriously disrupting the international economic and trade order, and bringing uncertainty and instability to global economic development.

statements.speaker: Han Yong
statements.context: Press briefing by Ministry of Commerce
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China will firmly oppose unilateralism and protectionism and uphold fundamental WTO principles and rules, including non-discrimination. China will promote the updating of WTO rules and push for the early inclusion of the Investment Facilitation Agreement and the E-Commerce Agreement into the WTO legal framework.

article_title: Xi Visits Xinjiang - New Xi Thought Curriculum & Teaching Syllabus - Zhao Leji, Wang Yi Stress Taiwan Issue with US Delegation - Steel Industry Work Plan

statements.speaker: Zhao Leji
statements.speaker_title: Chairman of the National People's Congress Standing Committee
statements.context: Meeting with US congressional delegation led by Representative Adam Smith
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Maintaining the sound, stable and sustainable development of China-U.S. relations is an expectation shared by the people of both countries and the world at large. Mutual respect, peaceful coexistence and win-win cooperation are the fundamental principles for the development of China-U.S. ties. Both sides should adhere to principles of rationality, objectivity and fairness, strengthen communication, seek common ground while reserving differences, and enhance mutual trust and dispel misgivings.

statements.speaker: Zhao Leji
statements.speaker_title: Chairman of the National People's Congress Standing Committee
statements.context: Meeting with US congressional delegation led by Representative Adam Smith
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The Taiwan question is the most important and sensitive matter in China-U.S. relations. The United States should adhere to the one-China principle and handle the Taiwan question with caution.

statements.speaker: Zhao Leji
statements.speaker_title: Chairman of the National People's Congress Standing Committee
statements.context: Meeting with US congressional delegation led by Representative Adam Smith
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China's NPC is willing to strengthen exchanges with the U.S. Congress to play a constructive role in boosting bilateral ties, and welcomes more members of the U.S. Congress to visit China.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with US congressional delegation
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The delegation brings the voices of both U.S. political parties and the American people's expectations for China-U.S. relations and should be considered an ice-breaking journey. The visit should help the U.S. understand China accurately, view China objectively, approach differences rationally, engage in friendly interactions, and explore cooperation actively.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with US congressional delegation
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Head-of-state diplomacy plays an irreplaceable leading role in China-U.S. relations. Chinese President Xi Jinping and U.S. President Donald Trump have maintained contact and held phone talks three times, setting the tone and direction for the improvement and development of China-U.S. relations. The current stabilizing trend in bilateral relations is hard-won and should be cherished.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with US congressional delegation
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The U.S. congressional delegation's visit to China has been full of twists and turns, but good things take time, and it has opened another window for engagement between the two countries. Understanding is the foundation on which trust can be built, the starting point from which cooperation can be explored, and the driving force that can shape the future. China's door is always open.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with US congressional delegation
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China and the United States are partners, rather than rivals -- and certainly not enemies. The two countries should strengthen communication and dialogue, avoid misunderstandings and misjudgments, prevent confrontations and opposition, promote mutually beneficial cooperation, and jointly shoulder the responsibilities of major powers.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with US congressional delegation
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The Taiwan question is China's internal affairs. The fact that the mainland and Taiwan belong to one and the same China since ancient times is the real status quo in the Taiwan Strait. The United States has made political commitments regarding the one-China principle. To maintain peace and stability across the Taiwan Strait, it is essential to firmly oppose 'Taiwan independence'.

statements.speaker: Guo Jiakun
statements.context: Ministry of Foreign Affairs regular press briefing
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China commends the positive stance expressed by Russia on the U.S.-Russia New START treaty. It is important that the U.S. and Russia, which possess the world's biggest nuclear arsenals, fulfill their special and primary responsibility for nuclear disarmament, resume implementing the treaty and work out a way to continue substantively slashing their nuclear stockpile in a verifiable, irreversible and legally-binding way.

article_title: New Xinjiang White Paper - Li Meets Congressional Delegation - Zheng Yongnian on Building China's Independent International Relations Knowledge System

statements.speaker: State Council Information Office
statements.context: White paper on Party's governance of Xinjiang, published in People's Daily
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Western countries led by the United States have imposed sanctions on businesses and individuals related to Xinjiang on account of 'genocide' and 'forced labor'—lies and absurd fallacies concocted to interfere in China's internal affairs. Their purpose is political manipulation and economic bullying under the guise of human rights protection.

statements.speaker: Li Qiang
statements.context: Meeting with delegation from US House of Representatives
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Both China and the US are major countries with significant global influence. China is willing to work with the US to achieve mutual respect, peaceful coexistence and win-win cooperation. China and the US should be partners for joint development, treating each other sincerely, empowering each other, and achieving mutual success. The Chinese side is willing to work with the US side in the spirit of equality, respect, and mutual benefit to resolve respective concerns through communication.

statements.speaker: Li Qiang
statements.context: Meeting with delegation from US House of Representatives
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: It is hoped that the US Congress will view China and China-US relations correctly, actively promote exchanges and cooperation between the two countries, and play a constructive role in the friendship and common development of both countries.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Phone call with President Trump on Friday (readout by Chinese side)
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China and the United States were allies who fought shoulder to shoulder during WWII. The Chinese people will not forget the valuable support from the U.S. and other anti-fascist Allied nations for China's War of Resistance. Honoring fallen heroes and remembering history is essential for cherishing peace and creating a better future.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Phone call with President Trump on Friday (readout by Chinese side)
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China and the United States are fully capable of helping each other succeed and prospering together for the good of the two countries and the whole world. For that vision to materialize, both sides need to work hard and in the same direction, so as to realize mutual respect, peaceful coexistence and win-win cooperation.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Phone call with President Trump on Friday (readout by Chinese side)
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The U.S. side should refrain from imposing unilateral trade restrictions so as not to disrupt the outcomes of multiple rounds of consultation between the two sides.

statements.speaker: Chinese government
statements.context: Official position on TikTok issue (from phone call readout)
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China's position on the TikTok issue is clear: The Chinese government respects the wishes of the company in question, and would be happy to see productive commercial negotiations in keeping with market rules lead to a solution that complies with China's laws and regulations and takes into account the interests of both sides. The U.S. side needs to provide an open, fair and non-discriminatory environment for Chinese investors.

statements.speaker: Ministry of Commerce
statements.context: Official statement on TikTok
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The country welcomes companies to conduct business negotiations in line with market rules to reach solutions that comply with Chinese laws and regulations and balance interests of all parties. China hopes the United States will move in the same direction and fully honor its commitments, provide an open, fair, just and non-discriminatory business environment for Chinese companies, including TikTok, to continue operating in the United States, and promote stable, healthy and sustainable development of China-U.S. economic and trade relations.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.speaker_title: General Secretary of the Communist Party of China and President

statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The commemoration of the 80th anniversary of the victory of the Chinese People's War of Resistance Against Japanese Aggression and the World Anti-Fascist War was a solemn and grand ceremony that promoted the great spirit of the War of Resistance, strengthened conviction and confidence in comprehensively advancing the great cause of building a strong nation and rejuvenating the nation, and demonstrated responsibility in promoting the building of a community with a shared future for mankind.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.speaker_title: General Secretary of the Communist Party of China and President
statements.context: Politburo Standing Committee meeting on WWII commemorative activities, reported in People's Daily
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: We must tell well the stories of China's War of Resistance and peaceful development, demonstrate to the world that China is a firm defender of the post-war international order, and display our image as a responsible major power committed to building a community with a shared future for mankind.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.speaker_title: State Councilor and Minister of Foreign Affairs
statements.context: Meeting with South Korean Foreign Minister Cho Hyun in Beijing
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China and South Korea are neighbours that cannot be moved away. The course of development of bilateral relations shows that good-neighbourliness and friendship, seeking common ground while reserving differences, and focusing on cooperation is the correct choice. China's policy toward South Korea maintains stability and continuity.
statements.topic: bilateral relations with South Korea, diplomacy

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.speaker_title: State Councilor and Minister of Foreign Affairs
statements.context: Meeting with South Korean Foreign Minister Cho Hyun in Beijing
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Both China and South Korea are beneficiaries of economic globalisation. In today's climate of rampant unilateral bullying, they should jointly oppose trade protectionism and safeguard the international free trade system.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.speaker_title: State Councilor and Minister of Foreign Affairs
statements.context: Meeting with South Korean Foreign Minister Cho Hyun in Beijing
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: This year is the 80th anniversary of the victory of the Chinese People's War of Resistance Against Japan and the World Anti-Fascist War, and also the 80th anniversary of the founding of the United Nations. At this special historical juncture, President Xi Jinping put forward the Global Governance Initiative, offering Chinese solutions and contributing Chinese wisdom to strengthening and improving global governance. China is willing, together with the international community, including South Korea, to remember history, honour the martyrs, defend the outcomes of the victory of World War II, safeguard the international system with the United Nations at its core, and push the international order in a more just and reasonable direction.

statements.speaker: Han Zheng
statements.context: Speech at 22nd China-ASEAN Expo and China-ASEAN Business and Investment Summit
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China considers ASEAN a priority in its neighborhood diplomacy and firmly supports ASEAN centrality in the regional architecture. China-ASEAN relations have become the most successful and dynamic model of cooperation in the Asia-Pacific, and a vivid example of the building of a community with a shared future for humanity.

statements.speaker: Han Zheng
statements.context: Speech at 22nd China-ASEAN Expo and China-ASEAN Business and Investment Summit
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China is ready to work with ASEAN countries to pursue harmonious coexistence and win-win cooperation, and take a more proactive attitude and more practical steps to advance the building of the China-ASEAN community with a shared future, and contribute more to peace, stability, development and prosperity of the region.

statements.speaker: Ding Xuexiang
statements.context: Meeting with CEO of Singapore Investment Corporation (GIC) in Beijing
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Under the strategic guidance of the leaders of the two countries, the all-round, high-quality, future-oriented partnership between China and Singapore has continuously reached new heights, setting a benchmark for cooperation among regional countries. China's economy maintains a positive long-term trajectory, with new quality productive forces steadily developing, scientific and technological innovation yielding cumulative achievements, and the business environment consistently improving, making it a preferred destination for foreign enterprises.
statements.topic: bilateral relations with Singapore, economic cooperation

statements.speaker: Zhang Youxia
statements.speaker_title: Vice Chairman of the Central Military Commission
statements.context: Meeting with Singapore's Minister of Defense Chan Chun Sing at Xiangshan Forum
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China stands ready to join hands with Singapore to implement the important consensus reached between the leaders of the two countries, practice true multilateralism and strengthen regional security cooperation. China is also willing to work with Singapore to maintain maritime security and order, uphold international fairness and justice, promote the upward, positive development of military relations between the two countries, and inject more certainty and stability into regional security.
statements.topic: regional security, military cooperation, maritime security

statements.speaker: Zhang Youxia
statements.speaker_title: Vice Chairman of the Central Military Commission
statements.context: Meeting with Cuba's Minister of Revolutionary Armed Forces Alvaro Lopez Miera at Xiangshan Forum
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China is willing to coordinate closely with Cuba on international and regional affairs, deepen practical cooperation in various fields to advance relations between the two countries and the two militaries, and bring the China-Cuba community with a shared future to a deeper level and higher standard.
statements.topic: bilateral relations with Cuba, military cooperation

statements.speaker: Dong Jun
statements.context: Meetings with defense chiefs of Malaysia, Cambodia, Myanmar, Namibia, Rwanda and Senegal at Xiangshan Forum
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: This year's forum is of historical significance and practical importance. The Chinese military is ready to carry forward its long-standing friendships with all parties, enhance strategic communication, engage in higher-level security cooperation, and work collaboratively to respond to risks and challenges.

statements.speaker: Wang Xiaohong
statements.context: Opening speech at 2025 Conference of Global Public Security Cooperation Forum in Lianyungang
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China is willing to work with all parties to actively implement the Global Security Initiative and Global Governance Initiative proposed by President Xi Jinping, uphold sovereign equality and achieve shared governance, abide by international rule of law and achieve fairness and justice, practice multilateralism and achieve mutual benefit and win-win results, advocate a people-centered approach and achieve shared results, focus on action-orientedness and achieve lasting security, and promote the building of a more just and reasonable global governance system.

statements.speaker: Cai Qi
statements.speaker_title: Member of Politburo Standing Committee and Party Secretary of Beijing
statements.context: Speech at symposium on publication of fifth volume of 'Xi Jinping: The Governance of China'
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The fifth volume of 'Xi Jinping: The Governance of China' fully reflects our Party's wisdom and responsibility in promoting the building of a community with a shared future for mankind, and provides an authoritative textbook for us to further study and implement Xi Jinping Thought on Socialism with Chinese Characteristics for a New Era.
statements.topic: ideology, China's role in global governance

statements.speaker: Cai Qi
statements.speaker_title: Member of Politburo Standing Committee and Party Secretary of Beijing
statements.context: Speech at symposium on publication of fifth volume of 'Xi Jinping: The Governance of China'
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: We must deeply comprehend General Secretary Xi Jinping's wise reflections on the broad logic and trends of human social development, deeply appreciate the broad-mindedness and sense of responsibility of the Chinese Communists in continuously providing new opportunities for the world through the new progress of Chinese-style modernisation, and create a more favourable international environment.

article_title: Xu Jian on Implications of GGI - China-Slovenia Ties - Jan-August Economic Data - Legitimising Xinjiang Policy via Legislators Forum - Start-up Subsidies are 'Not Windfall from Heaven'

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Letter exchanged with Hereditary Prince Alois of Liechtenstein on 75th anniversary of diplomatic relations, reported by Xinhua
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Over the past 75 years since the establishment of diplomatic relations, China and Liechtenstein have consistently adhered to mutual respect and trust, actively engaged in friendly exchanges and cooperation, and closely coordinated in multilateral arenas, setting an example of friendly coexistence and mutually beneficial cooperation between large and small countries. Xi said that he attaches great importance to development of China-Liechtenstein relations and stands ready to work with Hereditary Prince Alois to continuously deepen friendship and cooperation between the two countries.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Letter exchanged with Karin Keller-Sutter, President of the Swiss Confederation, on 75th anniversary of diplomatic relations, reported by Xinhua
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China and Switzerland set an example of friendly cooperation between countries with different social systems and development stages. Since the establishment of diplomatic ties 75 years ago, the two sides have cultivated a cooperation spirit of equality, innovation and win-win results, achieving fruitful results in bilateral and multilateral arenas, enhancing the well-being of their peoples, and making positive contributions to maintaining multilateralism and free trade. Xi said he attaches great importance to the development of China-Switzerland relations and stands ready to work with Keller-Sutter to take the 75th anniversary of ties as an opportunity to deepen business and financial cooperation and people-to-people exchanges, elevate the China-Switzerland innovative strategic partnership to a new level, and make fresh contributions to promoting an equal and orderly multipolar world and a universally beneficial and inclusive economic globalization.

statements.speaker: Ministry of Commerce
statements.context: Official statement regarding trade talks between China and the US in Madrid
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: In the coming days, the two sides will discuss issues such as the U.S. unilateral tariff measures, the abuse of export controls and TikTok.

statements.speaker: Wang Xiaohong
statements.context: Meeting with Lao Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Public Security Vilay Lakhamfong in Beijing, reported by Xinhua
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China is willing to work with Laos to implement the important consensus reached by the top leaders of the two parties and two countries, and act on the Global Security Initiative and the Global Governance Initiative. The Chinese side stands ready to deepen law enforcement and security cooperation with Laos to continue to crack down on transnational crimes such as online gambling and telecom fraud.

statements.speaker: Wang Xiaohong
statements.context: Meeting with Francisco Díaz Madriz, chief of the Nicaraguan Police Force in Beijing, reported by Xinhua
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China stands ready to work with Nicaragua, guided by the important consensus reached by the leaders of the two countries, to strengthen multilateral communication and coordination, and jointly enhance law enforcement capacity-building.

statements.speaker: Wang Xiaohong
statements.context: Meeting with Demelash Gebremichael, commissioner general of the Ethiopian Federal Police Commission in Beijing, reported by Xinhua
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Both sides should, under the guidance of the important consensus reached by the leaders of the two countries, strengthen coordination in multilateral occasions, boost security cooperation for Belt and Road cooperation, and enhance their capabilities to combat crimes.

statements.speaker: Wang Xiaohong
statements.context: Meeting with Artur Poghosyan, chairman of the Investigative Committee of Armenia in Beijing, reported by Xinhua
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China is willing to work with Armenia to implement the important consensus reached by the leaders of the two countries, jointly combat transnational organized crimes, make concerted efforts to ensure the safe and smooth progress of projects under the Belt and Road Initiative, and deeply engage in cooperation on police training.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with Slovenian President Natasa Pirc Musar in Ljubljana, reported by Xinhua
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Slovenia practices 'small country, big diplomacy' with a global vision, and regards China as a partner rather than a rival, which serves the interests of all parties, including Slovenia itself. China-Slovenia relations transcend differences in social systems and serve as a model of mutual respect and win-win cooperation among countries of different national conditions and sizes. In the face of a world full of intertwined changes, Xi has proposed the Global Governance Initiative, which aims to reform and improve the global governance system. The five key principles contained in the initiative are in line with the purposes of the Charter of the United Nations (UN) and meet the common expectations of the international community. China will continue to stand by the majority of countries, oppose the world's return to 'law of the jungle' and take actions to defend international fairness and justice. China is willing to enhance multilateral collaboration with Slovenia, uphold the basic norms governing international relations, promote the political settlement of hotspot issues and build a more just and equitable global governance system.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with Marko Lotric, president of the National Council of Slovenia in Ljubljana, reported by Xinhua
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: History has shown that the most important thing for a country's development is to find a path that suits its own national conditions. China has found a path of socialism with Chinese characteristics that combines the fundamental principles of Marxism with China's specific realities and the fine traditional Chinese culture. This is a path of peace, development, openness, and win-win cooperation and China will continue to unswervingly move forward along this path. China is committed to expanding high-level opening-up, promoting green, low-carbon and sustainable development and realizing modernization with Chinese characteristics, while in international relations, China advocates mutual respect, mutual tolerance, and win-win cooperation, aiming to build a community with a shared future for humanity. China's continuous development will offer opportunities to countries around the world, including Slovenia. China regards Slovenia as a partner and friend, and is willing to continuously expand their practical cooperation, strengthen multilateral collaboration, safeguard the international system with the United Nations at its core, and play a constructive role in the political settlement of international disputes. None of the problems currently faced by Europe is caused by China. China and Europe should see each other as partners rather than rivals, and their relationship should move forward, not backward.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with Slovenian Foreign Minister Tanja Fajon in Ljubljana, reported by Xinhua
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The bilateral relationship, featuring equality, sincerity, trust and win-win despite their social and institutional differences, is particularly valuable amid the current complex and turbulent international landscape. The two countries should uphold the original aspiration, enhance communication, deepen mutual trust, bolster cooperation and continuously enrich the strategic connotation of the China-Slovenia partnership. The 'Taiwan independence' separatist forces are seeking to promote separatist activities, which is a challenge to the victory of World War II (WWII) and a disruption to the post-WWII international order. China trusts that the Slovenian side will continue to abide by the one-China principle, support the Chinese people in opposing the 'Taiwan independence' activities and consolidate the political foundation of bilateral relations. China is willing to enhance exchanges at all levels with Slovenia, expand cooperation in new fields such as high-end manufacturing, scientific and technological innovation, health and medicine, green energy and artificial intelligence, and provide a fair, open, and non-discriminatory business environment for enterprises of the two countries. Both sides should leverage their respective strengths, promote trade balance in an open spirit, and jointly support economic globalization. Slovenia should play an active role in promoting the healthy and stable development of relations between China and the European Union (EU). Chinese President Xi Jinping has proposed the Global Governance Initiative, which upholds five key principles that align with the shared aspiration of the international community. The initiative aims to reform and improve global governance, consolidate the authority and core position of the United Nations (UN), and has been widely welcomed and supported by the international community. China is willing to enhance collaboration with Slovenia and other countries, uphold multilateralism, join hands to build a more just and equitable global governance system and jointly safeguard world peace and development.

statements.speaker: Ministry of Foreign Affairs
statements.context: Official statement on congratulations to former chief justice Sushila Karki for taking over as Prime Minister of Nepal
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China and Nepal enjoy a long-standing traditional friendship. China has always respected the development path independently chosen by the Nepalese people and is willing to work with Nepal to uphold the Five Principles of Peaceful Coexistence, promote exchanges and cooperation in various fields, and advance the continuous development of China-Nepal relations.

article_title: Major New Reforms on Market-based Allocation of Factors of Production - NDRC's AI+ Action Plan Agenda

statements.speaker: State Council
statements.context: Official approval document for 10 pilot projects on market-based allocation of production factors
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The initiative will last for two years and comes amid the country's broader efforts to foster new quality productive forces, advance the building of a unified national market, and develop a high-standard socialist market economy. Reforms are set to be carried out in major cities such as Zhengzhou, Chongqing and Chengdu as well as in designated areas of Beijing and several provinces, including Jiangsu, Zhejiang, Anhui, Fujian, Hunan, and Guangdong.

statements.speaker: National Development and Reform Commission (NDRC)
statements.context: Article on AI+ action plan in People's Daily
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Implementing the 'AI+' initiative in depth and promoting the deep integration of AI with the economy and society is not only an urgent task but also a strategic proposition for long-term development. Deeply implementing the 'AI+ initiative is a strategic choice for seizing the opportunities presented by the new round of scientific and technological revolution and industrial transformation.

statements.speaker: National Development and Reform Commission (NDRC)
statements.context: Article on AI+ action plan in People's Daily
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: AI has a 'leading goose' effect with very strong spillover and driving characteristics. Through innovative allocation of factors such as capital, labour, technology, and data, it significantly enhances total factor productivity and promotes revolutionary leaps in productive forces.

statements.speaker: National Development and Reform Commission (NDRC)
statements.context: Article on AI+ action plan in People's Daily
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Deep implementation of the 'AI+ action' is an important way to meet people's needs for a better life and is a proactive measure to assist global equal participation in the process of intelligentization development. China's deep implementation of the AI+ action, creating an AI ecosystem with world influence, deepening high-level opening in the AI field, and promoting AI technology to be open-source and accessible, helps promote the formation of a global governance framework and standard norms with broad consensus.

statements.speaker: National Development and Reform Commission (NDRC)
statements.context: Article on AI+ action plan in People's Daily
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China has abundant data resources: By 2024, China's total data production will reach 41.06 zettabytes (ZB), accounting for 26.67% of the global total. The amount of data used for AI development, training, and inference will increase by 40.95% year-on-year.

statements.speaker: National Development and Reform Commission (NDRC)
statements.context: Article on AI+ action plan in People's Daily
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China is the world's only country that possesses all industrial categories under the UN's industrial classification, has an industrial system of 41 major categories, 207 medium categories, and 666 small categories, with the output of more than 200 major industrial products ranking first in the world. This industrial ecology provides full-chain support for AI technology from R&D and verification to product design and manufacturing and delivery.

statements.speaker: National Development and Reform Commission (NDRC)
statements.context: Article on AI+ action plan in People's Daily
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China has a comprehensive and diverse application ecosystem, covering key areas such as smart manufacturing, smart healthcare, digital finance, smart transportation, and smart education. Currently, China has released over 1,500 industry models, covering 50 key industries and over 700 scenarios.

statements.speaker: National Development and Reform Commission (NDRC)
statements.context: Article on AI+ action plan in People's Daily
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China has already built the world's largest and high-quality education system. The total amount of talent resources, the total amount of scientific and technological human resources, and the total number of R&D personnel all rank first in the world. Software developers number nearly 10 million.

article_title: No More Indo-Pacific? - Services Trade Pitch - China's Legislature Outreach - NPC Session Updates

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping

statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China supports Pakistan in resolutely combating all forms of terrorism, and hopes that the Pakistani military will continue to make every effort to ensure the safety of Chinese personnel, projects and institutions in Pakistan.

article_title: Zhong Yiping Commentary Lashes out at Lai for Politicising Typhoon Relief - Zhu Weidong Warns 'Risk of Taiwan Independence Provoking War is Increasing'

statements.speaker: Wang Changlin
statements.speaker_title: Deputy Chief, National Development and Reform Commission (NDRC)
statements.context: Official statement on Hainan Free Trade Port customs operations reform
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Under the new customs closure system, Hainan will expand zero-tariff goods coverage from 21 percent to 74 percent, covering around 6,600 product categories. Eight ports will serve as first-tier entry points for expedited clearance. Goods produced by encouraged industries in Hainan that achieve at least 30 percent value-added processing can enter the mainland tariff-free. The new policies aim to strengthen supply chains, attract foreign investment and foster industrial clusters in sectors like tourism, modern services, high-tech and tropical agriculture.

article_title: Shen Chunyao on the Future of China's National Security Legislative System

statements.speaker: Shen Chunyao
statements.speaker_title: Chairperson of the Legislative Affairs Commission of the NPCSC
statements.context: Article published in People's Daily discussing strengthening of national security legal system
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China has formulated comprehensive national security legislation including laws on foreign investment security review, cybersecurity, data security, and anti-foreign sanctions. China needs to strengthen legislative protection for economic security including supply chains, critical minerals, strategic resources, energy, and finance, and improve anti-sanctions, anti-interference, and anti-'long-arm jurisdiction' mechanisms.
statements.topic: national security, economic security, foreign relations

statements.speaker: Shen Chunyao
statements.speaker_title: Chairperson of the Legislative Affairs Commission of the NPCSC
statements.context: Article published in People's Daily discussing strengthening of national security legal system
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Facing continuous escalation of external risks and challenges, it is necessary to further enrich China's legal 'toolkit' for external struggles, providing a solid rule of law guarantee for safeguarding national sovereignty, security, and development interests.
statements.topic: US-China relations, external challenges, national security

statements.speaker: Shen Chunyao
statements.speaker_title: Chairperson of the Legislative Affairs Commission of the NPCSC
statements.context: Article published in People's Daily discussing strengthening of national security legal system
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China's development has entered a period where strategic opportunities coexist with risks and challenges, and uncertain and unpredictable factors are increasing. Various 'black swan' and 'gray rhino' events may occur at any time, and the complexity and difficulty of national security problems have increased significantly.

article_title: Xi's Message of Looking Beyond GDP in Development - Li Wants Stronger Cost Investigation & Price Monitoring in NEV Sector - Wang Yi Meets Iran & Pak FMs

statements.speaker: Li Qiang
statements.context: State Council Executive Meeting on July 16, 2025
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Strengthening domestic circulation is a strategic move to promote steady and long-term economic development. The government must identify key focus points, implement consumption-boosting actions, eliminate unreasonable consumption restrictions, expand investment in new quality productive forces, and release domestic demand potential.

statements.speaker: Li Qiang
statements.context: State Council Executive Meeting on July 16, 2025
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: On new energy vehicle industry regulation: must strengthen cost investigation and price monitoring, strengthen product consistency supervision, urge key automakers to fulfill payment commitments, improve long-term mechanisms for standardized competition, strengthen industry self-discipline, and guide enterprises to enhance competitiveness through technological innovation and quality improvement.

statements.speaker: Wang Huning
statements.speaker_title: Member of CPC Central Committee Standing Committee
statements.context: Symposium on comprehensive expansion of domestic demand in Beijing
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Since the 18th Party Congress, the CPC Central Committee with Xi Jinping as core has firmly implemented the strategy of expanding domestic demand and accelerated cultivation of a complete domestic demand system. China must take expanding consumption as the foundation, leverage investment's key role, attach importance to supply system enhancement, and contribute to creating a new development pattern and promoting high-quality development.

statements.speaker: Wang Huning
statements.speaker_title: Member of CPC Central Committee Standing Committee
statements.context: Symposium on comprehensive expansion of domestic demand in Beijing
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Comprehensively expanding domestic demand is a necessity for maintaining long-term sustained healthy economic development, meeting people's growing needs for better life, and a strategic move. Must firmly grasp political positioning of serving central Party and state tasks, focus on key issues, form more in-depth research results, and strengthen ideological-political guidance to unite efforts for Party and state development.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Central Urban Work Conference (observations reported in People's Daily feature)
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Building a modern people's city requires adhering to connotative city development as the main line. The industrialization process took the West hundreds of years but China only decades, though China still has many shortcomings to address. Similarly for urbanization - cannot rush for quick success. Some things require sustained long-term effort; cannot pursue superficial achievements while neglecting substance.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Central Urban Work Conference (observations reported in People's Daily feature)
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: As someone engaged in politics, if not familiar with history, especially Chinese history, and lacking historical depth to understand current work and formulate goals, cannot do today's work well. Eagerness for quick success relates to lacking historical sense. In modernization, cities will rise but countryside will not disappear. Rural revitalization and urban development must be organically integrated.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Central Urban Work Conference (observations reported in People's Daily feature)
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Currently urban-rural population flow is still migratory bird-like. The balanced transformation between urban and rural residents must be reflected in policy. Regarding contracted farmland and homesteads of people who moved to cities: on voluntary basis may be relinquished, but government cannot forcibly reclaim. This process requires sufficient historical patience.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Central Urban Work Conference (observations reported in People's Daily feature)
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Regarding cultural preservation in cities: things like large-scale migration and tree cutting, rampant construction of cultural landmarks, and arbitrary changing of old place names absolutely cannot be done anymore. Culture is the soul of a city.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Central Urban Work Conference (observations reported in People's Daily feature)
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Urge leading cadres to establish correct view of political achievements, overcome impetuous attitudes, abandon selfish distractions. Annual assessments cannot focus only on GDP growth or big projects built; must also look at debt incurred. Cannot allow some to play pass-the-parcel game, leaving problems to future generations.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with Tajik Foreign Minister Sirojiddin Muhriddin in Tianjin
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China is willing to work with Tajikistan to implement consensus reached between two heads of state, prepare for next stage of high-level exchanges, and jointly promote successful SCO Tianjin summit. China firmly supports Tajikistan following development path suited to its national conditions and opposes any interference in Tajikistan's internal affairs.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with Uzbek Foreign Minister Bakhtiyor Saidov in Tianjin
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China is willing to work with Uzbekistan to fully implement consensus reached between leaders, prepare for next-stage high-level exchange, and promote bilateral relations to higher quality and level. China is trustworthy and reliable partner for Uzbekistan and regards Uzbekistan as priority in neighborhood diplomacy. China supports Uzbekistan safeguarding national independence, sovereignty, security and development interests.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with Uzbek Foreign Minister Bakhtiyor Saidov in Tianjin
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Two sides should accelerate cooperation in key areas, promote early operation of China-Kyrgyzstan-Uzbekistan Railway, make more achievements in bilateral cooperation. China looks forward to working with Uzbekistan and other SCO member states to ensure complete success of SCO Tianjin summit and inject stronger impetus into organization's development.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with Pakistani Foreign Minister Ishaq Dar in Tianjin
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The friendship between China and Pakistan is unique and time-tested. Frequent communication between foreign ministers reflects high level of all-weather strategic cooperative partnership, conducive to deepening mutual trust and friendship and promoting cooperation. China is willing to work with Pakistan to implement consensus reached by leaders and continue firmly supporting each other on core interest issues.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with Pakistani Foreign Minister Ishaq Dar in Tianjin
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China supports Pakistan concentrating efforts on managing own affairs well, achieving independent and sustainable development, continuously enhancing comprehensive national strength. China willing to strengthen strategic dialogue, jointly build CPEC with high quality, deepen cooperation in agriculture, industry, mining. China supports Pakistan carrying out counterterrorism operations to end.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with Pakistani Foreign Minister Ishaq Dar in Tianjin
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Chinese government always cares about safety of Chinese nationals in Pakistan and believes Pakistani side will continue doing utmost to ensure safety of Chinese personnel, projects, and institutions. Pakistan's active support for China's rotating SCO chairmanship is deeply appreciated. China looks forward to working with Pakistan to ensure complete success of SCO Tianjin summit.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with Iranian Foreign Minister Seyed Abbas Araghchi in Tianjin
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China and Iran have established diplomatic relations for more than half a century with stable and sound development. As comprehensive strategic partner, China will continue supporting Iran in safeguarding state sovereignty and national dignity, resisting power politics and bullying acts, defending legitimate rights through political negotiations, adhering to good-neighborliness and friendship.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with Iranian Foreign Minister Seyed Abbas Araghchi in Tianjin
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China is ready to work with Iran to deepen mutual trust, strengthen cooperation, expand exchanges, and promote steady and long-term growth of China-Iran relations.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with Iranian Foreign Minister Seyed Abbas Araghchi in Tianjin (discussing Iranian nuclear issue)
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China consistently opposes use or threat of force and advocates resolving differences through dialogue and consultation. China values Iran's commitment to not developing nuclear weapons, respects Iran's right to peaceful use of nuclear energy, and appreciates Iran's efforts to strive for peace through diplomatic means.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with Iranian Foreign Minister Seyed Abbas Araghchi in Tianjin (discussing Iranian nuclear issue)
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China supports Iran in maintaining momentum of dialogue with all parties and stands ready to continue playing constructive role in facilitating settlement of Iranian nuclear issue and promoting stability in Middle East region.

article_title: New Guidelines Strengthen Party Control & Xi Thought Across Judiciary - India-China Talks - Foreign Trade Resilience - Xi's Thought & Social Sciences - Lai an ‘Impurity That Must Be Eliminated'

statements.speaker: Ding Xuexiang
statements.context: Sixth China-EU High-Level Environment and Climate Dialogue, co-chaired with Teresa Ribiera of European Commission
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China attaches great importance to ecological and environmental protection and responding to climate change, has formulated and implemented a series of practical measures, and has achieved remarkable results in comprehensive green transformation of economic and social development. China will firmly promote green and low-carbon development and take effective measures to participate in global environmental and climate governance. China is willing to work with the EU to maintain high-level dialogue and exchanges, build greater consensus and deepen the green partnership. China stands ready to work with the EU to uphold mutual benefit and win-win outcomes, expand cooperation in key areas such as energy and circular economy, and jointly support green and low-carbon development of other developing countries. China is willing to work with the EU to promote establishment of a fair, reasonable, cooperative and win-win global environmental and climate governance system.

statements.speaker: Han Zheng
statements.context: Meeting with Indian Foreign Minister S. Jaishankar
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China and India are both major developing countries and important members of the Global South. Being partners that help each other succeed and realising 'the dragon and the elephant dancing together' is the right choice for both sides. Both sides should further implement the important consensus reached by the leaders of the two countries, adhere to the high-level guidance, steadily advance pragmatic cooperation, respect each other's concerns, and promote sustained, healthy, and stable development of China-India relations.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with Indian Foreign Minister S. Jaishankar
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The current international situation has undergone profound changes, and unilateral protectionism and hegemonic bullying actions are bringing severe challenges to the world. As two major Eastern civilisations and major emerging economies that are neighbours, the essence of China-India relations is how to get along harmoniously and achieve mutual success. Both sides should aim high, plan for the long term, adhere to the direction of good-neighbourliness and friendship, and realise the 'Dragon-Elephant Tango', and find a way for the two countries to get along through mutual respect and mutual trust, peaceful coexistence, joint pursuit of development, and win-win cooperation.
statements.framing: accusatory of Western actions, constructive on China-India relations

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with Indian Foreign Minister S. Jaishankar
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: This year marks the 75th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between China and India. China-India relations have maintained an improving momentum of development, which is hard-won and worth cherishing. The relationship between the two countries has its own historical logic and endogenous driving force. It is not targeted at any third party and should not be interfered with by any third party. Both sides should trust each other rather than suspect each other, cooperate with each other rather than compete with each other, achieve each other rather than consume each other. China is willing to work with India to jointly implement the important consensus reached by the leaders of the two countries, demonstrate the strategic vision of emerging and developing major countries, continuously enhance political mutual trust, move toward each other to expand exchanges and cooperation, properly handle contradictions and differences from an overall perspective, strengthen coordination and cooperation on multilateral platforms such as the Shanghai Cooperation Organization, and promote sustained, healthy, and stable development of China-India relations.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with Indian Foreign Minister S. Jaishankar
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: President Xi Jinping has proposed promoting the construction of a community with a shared future for mankind. Both China and India support multilateralism and hope that the international order develops in a more just and reasonable direction. China is willing to strengthen communication and coordination with India, jointly maintain the multilateral trading system, the stability of the global production and supply chain, and the international environment of open cooperation, promote an equal and orderly world multipolarization and inclusive economic globalization, work together to safeguard the common interests of the 'Global South', and promote regional peace, stability, development and prosperity.
statements.topic: multilateralism, international order, global governance, economics

article_title: What's in the GCI Action Plan? - Wang Yi's New Formulation on US Ties - China-Sri Lanka Maritime Cooperation 'Should Not Be Disrupted By Any Third Party'

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with US Secretary of State Marco Rubio in Kuala Lumpur; Chinese official readout
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Both sides should translate the important common understandings of the two presidents into concrete policies and actions. China hopes that the U.S. can view China with an objective, rational, and pragmatic attitude, formulate its policies toward China with the goal of peaceful coexistence and mutually beneficial cooperation, engage with China in an equal, respectful, and mutually beneficial manner, and work with China to explore the right way for the two countries to get along well with each other in the new era.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Remarks to Chinese press after meeting with US Secretary of State in Kuala Lumpur
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The China-US relationship is the most important bilateral relationship in the world today, which concerns both countries and affects the world. Since we are going to meet, we must talk seriously and frankly with an attitude of responsibility to the people of the two countries, the world and history. A common focus of both sides is to truly turn the important consensus reached by the two heads of state into specific policies and practical actions. Only in this way can the two giant ships of China and the US avoid veering off course, avoid stalling, and, even more so, avoid colliding.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Remarks to Chinese press after meeting with US Secretary of State in Kuala Lumpur
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: This meeting was constructive, and the two sides conducted equal-footed dialogue in the spirit of mutual respect. The Chinese side fully expounded our principled position on China-US relations, which I believe has enhanced the US's understanding of China and paved the way for the next step of exchanges between the two countries' diplomatic teams. This can be summarized in a few words: strengthen engagement, prevent misjudgment, manage differences, and expand cooperation.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Remarks to Chinese press after meeting with US Secretary of State in Kuala Lumpur
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: From the perspective of historical evolution and the whole of humanity, the two major countries of China and the United States do have extensive common interests and broad space for cooperation. Both sides have the responsibility and the possibility to find a correct way for China and the US to get along on this planet in the new era, which will be a blessing for the people of the two countries and what the world hopes for.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with Canadian Foreign Minister Anita Anand in Kuala Lumpur; Chinese official readout
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The abuse of tariffs by the United States undermines the international economic and trade order and drags down global economic growth. The United States has even imposed high tariffs on small and poor countries. In contrast, China upholds multilateralism and free trade, voluntarily offers zero-tariff treatment for 100 percent of products from the least developed countries, and promotes the common modernization of all countries by sharing development opportunities.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with Canadian Foreign Minister Anita Anand in Kuala Lumpur; Chinese official readout
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Major countries, in particular, should take the lead and abandon the so-called logic of power politics that advocates 'peace through strength'.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Remarks to Chinese press during Kuala Lumpur foreign ministers' meetings
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Some extra-regional countries are always pointing fingers at the South China Sea; although their tone has clearly softened this year, they still haven't stopped. It seems they fear the South China Sea won't be chaotic. The regional countries are now seeing through these 'old tricks' very clearly.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Remarks to Chinese press during Kuala Lumpur foreign ministers' meetings
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The 'arbitration case' has serious flaws in both factual findings and the application of law. It is an act that violates UNCLOS under the guise of upholding it, and its destructive impact on regional peace and stability and the international maritime order is becoming increasingly evident. The 'arbitration case' was political manipulation and should be swept into the dustbin of history.
statements.topic: South China Sea arbitration ruling, US position

article_title: Xi Focuses on History & Industrial Development in Shanxi - Li Promises 'Greater Policy Support' for Chinese Companies Abroad - Interview with Rana Mitter - Zhong Sheng on Sino-US People-to-People Ties

statements.speaker: Li Qiang
statements.context: BRICS Summit second and third phase meetings in Rio de Janeiro
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The current international economic and trade order and multilateral trading system have been severely impacted by unilateralism and protectionism. The 'Greater BRICS Cooperation' should safeguard and practice multilateralism, promote the construction of a fair and open international economic and trade order, and gather the power of the Global South.

statements.speaker: Li Qiang
statements.context: BRICS Summit in Rio de Janeiro
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China will, under the Global Development Initiative framework, build the 'Digital South' brand and will hold 200 training programs on the digital economy and artificial intelligence for countries from the South over the next five years.

statements.speaker: Li Qiang
statements.context: Meeting with UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres in Rio
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China stands ready to deepen coordination and cooperation with the United Nations to jointly advocate for a more just and equitable international order. The vision of building a community with a shared future for mankind and the three major global initiatives proposed by Xi Jinping are highly consistent with the purposes and principles of the UN Charter.

statements.speaker: Li Qiang
statements.context: Meeting with WTO Director-General Ngozi Okonkwo-Iweala in Rio
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China stands ready to work with the international community to get the world economy back on track at an early date. The global trade has undergone significant changes with rising unilateralism and protectionism, which has severely impacted the international economic and trade order and posed grave challenges to the world economy.

statements.speaker: Li Qiang
statements.context: Meeting with WTO Director-General in Rio
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Faced with U.S. tariff pressure, China stands firm in defending its own rights and interests and upholding international fairness and justice.

statements.speaker: Li Qiang
statements.context: Meeting with WTO Director-General
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Economic globalization is an irreversible trend of history. China will, as always, continue to practice and safeguard multilateralism and free trade, actively support the reform and development of the WTO to restore its authority.

statements.speaker: Li Qiang
statements.context: Meeting with WTO Director-General
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China has abundant resources and means to counter adverse external impacts, and is confident in and capable of promoting steady and healthy economic development. China will introduce more measures for voluntary and unilateral opening up, strictly abide by the principles and market rules of the WTO, and continue to share development opportunities with other countries.

statements.speaker: Li Qiang
statements.context: Meeting with Chinese enterprises in Brazil
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The Chinese economy is fully capable of withstanding any external shocks and achieving long-term stable growth. The current global economic and trade landscape is undergoing profound changes with the rise of unilateralism and protectionism, and increasing trade and investment barriers.

statements.speaker: Zhong Sheng commentary (People's Daily)
statements.context: Editorial commentary in People's Daily
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China is willing to invite 50,000 American youth to come to China for exchanges and studies in the next five years. The achievements of China-US relations are primarily due to the joint efforts of the two peoples. From historical 'ping-pong diplomacy' to current pickleball exchanges, sincere interaction between the people can add warmth to China-US relations.

statements.speaker: Zhong Sheng commentary (People's Daily)
statements.context: Editorial commentary in People's Daily
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: No matter how the situation changes, the historical logic of China-US peaceful coexistence will not change, the fundamental desire of the two peoples to exchange and cooperate will not change. China and the US should build bridges for personnel exchanges and cultural exchanges, and eliminate interference and obstacles.

statements.speaker: Zhong Sheng commentary (People's Daily)
statements.context: Editorial commentary in People's Daily
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China is willing to work with the US to pool the strength of the two peoples, continue the traditional friendship, promote the stable, healthy and sustainable development of China-US relations, and seek more benefits for the people of the two countries.

statements.speaker: Geng Shuang
statements.speaker_title: Deputy Permanent Representative to the UN
statements.context: UN General Assembly review of Afghanistan issue
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China expects the international community to view the situation in Afghanistan in a comprehensive and objective manner and play a constructive role in supporting Afghanistan's early return to the international community.

statements.speaker: Geng Shuang
statements.speaker_title: Deputy Permanent Representative to the UN
statements.context: UN General Assembly review of Afghanistan issue
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China calls on traditional donors, especially those countries that bear historical responsibility for Afghanistan's current situation, to increase financial input. China calls on relevant countries to immediately lift illegal unilateral sanctions against Afghanistan and unconditionally unfreeze and return Afghanistan's overseas assets.

article_title: Zhong Sheng Commentary: China-US London Framework 'Hard-Won'; Bilateral Deals Must not Harm China's Interests

statements.speaker: Li Qiang
statements.context: Speech at BRICS Summit plenary on Peace and Security and Reform of Global Governance
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Conflicts and disputes globally stem from lack of trust and communication. Power politics and bullying are never the right way to solve problems. Security and development of all countries should be respected. Less arrogance and prejudice, more sincerity and understanding needed. Countries should find the best answer through friendly consultation on basis of equality.

statements.speaker: Li Qiang
statements.context: Speech at BRICS Summit plenary on Peace and Security and Reform of Global Governance
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: When international rules are being undermined and bullying practices are on the rise, we need to stand up for what is right and speak up for justice. We need to act as a positive and stable force for good in the world, promote dispute settlement by peaceful means, and seek solutions that address root causes.

statements.speaker: Li Qiang
statements.context: Speech at BRICS Summit plenary on Peace and Security and Reform of Global Governance
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China will establish the China-BRICS New Quality Productive Forces Research Center and the BRICS New Industry Golden Egret Excellence Scholarships to help BRICS countries train talents in industry and telecommunication, and pursue innovation-driven development.

statements.speaker: Li Qiang
statements.context: Meeting with Ethiopian Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China will support Ethiopia in independently exploring a development path suited to its national conditions, deepen cooperation in infrastructure, new energy vehicles, green industries, e-commerce and artificial intelligence, and intensify exchanges in tourism, youth, education and other fields.

statements.speaker: Li Qiang
statements.context: Meeting with Ethiopian Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China will join hands with Ethiopia to strengthen communication and coordination within multilateral frameworks like the United Nations and BRICS, boost concerted efforts to practice true multilateralism, firmly safeguard economic globalization and free trade, and inject more stability and positive energy into the world.
statements.framing: assertive defense of multilateralism against unilateralism

statements.speaker: Zhong Sheng (People's Daily commentary)
statements.context: Zhong Sheng commentary on China-US trade ties, Page 17
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Since the London talks, the two sides have stepped up implementation of outcomes, made positive progress on some issues, and sent positive signals. This shows that as long as China and the US persist in resolving differences through equal dialogue and consultation, continuously enhance consensus, reduce misunderstandings, and strengthen cooperation, they can find appropriate ways to resolve disputes and inject more positive factors into development of both countries and world economy.

statements.speaker: Zhong Sheng (People's Daily commentary)
statements.context: Zhong Sheng commentary on China-US trade ties, Page 17
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: During China-US London Economic and Trade Talks, the two sides reached in-principle consensus on framework of measures to implement important consensus reached by two heads of state on June 5. China is approving qualified applications for export licenses for controlled items. The United States has taken corresponding actions to cancel restrictive measures against China.

statements.speaker: Zhong Sheng (People's Daily commentary)
statements.context: Zhong Sheng commentary on China-US trade ties, Page 17
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The US side's abuse of tariffs is a typical unilateral bullying practice that causes serious impact on normal international trade order and must be resolutely opposed. The World Bank and OECD recently downgraded expectations for US and global economic growth, with trade policy uncertainty being an important reason.

statements.speaker: Zhong Sheng (People's Daily commentary)
statements.context: Zhong Sheng commentary on China-US trade ties, Page 17
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China is pleased to see all parties resolve economic and trade differences with the US through equal consultations, and advocates that all parties jointly maintain the multilateral trading system with the WTO at its core. Bilateral negotiations are important for easing trade frictions, but bilateral arrangements cannot harm the interests of third parties. China firmly opposes any party reaching a deal at the expense of China's interests. If this happens, China will never accept it and will resolutely counter it.
statements.framing: assertive warning to third countries against US deals that harm China

statements.speaker: Zhong Sheng (People's Daily commentary)
statements.context: Zhong Sheng commentary on China-US trade ties, Page 17
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: No one can be immune to the impact of unilateralism and protectionism. Once the bottom line of principles is breached, blackmail will intensify, all countries will become victims, and the institutional environment for global development may suffer irreversible damage.

statements.speaker: Zhong Sheng (People's Daily commentary)
statements.context: Zhong Sheng commentary on China-US trade ties, Page 17
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: As a responsible major country, China is willing to work with all parties to uphold true multilateralism, effectively safeguard the multilateral trading system, promote the construction of an open world economy, and jointly inject more certainty and stability into the world economy.

article_title: Li in Brazil, But Xi Dominates the Headlines

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Letter to U.S. youth pickleball cultural exchange delegation from Montgomery County, Maryland, reported by Xinhua
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The future of China-U.S. relations depends on the youth. Expressed hope that the delegation members will become a new generation of ambassadors for friendship between the two countries and make greater contributions to enhancing the friendship between the two peoples.

statements.speaker: Li Qiang
statements.context: Meeting with Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva at BRICS summit
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China-Brazil relations are currently at their best in history. The two sides are working together to build a China-Brazil community with a shared future for a more just world and a more sustainable planet. China is willing to continue working with Brazil to continuously enrich the connotation of bilateral relations, achieve more practical cooperation results, and better benefit the people of the two countries.

article_title: Building Unified National Market & Marine Economy - Xi & China's Youth - China Sanctions ex-Philippine Senator - Wang Yi Visits Belgium - Xinhua Commentary: Dalai Lama Succession 'Rests with Govt'

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.speaker_title: President, General Secretary of the CPC
statements.context: Speech at Central Commission for Financial and Economic Affairs meeting
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Building a unified national market is necessary to build a new development pattern and promote high-quality development. To promote Chinese-style modernisation, we must promote high-quality development of the marine economy and forge a Chinese path of leveraging marine resources to achieve strength.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.speaker_title: President, General Secretary of the CPC
statements.context: Editorial citing Xi's remarks to youth organizations
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The world's profound changes unseen in a century are accelerating their evolution. To realise the grand goal of building a strong country and achieving national rejuvenation, the whole Party and people must unite as one. Youth should firmly uphold the life ambition of 'serving the country and the people', maintain the confident foundation of 'looking at the world on equal footing', and courageously innovate and create.

statements.speaker: Wang Huning
statements.speaker_title: Member of Politburo Standing Committee, Chairman of CPPCC National Committee
statements.context: Meeting with Marinko Cavara, deputy speaker of the House of Representatives of the Parliamentary Assembly of Bosnia and Herzegovina
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Under the strategic guidance of President Xi Jinping and the Presidency of BiH, the two countries have maintained solid political mutual trust and close people-to-people and cultural exchanges. statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with New Zealand Deputy Prime Minister and Foreign Minister Winston Peters

statements.context: Meeting with New Zealand Deputy Prime Minister and Foreign Minister Winston Peters
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The two countries should upgrade economic and trade cooperation, launch negotiations on negative list for trade in services as soon as possible, and work together to create new growth engines such as artificial intelligence and green economy

statements.context: Meeting with New Zealand Deputy Prime Minister and Foreign Minister Winston Peters

China respects New Zealand's traditional relations with Pacific island countries

statements.speaker: Ministry of Foreign Affairs
statements.context: Foreign Ministry statement on Taiwan arms sales
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China calls on the US to stop arming Taiwan and to desist from undermining peace and stability across the Taiwan Strait

statements.speaker: Lin Jian
statements.context: Foreign Ministry press briefing responding to Trump administration Taiwan aid release
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China is seriously concerned about reports of US military assistance to Taiwan; the provision of military assistance by the United States to Taiwan seriously violates the one-China principle and the three China-U.S. joint communiqués, significantly violates China's sovereignty and security interests, and sends a very wrong signal to 'Taiwan independence' separatist forces. China will closely follow the development of the situation and firmly safeguard national sovereignty, security and territorial integrity

statements.speaker: Zhu Fenglian
statements.speaker_title: Spokesperson, State Council's Taiwan Affairs Office
statements.context: Press conference responding to Japan's family registration system change
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Japan's move to allow individuals from Taiwan to list Taiwan instead of China as their place of origin attempts to create 'two Chinas' or 'one China, one Taiwan,' which seriously violates the one-China principle and constitutes grave interference in China's internal affairs. We firmly oppose this. As a country with historical responsibility for Taiwan question, Japan should learn from history, act with caution, strictly adhere to the one-China principle and spirit of four political documents between China and Japan, and handle Taiwan-related issues prudently

statements.speaker: Zhu Fenglian
statements.speaker_title: Spokesperson, State Council's Taiwan Affairs Office
statements.context: Press conference warning DPP authorities
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: We sternly warn the DPP authorities that misjudging the situation and seeking independence by relying on external forces is doomed to fail

statements.speaker: Zhu Fenglian
statements.speaker_title: Spokesperson, State Council's Taiwan Affairs Office
statements.context: Press conference regarding USAID backing of Taiwan NGOs
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: USAID has backed and indulged many non-governmental groups in Taiwan, either directly or indirectly, to collude with the DPP in fabricating 'Taiwan independence' fallacies and inciting conflicts across the Taiwan Strait. This laid bare the inherent nature of some U.S. foundations and think tanks in inciting 'color revolution' around the world and stirring up trouble regarding the Taiwan question

statements.speaker: Zhu Fenglian
statements.speaker_title: Spokesperson, State Council's Taiwan Affairs Office
statements.context: Press conference responding to DPP defense spending and potential arms purchases
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: It is commonplace for the DPP authorities to spend sums on flattering the United States, such as donating money to certain U.S. think tanks in return for favorable research reports and inviting anti-China politicians to visit the island. Playing up to external forces and 'selling Taiwan' would only push Taiwan into the throes of disaster. Taiwan is China's Taiwan. The more than 1.4 billion Chinese people and the Chinese People's Liberation Army would never allow anyone or any forces to split Taiwan from China
