article_title: Xi Talks to Putin - Is a Reverse-Kissinger Possible? - Changes to Private Economy Promotion Law - Wang Yi's Pitch at UNHRC

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Phone call with Vladimir Putin, reported in People's Daily
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Both history and reality tell us that China and Russia are destined to be good neighbors, and our two countries are true friends that share weal and woe, support each other and pursue common development. Our bilateral relationship has a strong internal driving force and unique strategic value. It is neither targeted at any third party nor affected by any third party.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Phone call with Vladimir Putin, reported in People's Daily
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China welcomes positive efforts made by Russia and relevant parties to resolve the crisis.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Remarks at the high-level meeting of the 58th session of the United Nations Human Rights Council
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: We must say no to any words and deeds that use human rights as an excuse to interfere in the internal affairs of other countries in disregard of national sovereignty and security and the safety of people's lives.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Remarks at the high-level meeting of the 58th session of the United Nations Human Rights Council
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: We must say no to any words and deeds that apply double or even multiple standards on human rights issues.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Remarks at the high-level meeting of the 58th session of the United Nations Human Rights Council
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: We must say no to any words and deeds that impose one's own model or will upon others, that politicize, instrumentalize or weaponize human rights.

statements.speaker: Lyu Jian
statements.context: Event held in Oman by the State Council Information Office discussing Chinese policies in Xinjiang
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The right to development is a fundamental human right, and religious inclusiveness is the cornerstone of civilisational progress. He opposed interference in other countries' internal affairs under the pretext of human rights and religion and the application of double standards.

article_title: Wang Yi: Multipolarity is 'Becoming a New Reality' - China Issues Document No. 1 - Banking on Silver-Haired Economy amid Waning Demographic Dividend - China as an 'Empowering-type Major Power'

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: G20 Foreign Ministers' meeting in South Africa
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Countries should respect each other's sovereignty and territorial integrity, and respect the development paths and social systems independently chosen by each other. Bloc confrontation and interference in other countries' internal affairs must be rejected. The Five Principles of Peaceful Coexistence remain as relevant as ever.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: G20 Foreign Ministers' meeting in South Africa
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: President Xi Jinping has proposed the Global Security Initiative, which advocates the vision of common, comprehensive, cooperative and sustainable security, a new path to security featuring dialogue rather than confrontation, partnership rather than alliance, and win-win rather than zero-sum.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: G20 Foreign Ministers' meeting in South Africa
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: It is all the more important to defend the authority of the U.N. and give full play to its role. Countries need to translate the Call to Action on Global Governance Reform launched by the G20 foreign ministers into action and firmly safeguard the international system with the U.N. at its core.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: G20 Foreign Ministers' meeting in South Africa
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Recently the calls for peace talks are rising and the window of opportunity for peace is opening. China always calls for an early and peaceful settlement of the crisis and has been actively promoting peace talks. China supports all efforts dedicated to peace, including the recent consensus reached between the United States and Russia.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: G20 Foreign Ministers' meeting in South Africa
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China firmly supports the African people in independently resolving African problems, and opposes external interference in the internal affairs of African countries.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Bilateral meeting with Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov at G20
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China and Russia, as major victorious nations of World War II and permanent members of the United Nations Security Committee, jointly bear the crucial responsibility of safeguarding the victorious results of World War II and maintaining the post-war international order. Both nations are duty-bound to uphold their international moral obligations as major countries.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Bilateral meeting with Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov at G20
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Both sides should take the opportunity of jointly commemorating the 80th anniversary to deepen China-Russia strategic coordination, actively promote the correct view on World War II, firmly defend the international system with the United Nations at its core, safeguard the legitimate rights and interests of Global South countries, and promote the building of an equal and orderly multipolar world.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Bilateral meeting with Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov at G20
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China will continue to play a constructive role in promoting peace talks and political settlement of the [Ukraine] crisis.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Bilateral meeting with Russian Foreign Minister
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: While promoting initiatives for a peaceful settlement of the Ukrainian crisis, Beijing believes it necessary to eradicate its root causes in accordance with the corresponding principles of the UN Charter, above all unconditional respect for human rights.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Bilateral meeting with Indian Foreign Minister S. Jaishankar at G20
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: President Xi Jinping and Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi held a successful meeting in Kazan last year, which set the general direction for the improvement and development of bilateral relations. China and India, as two ancient civilizations and neighboring countries, should trust and support each other and help each other succeed.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Bilateral meeting with Australian Foreign Minister Penny Wong at G20
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Under the strategic guidance of the leaders of the two countries, China-Australia relations have stabilized. China appreciates Australia's repeated commitment to the one-China principle, and hopes that Australia will continue to respect China's core interests and major concerns, safeguard the political foundation of bilateral relations, and properly manage differences.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Bilateral meeting with Australian Foreign Minister Penny Wong at G20
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Major countries, in particular, should demonstrate exemplary responsibility in firmly opposing 'turning back the wheel of history' and returning to the 'law of the jungle'. China is ready to work with Australia and other members of the international community to defend the victorious outcomes of World War II and uphold the international system with the United Nations at its core.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Bilateral meeting with Saudi Foreign Minister Faisal bin Farhan Al Saud at G20
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The Palestinian question is the core of the Middle East issue. China will continue to stand firmly with Arab brothers and make efforts to redress historical injustice thoroughly and restore lasting peace in the region at an early date.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Bilateral meeting with Turkish Foreign Minister Hakan Fidan at G20
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China attaches great importance to its relations with Türkiye and places bilateral relations at an important position in its Middle East diplomacy. Resolutely countering terrorism in all forms serves the common interests of both China and Türkiye and is a strong consensus of the international community.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Interview captured in People's Daily following European and South African visits
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: A multipolar world is both a historical inevitability and is becoming a new reality. Promoting the construction of an equal and orderly multipolar world is an important proposition put forward by President Xi Jinping. China will be a factor of certainty in the multipolar system and will firmly be a constructive force in a changing world.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Interview captured in People's Daily following European and South African visits
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: We advocate treating each other as equals, adhering to equality of rights, equality of opportunity, and equality of rules. Countries big and small are all equal. We should enhance the representation and voice of developing countries in the international system.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Interview captured in People's Daily following European and South African visits
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Major powers should take the lead in being trustworthy and upholding the rule of law, resolutely abandon zero-sum games, should not return to jungle law, and cannot practice double standards in complying with international law.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Interview captured in People's Daily following European and South African visits
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Protectionism is not the way out, 'decoupling and breaking chains' cuts off opportunities, 'small yards with high walls' only closes oneself off. We must support equal and orderly world multipolarity with inclusive economic globalisation.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Interview captured in People's Daily following European and South African visits
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China has always viewed China-EU relations from a strategic height and long-term perspective, regarding Europe as an important direction of major-country diplomacy with Chinese characteristics and a key partner in achieving Chinese-style modernization. China-EU relations are not targeted at, dependent on, or subject to any third party.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Interview captured in People's Daily following European and South African visits
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: During this European trip, I felt that under the strategic guidance of head-of-state diplomacy, Europe's policy towards China is becoming more rational and pragmatic. Europe hopes to understand China's thoughts and actions, is willing to strengthen exchanges and cooperation with China, handle differences through dialogue.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Interview captured in People's Daily following European and South African visits
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Peace and stability are the common pursuit of the international community, with the vast majority of countries hoping for the cessation of warfare, expecting hot spots to cool down, worrying about division and confrontation, and opposing the resort to force at every turn.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Interview captured in People's Daily following European and South African visits
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Development and prosperity are the urgent expectations of all countries, with Global South countries having an even more urgent desire for development and revitalisation. Trade wars are unpopular, and unilateral sanctions will inevitably backfire.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Interview captured in People's Daily following European and South African visits
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Expecting China to play a role is a universal call. More and more countries realize that China is a stable anchor in a turbulent world, hoping that China will play a role and make contributions in responding to various global challenges.

statements.speaker: State Council
statements.context: State Council executive meeting
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The development of trade in services and consumption of services is an important means to stabilise foreign trade and expand domestic demand. It is necessary to focus on innovation and enhance trade in services, fully implement the negative list of cross-border trade in services, actively connect with international high-standard economic and trade rules, and study and launch a number of new opening-up measures.

article_title: What Private Entrepreneurs Told Xi During Monday's Meeting - State Council Studies Consumption Policies - Lan Fo’an on Fiscal Policy Priorities for 2025 - What Indonesia Desires from BRICS

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.speaker_title: General Secretary of the CPC Central Committee
statements.context: Symposium with private entrepreneurs
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: You are the youngest here. The country's innovation needs the contribution of the younger generation.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.speaker_title: General Secretary of the CPC Central Committee
statements.context: Symposium with private entrepreneurs
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: In the long run, east wind is still strong. Confidence is very important.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.speaker_title: General Secretary of the CPC Central Committee
statements.context: Symposium with private entrepreneurs
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China's economy has a stable foundation, many advantages, strong resilience, and great potential.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.speaker_title: General Secretary of the CPC Central Committee
statements.context: Symposium with private entrepreneurs
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Solidly implementing policies and measures to promote the development of the private economy is the current focus. Whatever the Central Committee has decided must be resolutely implemented without compromise.

statements.speaker: Ren Zhengfei
statements.context: Symposium with private entrepreneurs
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Our earlier concerns about lacking chips and lacking soul (core technology dependence) have diminished. I firmly believe that a greater China will rise at an accelerated pace.

statements.speaker: Lei Jun
statements.context: Symposium with private entrepreneurs
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: We firmly believe that despite changing international circumstances, as long as we have the CPC Central Committee with Comrade Xi Jinping at its core leading the people of the whole country united in moving forward, there is nothing that cannot be overcome.

statements.speaker: Li Qiang
statements.context: State Council special study session on consumption and domestic demand
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Internal circulation and domestic demand are the unique advantages of the economy of a big country. Boosting consumption is an important means to expand domestic demand and stabilize growth, and a major measure to transform the development mode.

statements.speaker: Cai Qi
statements.speaker_title: Member of the Politburo Standing Committee
statements.context: National social work ministers' conference
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Profoundly understand the decisive significance of the 'two establishments', resolutely uphold the 'two safeguards', unswervingly follow the path of socialist social governance with Chinese characteristics.

statements.speaker: Lan Fo'an
statements.context: Article in People's Daily on fiscal policy priorities for 2025
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: 2025 is the final year of the 14th Five-Year Plan. China's economic advantages of strong resilience, sufficient potential, and large room for maneuver are still evident, and the long-term support conditions and basic trends have not changed.

statements.speaker: Lan Fo'an
statements.context: Article in People's Daily on fiscal policy priorities for 2025
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: We will increase the fiscal deficit ratio, increase expenditure intensity and speed up expenditure progress to inject more impetus into economic development.

article_title: Xi Attaches 'Great Importance' to Private Economy - China's Development Philosophy Now a Global Public Good? - Wang Yi's Multilateralism Pitch at UNSC - 20-Point Plan on Foreign Investment

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Speech at meeting with private entrepreneurs, reported in People's Daily commentary
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Supporting the development of the private economy is a consistent policy of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, and promoting the growth and strengthening of the private economy is a long-term strategy. The basic policies and guidelines of the Party and the state for the development of the private economy have been incorporated into the system of socialism with Chinese characteristics, and will be adhered to and implemented consistently. They cannot and will not change.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Remarks at symposium with private entrepreneurs
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Some difficulties and challenges currently facing the development of the private economy are generally occurring in the process of reform and development, industrial transformation and upgrading. They are local rather than universal, temporary rather than long-term, and surmountable rather than being unsolvable. In difficulties and challenges, one must see prospects, see brightness, and see the future, maintain strategic resolve in development, strengthen confidence in development, and uphold the fighting spirit of striving and winning.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Remarks at symposium with private entrepreneurs
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: In the new era and new journey, the private economy has broad prospects for development and great potential, and it is time for private enterprises and private entrepreneurs to show their talents.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Remarks at symposium with private entrepreneurs
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: We must resolutely break down various obstacles to the equal use of production factors and fair participation in market competition in accordance with the law; continue to promote the fair opening of competitive infrastructure fields to various business entities; continue to make great efforts to solve the problems of difficulty in accessing and high cost of financing for private enterprises; focus on solving the problem of arrears of accounts payable to private enterprises; strengthen law enforcement supervision and protect the legitimate rights and interests of private enterprises; earnestly implement various relief policies; and further build a close and clean relationship between government and business.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Speech at UN Security Council high-level meeting on 'Practicing Multilateralism, Reforming and Improving Global Governance'
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China will continue to uphold practicing multilateralism, defend the vision of the United Nations, and firmly safeguard the authority of the United Nations. China is ready to work with all countries for a better future.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Speech at UN Security Council high-level meeting
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Upholding sovereign equality: all countries participate as equals, make decisions as equals, and benefit as equals. Members must respect the development paths chosen independently by people of all countries, uphold the principle of non-interference in internal affairs, and not impose one's will upon others. Any unilateral sanction that circumvents Security Council authorization lacks legal basis, defies justification and contradicts common sense.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Speech at UN Security Council high-level meeting
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Upholding fairness and justice: International affairs should no longer be monopolized by a small number of countries. Countries in the Global South have the right to speak up for and defend their legitimate rights and interests. The reform of the U.N. Security Council should continue to emphasize democratic consultation, increase the representation and say of developing countries, especially African countries, and effectively redress historical injustice.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Speech at UN Security Council high-level meeting
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Upholding solidarity and coordination: Countries should commit to the principle of extensive consultation and joint contribution for shared benefit, replace confrontation with coordination, prevent lose-lose through win-win cooperation, and break down small circles with greater solidarity. The U.N. Security Council must rise above narrow-minded geopolitical considerations, champion the spirit of solidarity and cooperation, fulfill its duties conferred by the U.N. Charter, and effectually play its role for the maintenance of international peace and security.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with Pakistani FM Mohammad Ishaq Dar
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China and Pakistan are all-weather strategic cooperative partners, and the two sides have always trusted and supported each other. China prioritizes relations with Pakistan in its neighborhood diplomacy and will continue to uphold justice and speak up for Pakistan on international occasions. China will seek greater synergy of development strategies with Pakistan, in particular, deepen cooperation on agricultural modernization and industrialization, and help Pakistan enhance its capacity for independent development.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with Hungarian Foreign Minister Péter Szijjártó
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China appreciates Hungary's rational and objective stance on hotspot conflict issues and believes that Hungary will continue to contribute to peace and stability in Europe. Regardless of changes in the international landscape, China will always be a trustworthy partner for Hungary. Hungary will continue to play a constructive role in the sound and stable development of China-EU relations.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with Ugandan Foreign Minister Jeje Odongo
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The international community cannot promote multilateralism without African voices, or improve global governance without African participation. China is willing to work with African partners to build a just and equitable global governance system and make joint efforts for world peace, stability, development and prosperity. China and Uganda have always respected, trusted and supported each other.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with Bolivian Foreign Minister Celinda Sosa Lunda
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Standing at a new historical starting point, China is ready to make joint efforts with Bolivia to deepen mutually beneficial cooperation and take China-Bolivia strategic partnership to new heights. China supports Chinese enterprises to invest and do business in Bolivia to help the country accelerate development and improve people's livelihood. Latin America is the homeland of the Latin American people, not the backyard of any country. China supports Latin American countries in safeguarding sovereignty, independence and national dignity. China will always be a reliable friend and partner of Latin America.

statements.speaker: Shi Taifeng
statements.context: Meeting on learning and implementing the spirit of the Third Plenum and CEWC, engaging with people from new social strata
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The Party Central Committee attaches great importance to United Front work related to people from new social strata, emphasizing that people from new social strata are builders of the cause of socialism with Chinese characteristics. In the new era and on the new journey, further comprehensively deepening reform and comprehensively promoting the great cause of building a strong country and national rejuvenation with Chinese-style modernisation require the joint efforts of people of all ethnic groups across the country, including those from new social strata.
statements.topic: domestic policy and united front work

statements.speaker: Zheng Bei
statements.context: Statement on implementing directives from private enterprise symposium
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The commission will work with relevant departments and local governments to implement various directives from the private enterprise symposium in five key areas: breaking down barriers to market access and resource acquisition; promoting the resolution of overdue payments to private enterprises; legally protecting the legitimate rights and interests of private enterprises and entrepreneurs; implementing various business support and relief policies; and actively fostering a supportive environment for private economic development.

article_title: What's Xi's Message to Private Entrepreneurs? - Wang Yi Visits Ireland - Plan for New-energy Storage Manufacturing Industry

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with Irish Taoiseach Micheal Martin
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China is committed to promoting broader and deeper reform across the board, advancing Chinese modernization, and building a higher-standard open economy, which will bring new opportunities to all countries, including Ireland. China is ready to work with Ireland to strengthen dialogue, enhance mutual trust, and properly manage differences.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with Irish Foreign Minister Simon Harris
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China is willing to work with Ireland to implement consensus reached by leaders and be partners based on mutual trust, respect and support. China calls for building an equal and orderly multipolar world. China and the EU are key forces in a multipolar world and should collaborate to uphold UN authority, adhere to fundamental norms of international relations, oppose unilateralism, and reject resurgence of 'the law of the jungle'.

statements.speaker: People's Daily
statements.context: Editorial commentary on China-Europe relations
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China has always viewed China-EU relations from a strategic height and long-term perspective. China and the EU share broad common interests, with cooperation outweighing competition. Both sides should oppose unilateralism and protectionism, safeguard the international system with the UN at its core, and work together to promote an equal and orderly multipolar world based on equal rights, equal opportunities, and equal rules.

statements.speaker: People's Daily
statements.context: Editorial commentary on China-Europe relations
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China is a factor of certainty in a multipolar system and is firmly committed to being a constructive force in a changing world. China has always believed Europe is an important pole in a multipolar world and supports European integration and EU strategic autonomy. Both sides should cooperate rather than compete and oppose camp confrontation.

article_title: Xi Meets Thai PM & Sultan of Brunei - China-Pakistan Joint Statement

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Meeting with Sultan of Brunei Haji Hassanal Bolkiah Mu'izzaddin Waddaulah

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Meeting with Sultan of Brunei Haji Hassanal Bolkiah Mu'izzaddin Waddaulah
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China and Brunei should jointly advocate an equal and orderly multipolar world and a universally beneficial and inclusive economic globalization, safeguard international fairness and justice, and play a positive role in promoting global and regional peace and stability

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Meeting with Thai Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: In the face of profound changes unseen in a century, China and Thailand should consolidate strategic mutual trust, firmly support each other, and respond to uncertainties in the external environment with the stability and certainty of China-Thailand relations. China is ready to work with Thailand to align development strategies, expand mutually beneficial cooperation, and implement flagship projects such as the China-Thailand Railway

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Meeting with Thai Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China stands ready to work closely with Thailand to firmly defend the international system with the United Nations at its core and the international order based on international law, enhance unity and cooperation in the Global South, safeguard world peace and promote common development

statements.speaker: Li Qiang
statements.context: Meeting with Pakistan President Zardari
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China is ready to forge synergy between development strategies, jointly promote high-quality Belt and Road cooperation, advance construction of the China-Pakistan Economic Corridor, push forward construction of major projects concerning roads, railways and ports, deepen cooperation in agriculture, mining, new energy, information technology and artificial intelligence

statements.speaker: Li Qiang
statements.context: Meeting with Pakistan President Zardari
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China is willing to continue to support each other and strengthen coordination with Pakistan at multilateral forums in order to safeguard their respective sovereignty, security and development interests

statements.speaker: Li Qiang
statements.context: Meeting with Sultan of Brunei Hassanal
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China firmly supports ASEAN in strengthening unity and strategic autonomy, and is willing to work with ASEAN countries including Brunei to promote the building of a closer China-ASEAN community with a shared future

article_title: Xi Meets Zardari & Japarov - Boosting Self-reliance in Military Equipment - Li Wants Breakthroughs in Domestic Circulation, Tech & Industrial Upgrading - Cai Qi on Fighting Formalism

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Meeting with Pakistani President Asif Ali Zardari, reported in People's Daily
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China and Pakistan enjoy ironclad friendship and are all-weather strategic cooperative partners. China will support Pakistan firmly in safeguarding its sovereignty, independence and territorial integrity, in combating terrorism, and in following a development path suited to its national conditions.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Meeting with Kyrgyz President Sadyr Japarov, reported in People's Daily

China supports Kyrgyzstan in taking a development path that suits its national conditions and is willing to deepen cooperation. China hopes Kyrgyzstan will strengthen security measures for Chinese personnel, projects and institutions.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Meeting with Kyrgyz President Sadyr Japarov, reported in People's Daily
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China is willing to work closely with Kyrgyzstan to adhere to the Five Principles of Peaceful Coexistence, resist unilateralism and hegemony, strengthen multilateral cooperation, and safeguard the common interests of developing countries.

statements.speaker: Ministry of Foreign Affairs
statements.context: Official statement on Panama Canal issue, reported in People's Daily
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The United States has recently made irresponsible remarks on the Panama Canal issue, and intentionally distorted, attacked and mischaracterized relevant cooperation. China firmly opposes it and made stern demarches to the U.S. side.

statements.speaker: Lin Jian
statements.context: Official statement on Panama Canal issue, reported in People's Daily
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Cooperation between China and Panama under the framework of the BRI is carrying out normally and has achieved fruitful outcomes. China hopes relevant parties will strengthen confidence, resist external interruption, and make the right decision while keeping in mind the overall bilateral relations and the long-term interests of the people of the two countries.

statements.speaker: Lin Jian
statements.context: Official statement on Gaza ceasefire and Trump's Gaza remarks, reported in People's Daily
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China has all along believed that 'the Palestinians governing Palestine' is the fundamental principle of post-conflict governance of Gaza. We oppose the forced displacement of the people in Gaza, and hope that relevant parties will take the opportunity of the ceasefire and post-conflict governance in Gaza to bring the Palestinian question back to the right track of a political settlement based on the two-State solution.

statements.speaker: Li Qiang

The development of China-US relations has reached a new critical juncture. Xi comprehensively elaborated on China's policy toward the US, and Trump responded positively, expressing his expectation of maintaining a good relationship with Xi. Both teams must implement the important consensus reached by the two leaders, uphold the principles of mutual respect, peaceful coexistence, and win-win cooperation, maintain communication, manage differences, expand cooperation, and promote the stable, healthy, and sustainable development of China-US relations.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.speaker_title: State Councilor and Minister of Foreign Affairs
statements.context: Phone call with US Secretary of State Marco Rubio, readout published in People's Daily
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The leadership of the Communist Party of China is the choice of the Chinese people, and China's development follows a clear historical logic and possesses strong internal momentum. Our goal is to enable the people to live better lives and to contribute more significantly to the world. We have no intention of surpassing or replacing anyone, but we must defend our legitimate right to development.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.speaker_title: State Councilor and Minister of Foreign Affairs
statements.context: Phone call with US Secretary of State Marco Rubio, readout published in People's Daily
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Taiwan has been a part of China's territory since ancient times, and China will never allow Taiwan to be separated from the country. The US has made solemn commitments to the one-China policy in the three China-US Joint Communiqués and must not breach its word.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.speaker_title: State Councilor and Minister of Foreign Affairs
statements.context: Phone call with US Secretary of State Marco Rubio, readout published in People's Daily
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Major countries should act like major countries and should take on their due international responsibilities, safeguard world peace and help all countries achieve common development. He expressed hope that Rubio would conduct himself responsibly, playing a constructive role in the future of the peoples of China and the US, as well as in maintaining global peace and stability.

statements.speaker: Chen Dongxiao
statements.speaker_title: President of Shanghai Institutes for International Studies
statements.context: Theory page interview-based article in People's Daily on China as defender of international order
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Face of the United States beginning a new round of withdrawing from UN mechanisms, China has taken concrete actions to firmly support the United Nations and other organizations in playing a greater role in international affairs. For example, China strictly fulfills its obligations of the NPT and is the only one among the five nuclear-weapon states to pledge unconditionally not to use or threaten to use nuclear weapons against non-nuclear-weapon states and regions.

statements.speaker: Chen Dongxiao
statements.speaker_title: President of Shanghai Institutes for International Studies
statements.context: Theory page interview-based article in People's Daily on China as defender of international order
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Unity and cooperation are the only correct choices for maintaining international order stability and addressing global challenges. Currently, the 'new Cold War' mentality and hegemonic practices primarily damage international cooperation and mutual trust, exacerbate the risk of bloc confrontations in the international community, harm global partnerships, and make trust-building mechanisms difficult to establish. While some countries may appear to gain short-term benefits on specific issues, they ultimately will fall into a cycle of isolation and confrontation.

statements.speaker: Chen Dongxiao
statements.speaker_title: President of Shanghai Institutes for International Studies
statements.context: Theory page interview-based article in People's Daily on China as defender of international order
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The current world economic order is facing severe challenges of anti-globalisation and pan-securitisation. Advocating the construction of an open world economic system and promoting economic globalisation in a more open, inclusive, balanced and universally beneficial direction are important international public goods provided by China.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Video call meeting with Vladimir Putin
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Xi stressed readiness to work with Putin to guide China-Russia relations to a new height in 2025, to respond to external uncertainties with stability and resilience of China-Russia ties, to defend legitimate interests, and to uphold international fairness and justice. Noted the need to jointly safeguard the UN-centered international system.

statements.speaker: Ding Xuexiang
statements.context: Speech at World Economic Forum in Davos
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Economic globalization is an overwhelming trend of history demonstrating strong resilience. Protectionism leads nowhere and trade war has no winners. Called for multilateralism, WTO-centered trading system, equal rights and opportunities for all countries, and joint fostering of new drivers for global economic development including AI, quantum technology and biomedicine.

statements.speaker: Ding Xuexiang
statements.context: Speech at World Economic Forum in Davos
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China's door of opening up will not be closed and will only open even wider. Welcomed foreign enterprises to invest and do business in China. Highlighted improvements in IPR protection, government procurement, cross-border data flow, and business environment. China lifted all restrictions on foreign investment in manufacturing and established negative-list system for cross-border trade in services.
statements.topic: economic policy, foreign investment, trade liberalization

statements.speaker: Ding Xuexiang
statements.context: Speech at World Economic Forum in Davos
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: On Chinese economy: it has rebounded and turned for the better. Headwinds due to external environment and temporary pains from economic restructuring. China will increase intensity of macroeconomic policies with more proactive fiscal policy and moderately loose monetary policy.

statements.speaker: Ding Xuexiang
statements.context: Speech at World Economic Forum in Davos
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China's pursuit of green transition is a long-term commitment rather than expediency. No matter how international landscape evolves, China's determination for climate response will not change. Built world's largest and most complete new energy industry chain with 70% of global photovoltaic components and 60% of wind power equipment from China.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Phone call with Celso Amorim, special advisor to Brazil's president
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China supports Brazil in assuming BRICS presidency and pushing for new achievements in greater BRICS cooperation. China supports Brazil in hosting UN climate change conference. On Ukraine: the 'six-point consensus' jointly issued by China and Brazil and establishment of 'Friends of Peace' platform are to gather consensus from Global South and create conditions for peace talks.

statements.speaker: Liu Jianchao
statements.context: Meeting with Bangladesh interim government's Advisor for Foreign Affairs Touhid Hossain
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China supports Bangladeshi people in choosing their own development path and supports interim government in advancing political reform and election agenda. China willing to work with Bangladesh to promote Belt and Road cooperation and develop China-Bangladesh comprehensive strategic partnership. CPC willing to maintain friendly exchanges with all political parties in Bangladesh.

statements.speaker: CPC Politburo
statements.context: Politburo meeting on January 20, 2025
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The meeting affirmed the work of five party groups and agreed with their work arrangements for 2025. In the new year, the five Party Groups must take Xi Jinping Thought as their guide, adhere to the centralized and unified leadership of the Party Central Committee, ensure unity of thought and consistency of direction, establish correct political achievement views, prioritize action and strive for progress, work together to promote reform and breakthroughs, steadily advance high-quality development, and demonstrate new responsibilities on the new journey of comprehensively advancing Chinese-style modernization.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Speech at meeting with non-CPC political parties, ACFIC, and non-party personages ahead of Spring Festival
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: 2024 was a year to overcome difficulties and forge ahead steadfastly. The CPC Central Committee united and led the people, responding calmly and implementing comprehensive measures, successfully completing main economic and social development objectives. Chinese-style modernization took new solid steps. The Chinese economy rebounded and improved with GDP growth of 5%. We strengthened independent innovation, achieved breakthroughs in science and technology frontiers, and powerfully drove new quality productive forces. We deepened comprehensive reform, provided solid livelihood protection, coordinated development and security, and deeply advanced major-country diplomacy with Chinese characteristics, injecting positive energy into maintaining world peace and stability and promoting human development and progress.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Speech at meeting with non-CPC political parties, ACFIC, and non-party personages ahead of Spring Festival
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: 2025 is the final year of the 14th Five-Year Plan. We must adhere to the general tone of seeking progress while maintaining stability, implement more proactive and impactful macro policies, focus wholeheartedly on promoting high-quality development, promote high-level scientific and technological self-reliance and self-strengthening, maintain sound momentum in economic and social development, successfully complete the 14th Five-Year Plan objectives and tasks, and lay a solid foundation for a good start to the 15th Five-Year Plan.

statements.speaker: Li Qiang
statements.context: Symposium with experts, entrepreneurs and representatives from education, science, culture, health and sports fields
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: In the past year, under the strong leadership of the Party Central Committee with Xi Jinping as the core, the entire country has worked hard and overcome difficulties. The overall economic operation has been stable and steady, and main development goals and tasks have been successfully completed. High-quality development has been steadily promoted. At the same time, China's development still faces many difficulties and challenges, especially rising uncertain and unstable factors in the external environment. We must accurately grasp the situation and be good at turning crises into opportunities. China possesses comprehensive advantages in systems, markets, industries, and talents. The basic trend of long-term economic improvement has not changed and will not change. As long as we unswervingly manage our own affairs well, we will surely promote stable and healthy development of the Chinese economy.

statements.speaker: Li Qiang
statements.context: Symposium with experts, entrepreneurs and representatives from education, science, culture, health and sports fields
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: It is necessary to implement a more proactive fiscal policy and a moderately loose monetary policy. Fiscal policy should proactively exert force in advance and form actual expenditure as soon as possible, monetary policy should maintain abundant liquidity and promote funds to fully flow to the real economy. It is necessary to further deepen reform and expand opening up, clear bottlenecks and blockages around expanding and strengthening the domestic circulation, create a first-class business environment, and stimulate the vitality of various business entities. It is necessary to expand independent opening up and unilateral opening up in an orderly manner.
statements.topic: economic policy, trade and opening up

statements.speaker: Han Zheng
statements.speaker_title: Special representative of President Xi Jinping
statements.context: Meeting with U.S. Vice President-elect J.D. Vance in Washington
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Han conveyed Xi's greetings to Trump and congratulated Vance on his election. Xi recently had an important phone call with Trump, during which the two leaders reached many important consensuses on the development of China-U.S. relations in the next stage. China is ready to work with the United States to adhere to the strategic guidance of head-of-state diplomacy and follow through on the important consensus reached between Xi and Trump, so as to push for the steady, healthy and sustainable development of bilateral ties.

statements.speaker: Han Zheng
statements.speaker_title: Special representative of President Xi Jinping
statements.context: Meeting with U.S. Vice President-elect J.D. Vance in Washington
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The two sides are currently working hard to achieve their respective development goals and dreams. As long as the two sides uphold the principles of mutual respect, peaceful coexistence and win-win cooperation, they will contribute to each other's progress, bring benefits to the two countries, and make important contributions to world peace and development. Economic and trade relations are important issues of common concern to both sides. Despite differences and frictions between China and the United States, they share huge common interests and space for cooperation, and the two sides can strengthen dialogue and consultation in this regard.
statements.topic: US-China relations, economic and trade cooperation

statements.speaker: Han Zheng
statements.speaker_title: Special representative of President Xi Jinping
statements.context: Meeting with representatives of the U.S. business community in Washington
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: A good start and stable development of China-U.S. relations align with the common well-being of both peoples and meet the shared expectation of the international community. The U.S. business community has been a participant, witness, contributor and beneficiary of China-U.S. economic and trade cooperation as well as China's reform and opening-up. China will unswervingly advance reform and opening-up, and continue to improve and optimize the business environment. It is hoped that U.S. companies will continue to invest and take root in China, play an active role as a bridge, and make greater contribution to the development of China-U.S. relations.
statements.topic: US-China relations, US business investment in China, trade

statements.speaker: Mao Ning
statements.context: Statement on Nigeria becoming BRICS partner country
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Nigeria is a major developing country and a significant country of the Global South. The country's participation in BRICS cooperation will serve Nigeria's development, the common interests of BRICS members and partners, and those of the Global South, and will make contributions to the development of the BRICS mechanism. The inclusion of a new partner country marks an expansion of BRICS representativeness, widening its appeal and influence.

statements.speaker: Mao Ning
statements.context: Statement on Myanmar ceasefire agreement
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Under China's mediation, the Myanmar government and MNDAA held their seventh round of peace talks in Kunming and reached a ceasefire agreement. The easing of tensions in northern Myanmar is in the common interests of various parties in Myanmar and regional nations, and will contribute to the security, stability and development of the China-Myanmar border area. China and Myanmar are friendly neighbors, and China firmly opposes any conflict or unrest in Myanmar. It is hoped that all parties would maintain the momentum of the ceasefire and peace talks, earnestly implement consensus reached, de-escalate tensions proactively, and resolve related issues through further dialogues and consultations. China will firmly support Myanmar's efforts to safeguard its independence, sovereignty, national unity, and territorial integrity, secure domestic peace, stability, and economic development, and achieve political reconciliation and advance its domestic political agenda within the constitutional framework. China will continue to actively promote peace talks and provide support and assistance for the peace process in northern Myanmar.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Phone call with US president-elect Donald Trump on Friday, reported by Xinhua
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Xi congratulated Trump on re-election and expressed that both he and Trump attach great importance to interaction with each other, hope that China-U.S. ties will have a good start in the new U.S. presidential term, and stand ready to push China-U.S. relations to make greater progress. Xi stressed that both countries are pursuing their own dreams and committed to making lives of their people better, share extensive common interests and broad space for cooperation, and can become partners and friends. Xi said it is inevitable that the two major countries have some differences, and the key is to respect each other's core interests and major concerns. He stressed that the Taiwan question concerns China's national sovereignty and territorial integrity, and hoped the U.S. side handles it with caution. Xi said the nature of China-U.S. economic and trade relations is mutually beneficial and win-win, and confrontation and conflict should not be the choice of the two countries. He called on both sides to step up cooperation based on principles of mutual respect, peaceful coexistence and win-win cooperation.

statements.speaker: Xinhua
statements.context: News report on Xi-Trump phone call
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Reported that Xi and Trump exchanged views on major international and regional issues of common concern, such as the Ukraine crisis and the Israel-Palestine conflict, and agreed to establish strategic communication channels and maintain regular contact on major issues of common concern.

statements.speaker: Southern Theatre Command

statements.quote_or_paraphrase: 'Any military activity that stirs up trouble in the South China Sea is within our control'

statements.speaker: Ministry of Foreign Affairs
statements.context: Official statement regarding Vice President Han Zheng's attendance at Trump's inauguration
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China follows the principles of mutual respect, peaceful coexistence and win-win cooperation in viewing and growing its relationship with the United States. We stand ready to work with the new U.S. government to enhance dialogue and communication, properly manage differences, expand mutually beneficial cooperation, jointly pursue a stable, healthy and sustainable China-U.S. relationship and find the right way for the two countries to get along with each other.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with ASEAN ambassadors in China
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China will continue to firmly support ASEAN's centrality, and is willing to work with ASEAN to maintain the healthy and sustainable development momentum of China-ASEAN relations and continue to contribute to regional peaceful development. We are ready to deepen our partnership with ASEAN countries, advancing from peaceful coexistence to a shared future, and playing a leading role in building a community with a shared future for humanity.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with ASEAN ambassadors in China
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Recent vicious cases of online gambling and telecom fraud along the Thailand-Myanmar border have threatened and harmed the vital interests of citizens of China and other countries. China is willing to strengthen bilateral and multilateral cooperation on law enforcement and security with ASEAN countries to provide a safe environment for people-to-people exchanges and sound order of cooperation among neighboring countries.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Phone call with European Council President Antonio Costa, reported by Xinhua in People's Daily
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China and Europe have no fundamental conflicts of interest or geopolitical contradictions, and are partners of mutual achievement. The key lies in respecting each other's choice of social systems and development paths, as well as each other's core interests and major concerns. China regards Europe as an important pole in a multipolar world and firmly supports European integration and the EU's pursuit of strategic autonomy.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Phone call with European Council President Antonio Costa, reported by Xinhua in People's Daily
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The economic and trade cooperation between China and the EU is mutually complementary and beneficial. Both sides serve as defenders of the multilateral trading system and have formed a strong economic symbiotic relationship. China remains committed to high-quality development and high-level opening up, which will bring new opportunities for China-EU cooperation.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with Japanese ruling coalition delegation, reported in People's Daily
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Last November, President Xi Jinping met with Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba and reached an important consensus on comprehensively promoting the China-Japan strategic and mutually beneficial relationship and striving to build a constructive and stable China-Japan relationship that meets the requirements of the new era. At present, China-Japan relations are facing an important opportunity for improvement and development.

statements.speaker: Wang Huning
statements.context: Meeting with Japanese ruling coalition delegation led by Liberal Democratic Party and Komeito Party secretaries general, reported in People's Daily
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The ruling parties of the two countries should carry out in-depth exchanges, deliver on the common understandings between the two countries' leaders, make joint efforts to develop bilateral relations, and promote the prosperity and development of the region and the world. The CPPCC National Committee is ready to make positive contributions to this end.

statements.speaker: Liu Jianchao
statements.speaker_title: International Department of the CPC Central Committee Chief
statements.context: Ninth meeting of China-Japan ruling party exchange mechanism, reported in People's Daily
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China is willing to work with Japan to implement the important consensus reached by the leaders of the two countries, adhere to peaceful coexistence, harmonious symbiosis, and harmony amid diversity, and promote the building of a constructive and stable China-Japan relationship that meets the requirements of the new era. The ruling parties of the two countries should strengthen dialogue and communication and take concrete actions to promote the sound and stable development of China-Japan relations.

statements.speaker: Zhong Sheng
statements.context: People's Daily commentary on China-US ties
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Under the current circumstances, the common interests between China and the United States have not decreased but have instead increased. This is a shared perception among the vast majority of businesses and people in both countries and serves as an important foundation for both sides to move towards each other and engage in mutually beneficial cooperation.

statements.speaker: Zhong Sheng
statements.context: People's Daily commentary on China-US ties
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: No matter from which angle we look at Sino-US relations, we can find that China and the United States have extensive common interests, and mutual benefit and win-win are the essential characteristics of Sino-US relations. China has proposed that both sides should uphold the principles of mutual respect, peaceful coexistence, and win-win cooperation to find a correct way for China-U.S. relations in the new era.

statements.speaker: Zhong Sheng
statements.context: People's Daily commentary on China-US ties
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The interests of China and the US are deeply intertwined, and it is normal for contradictions and differences to arise, but this should not become an obstacle to the two countries' cooperation. Both sides should respect each other, seek common ground while reserving differences, and adopt constructive ways to enhance understanding and expand consensus. Starting tariff wars, trade wars, and technology wars for various reasons goes against historical trends and economic laws, and there will be no winners.

statements.speaker: Geng Shuang
statements.speaker_title: Deputy Permanent Representative to the United Nations
statements.context: Speech at policy dialogue meeting on Global Development Initiative at UN Headquarters, New York, January 9
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Over the past three years, the Global Development Initiative has evolved from a Chinese proposal to an international consensus, from a concept of cooperation to collective action, benefiting many developing countries. Hope that the Group of Friends of the GDI and the UN System Working Group would work together, remain steadfast in upholding multilateralism, stay focused on the development agenda, and strengthen partnerships to make greater contributions to the implementation of the 2030 Agenda.

statements.speaker: Ministry of Commerce
statements.context: Official statement on trade barriers probe initiated in July 2024, conclusion announced in January 2025
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The EU's practices in its foreign subsidy investigations against Chinese enterprises have constituted trade and investment barriers. The EU's investigations involved unreasonable practices that violated WTO core principles including non-discrimination. Regulations were 'selectively enforced,' criteria for determining foreign subsidies were vague, scope was overly broad, and key concepts were defined in a 'subjective and arbitrary' manner. Chinese enterprises incurred significant economic losses including approximately 7.6 billion yuan in abandoned bidding projects. The ministry will take measures including bilateral consultations to urge the European side to adjust or change relevant practices.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with Nigerian President Bola Ahmed Tinubu and Foreign Minister Yusuf Maitama Tuggar; press conference
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China opposes external forces interfering in the internal affairs of African countries in any form. China will not allow hegemonism and power politics to disrupt Africa. China's vote in the United Nations Security Council will always belong to Africa. China practices genuine multilateralism and will continue to speak out for the reasonable demands of African countries in multilateral forums.

statements.speaker: He Lifeng
statements.speaker_title: Vice Premier / Lead Official for China-US Economic and Trade Affairs
statements.context: Video call with US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Both sides agreed to maintain communication, manage differences and continue stabilization of China-U.S. economic relations during the political transition period in the U.S. The Chinese side expressed concern over U.S. economic and trade restrictions on China and clarified China's position concerning the recent trade investigation initiated by the U.S. side.

statements.speaker: Wang Xiaohong
statements.speaker_title: Councilor and Director of the China National Narcotic Control Committee
statements.context: Conversation with Rahul Gupta, director of the White House Office of National Drug Control Policy
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Under the strategic guidance of the two heads of state, China-U.S. cooperation on drug control has made positive progress over the past year. The two sides should adhere to the correct strategic perception, treat each other as equals, engage in dialogue and cooperation, and promote steady and long-term cooperation in drug control and law enforcement. Wang also expressed hope that the U.S. side will show more sincerity for cooperation, and respect and address China's concerns.

statements.speaker: Ministry of Commerce
statements.context: Official statement on US adding 11 Chinese companies to Entity List
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China's Ministry of Commerce firmly objects to the U.S. move to add 11 Chinese firms to its export control 'entity list' on so-called military-related grounds. For a long time, the United States has generalized the concept of national security, abused export control measures and suppressed and contained other entities, which has seriously harmed the legitimate rights and interests of relevant entities, undermined the security and stability of global industrial and supply chains, and hindered the recovery and development of the world economy. China urges the U.S. side to immediately stop its wrong practices, and the country will take necessary measures to safeguard the legitimate rights and interests of Chinese entities.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.speaker_title: General Secretary of the CPC Central Committee
statements.context: Speech at the Fourth Plenary Session of the 20th CCDI of the CPC
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The fight against corruption must remain unswerving; any hesitation and wavering, laxity and softness, or abandoning midway would constitute subversive mistakes. The current situation of the fight against corruption remains grim and complex.

statements.speaker: Ministry of Foreign Affairs
statements.context: Official statement on Indonesia's entry into BRICS
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Indonesia's official entry into BRICS serves the common interests of BRICS countries and the Global South. China stands ready to work with Indonesia and other BRICS members to jointly build a more comprehensive, close, practical and inclusive partnership.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
