statements.context: Meeting with Brazilian President, enumeration of four points
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: We must share a common destiny and consolidate strategic mutual trust. We must firmly support each other on issues involving core interests such as sovereignty, security, and territorial integrity, and become strategic partners that trust each other and a model of solidarity among Global South countries.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Meeting with Brazilian President, enumeration of four points
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: We must develop together and deepen linkages between our development strategies. We must seize the historical opportunity of building interlinkages between the BRI and Brazil's development strategy, deepen cooperation in economy, trade, infrastructure, finance, science and technology, and environmental protection, and strengthen cooperation in aerospace, agricultural science and technology, and clean energy.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Meeting with Brazilian President, enumeration of four points
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: We must share responsibilities and demonstrate the strength of China and Brazil in maintaining world peace and justice. We must practice true multilateralism, make fair remarks and take fair actions. China attaches great importance to Brazil's international status and influence and supports Brazil in playing a greater role on the international stage. China stands ready to strengthen communication and coordination with Brazil at the United Nations, BRICS and other multilateral mechanisms.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Meeting with Brazilian President, enumeration of four points
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: We must share weal and woe and make distinctive contributions to building a community with a shared future for mankind. China and Brazil should take the lead in conducting consultations, promoting global solidarity, jointly addressing global challenges concerning the future of mankind, and strengthening cooperation in green transformation, sustainable development, climate change, and AI governance.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Joint press conference with Brazilian President
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The world today is far from being tranquil. Many regions are still suffering from conflicts, turmoil and insecurity. Humanity is an indivisible community of security. Only by embracing the vision of common, comprehensive, cooperative and sustainable security can countries find a path to universal security. China and Brazil jointly issued consensus on political settlement of the Ukraine crisis and launched the group of Friends for Peace.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Joint press conference with Brazilian President
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The two sides are deeply concerned about the continued expansion of the conflict in Gaza, and call for realizing a ceasefire and end of hostilities as early as possible, implementing the two-State solution, and working tirelessly for a comprehensive, just and lasting settlement of the Palestinian question.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Joint press conference with Brazilian President
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China and Brazil share a tradition and responsibility in upholding justice and moral principles. China will work with Brazil to continually enrich the China-Brazil community with a shared future. Together, the two sides will firmly defend true multilateralism, send a powerful message on pursuing development, cooperation and justice and rejecting poverty, confrontation and hegemonism.

statements.speaker: Cyberspace Administration of China (CAC)
statements.context: Official statement on Global Cooperation Initiative on Cross-Border Data Flows
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: While promoting global cross-border data flows, countries are primarily concerned with risks related to national security, public interests, personal privacy, and intellectual property. The international community should fully respect the different policies and practices adopted by various countries and regions based on their specific conditions. It is crucial to work toward building consensus on cross-border data flow rules through consultation.

statements.speaker: Cyberspace Administration of China (CAC)
statements.context: Official statement on Global Cooperation Initiative on Cross-Border Data Flows
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Governments should encourage electronic cross-border data transmission to meet the needs of business and social activities. This will help global e-commerce and digital trade serve as new drivers for economic growth and sustainable development.

statements.speaker: Cyberspace Administration of China (CAC)
statements.context: Official statement on Global Cooperation Initiative on Cross-Border Data Flows
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Governments should respect the regulatory differences of various countries and regions in cross-border data flows. They should support free data flows that do not violate national security, public interests, and personal privacy. Regulations should be permitted when they aim to achieve legitimate public policy objectives on the premise that such measures do not constitute arbitrary discrimination or disguised restrictions on international trade.

statements.speaker: Cyberspace Administration of China (CAC)
statements.context: Official statement on Global Cooperation Initiative on Cross-Border Data Flows
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Governments should oppose overstretching the concept of national security on data issues. They should object to making restrictive and differentiated policies on cross-border data flows targeting specific countries and enterprises without factual evidence, or implementing discriminatory restrictions and prohibitions against specific countries and enterprises.

statements.speaker: Cyberspace Administration of China (CAC)
statements.context: Official statement on Global Cooperation Initiative on Cross-Border Data Flows
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Governments should prohibit illicit acquisition of data through methods such as setting up backdoors in digital products and services or exploiting vulnerabilities in digital technology infrastructure. They should collaborate to crack down on cross-border illegal activities in the data field.

statements.speaker: Liu Jianchao
statements.speaker_title: Minister of the International Department of the Communist Party of China (ILD Chief)
statements.context: Meeting with delegation of Communist Party of Nepal (UML), led by Ishwor Pokhrel
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China has always viewed and developed China-Nepal relations from a strategic and long-term perspective. China is willing to strengthen high-level exchanges with Nepal, enhance strategic communication, firmly support each other on issues involving each other's core interests, and deepen cooperation in areas such as BRI joint development. China welcomes Nepal's participation in the second Global South Think Tank Dialogue.

statements.speaker: Liu Jianchao
statements.speaker_title: Minister of the International Department of the Communist Party of China (ILD Chief)
statements.context: Meeting with delegation of Communist Party of Nepal (UML), led by Ishwor Pokhrel
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The CPC is willing to deepen exchanges at all levels with the CPN (UML), strengthen political mutual trust, enhance the exchange and mutual learning of governance experience, and promote pragmatic cooperation in various fields. The CPC supports Nepal in choosing a development path that aligns with its national conditions.

article_title: Xi at G20: If China Can Make it, Other Developing Countries Can Too - Jaishankar-Wang Meeting Analysis - Xi Meets Macron, Scholz, Milei, Arce & Sheinbaum - Zhong Sheng Commentary on US Ties

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: G20 Summit Session I in Rio de Janeiro
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: To build a just world, we need an open, inclusive and non-discriminatory environment for international economic cooperation. We should promote universally beneficial and inclusive economic globalization. We need to stay committed to multilateralism and uphold the UN-centered international system and international order based on international law.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Meeting with French President Emmanuel Macron at G20 sidelines in Rio
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Both China and France are independent, mature and responsible major countries. The relationship has unique strategic value and global significance. Both sides should deepen strategic communication and strengthen mutual support. China is willing to continue close high-level exchanges with France and deepen exchanges and cooperation in humanities fields. The Third Plenary Session has opened a new round of reform and opening up in China, which will provide new opportunities for China-France cooperation.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Meeting with French President Emmanuel Macron at G20 sidelines in Rio
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Regarding Ukraine: China hopes to see the conflict situation eased, does not wish to see the crisis spill over or the war escalate, and will continue to play a constructive role in its own way to promote a ceasefire and the cessation of hostilities.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Meeting with German Chancellor Olaf Scholz at G20 in Rio
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China and Germany should persist in consolidating their comprehensive strategic partnership. China's policy toward Germany maintains high stability and continuity. China values Germany as an important partner in advancing Chinese-style modernization and will continue to provide broad market opportunities for German enterprises. Regarding EU tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles: China has always insisted on resolving differences through dialogue and consultation, and hopes Germany will continue to play an important role in this.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Meeting with Argentine President Javier Milei at G20 in Rio
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China values the traditional friendship between the peoples of the two countries and supports Argentina in exploring a development path suited to its national conditions through reform. China is willing to work with Argentina to promote the long-term stable development of the China-Argentina comprehensive strategic partnership. Argentina is welcome to seize important opportunities brought by China's high-level opening up to the outside world and further expand its market share in China.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China and Russia should work with BRICS partners to implement the outcomes of the BRICS Kazan Summit, expand and strengthen the BRICS mechanism, enhance the influence of the Global South, and play a greater role in world multipolarization. China has taken over the presidency of the SCO and is willing to work closely with Russia to promote greater development of the SCO. Next year marks the 80th anniversary of the victory of the World Anti-Fascist War. China and Russia should jointly organize commemorative activities and firmly defend the results of the Second World War and international fairness and justice.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with Indian External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The successful meeting between President Xi Jinping and Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Kazan and the restart of China-India relations are in line with the fundamental interests of the two peoples and the expectations of Global South countries. The two sides should implement the important consensus reached by the two heads of state, respect each other's core interests, enhance mutual trust through dialogue and communication, handle differences properly with sincerity and integrity. China and India, as two neighbouring major developing countries, have more common interests than differences, and they should view each other's development as an opportunity and work together to achieve common development.

statements.speaker: People's Daily (Zhong Sheng commentary)
statements.context: Editorial commentary on Xi-Biden meeting
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: President Xi Jinping expounded on strategic, directional, and guiding opinions on the development of China-US relations, proposing that the two countries should respect each other, coexist peacefully, and cooperate for win-win results. He clearly outlined China's four red lines regarding the Taiwan issue, democracy and human rights, the choice of path and system, and development rights.

statements.speaker: People's Daily (Zhong Sheng commentary)
statements.context: Editorial commentary on China-US relations
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Strategic perception is the fundamental and overarching issue in Sino-US relations. The 'Thucydides Trap' is not a historical destiny, and a 'new Cold War' cannot be fought or won. Containment of China is unwise, undesirable, and will not succeed. If the two countries are partners and seek common ground while reserving differences, Sino-US relations will be able to achieve substantial development. The One China principle and the three China-US Joint Communiques are the political foundation of bilateral relations and must be strictly observed.

statements.speaker: People's Daily (Zhong Sheng commentary)
statements.context: Editorial commentary on China-US economic relations
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The interests of China and the United States are deeply intertwined, and the space for cooperation is infinite. Trade volume exceeds $660 billion. More than 70,000 American companies in China have annual profits of $50 billion. Exports to China support 930,000 jobs in the United States. The common interests of China and the United States have not decreased, but rather increased. China and the United States should always focus on the well-being of the people of the two countries and achieve win-win cooperation.

statements.speaker: People's Daily (Zhong Sheng commentary)
statements.context: Editorial commentary on China-US relations
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: To achieve a smooth transition in China-US relations, both sides need to uphold the already agreed-upon guiding principles, i.e., mutual respect, peaceful coexistence, maintaining communication, preventing conflict, adhering to the UN Charter, cooperating in areas of common interest. At present, China-US relations once again stand at a crossroads. It is hoped that the US side will meet China halfway, continue to explore the correct way for two major powers to get along, achieve long-term peaceful coexistence between China and the US on this planet.

statements.speaker: People's Daily (Jin Sheping article)
statements.context: Commentary on economic globalization
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: For some time, certain people in the US and the West have exaggerated the so-called 'Chinese new energy overcapacity theory', which in essence is a 'development anxiety theory' and a 'zero-sum game theory', which harms others and benefits no one. Unilateralism and protectionism offer no way forward, and 'small yards with high walls' will only trap oneself. China is a beneficiary of economic globalization and a firm promoter, because 'when the world is good, China will be good; when China is good, the world will be even better'.

article_title: Xi's G20 Speech - Xi Meets Starmer & Albanese - Wang Huning on Spreading China's Voice - Song Tao Meets Wang Jin-pyng

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Speech at G20 summit in Brazil
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The G20 needs to build on past achievements and act as a force to improve global governance. Mankind lives in a community with a shared future; countries should see each other's development as opportunities rather than challenges, and view each other as partners rather than rivals. Countries should observe basic norms of international relations underpinned by UN Charter purposes and principles, and defend the international order based on international law.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Speech at G20 summit in Brazil - point on global trade governance
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: We should place development at the center of the international economic and trade agenda, steadily advance trade and investment liberalization and facilitation, reform the WTO, oppose unilateralism and protectionism, restore the dispute settlement mechanism, avoid politicizing economic issues, avoid fragmenting the global market, and avoid taking protectionist moves in the name of green and low-carbon development.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Speech at G20 summit in Brazil - point on global digital governance
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: We should step up international governance and cooperation on artificial intelligence to make sure that AI is for good and for all, not a game of the rich countries and the wealthy. China hosted the 2024 World AI Conference and promoted the adoption of a UN General Assembly resolution on enhancing international cooperation on AI capacity-building. China will hold another world AI conference in 2025 and welcomes the participation of fellow G20 members.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Bilateral meeting with British Prime Minister Keir Starmer on the sidelines of the G20 summit in Rio
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The world has entered a new period of turbulence and transformation. China and Britain, both as permanent members of the UN Security Council and major global economies, share the responsibilities of advancing their respective national development and addressing global challenges. Both countries should stick to their strategic partnership, adhere to principles of mutual respect, open cooperation, and mutual learning, strive for mutual benefit and win-win outcomes. While the two countries differ in history, culture, values, and social systems, they share extensive common interests. Both sides should view each other's development rationally and objectively, strengthen strategic communication, enhance political mutual trust, and ensure China-UK relations remain stable, practical, and long-lasting. The two countries have extensive room for cooperation in trade and investment, clean energy, financial services, and healthcare.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Bilateral meeting with Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese on the sidelines of the G20 summit in Rio
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Over the past year, the two countries have maintained close communication and exchanges at all levels and made positive progress. There is no fundamental conflict of interests between China and Australia. As long as the two sides insist on mutual respect, equality, and seeking common ground while reserving differences, China-Australia relations will surely develop well. China is willing to work with Australia to promote the construction of a more mature, stable and fruitful China-Australia comprehensive strategic partnership. Both sides should continue to expand the pattern of mutually beneficial and win-win cooperation. China is willing to import more high-quality Australian products and encourages Chinese enterprises to invest and do business in Australia. Both China and Australia are supporters and defenders of economic globalization and free trade. The two sides should strengthen coordination and cooperation, oppose protectionism, and promote the sharing of opportunities and benefits through openness to achieve common development.

statements.speaker: Li Qiang
statements.context: Visit to the China Construction Technology Exhibition in Beijing
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China's housing situation is shifting from addressing 'whether there is housing' to focusing on 'how good the housing is'. Housing development should take into account functionality, quality, and experience, addressing the diverse needs of people with different living habits, age groups, and economic capacities, especially new demands such as elder-friendly and child-friendly housing. Efforts should be tailored to local conditions to promote the construction of quality housing. Urban renewal is an important task for ongoing urban construction. Efforts should combine the improvement of people's livelihoods with the expansion of domestic demand, and strengthen renovation of old urban residential compounds, urban villages and dilapidated houses.

statements.speaker: Wang Huning
statements.context: Remarks at the China Overseas Friendship Association executive directors' meeting in Beijing
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: To do a good job with overseas friendship work with Hong Kong, Macau, Taiwan in the new era, we must take Xi Jinping Thought on Socialism with Chinese Characteristics for a New Era as the guide, adhere to great unity and great solidarity, adhere to holding high the banner of patriotism, adhere to playing the role of Hong Kong, Macau, Taiwan and overseas united front work in winning hearts and minds. We should make better contributions to the long-term prosperity and stability of Hong Kong and Macau, fully and accurately implement the 'one country, two systems' policy and the Basic Law. We should better unite our hearts and minds to achieve the complete reunification of the motherland, adhere to the one-China principle and the '1992 Consensus', do more to promote cross-strait economic and cultural exchanges and cooperation, and resolutely oppose 'Taiwan independence' separatist activities and external interference.
statements.topic: Taiwan, Hong Kong, Macau, internal affairs

statements.speaker: Song Tao
statements.context: Meeting with Wang Jin-pyng, former leader of Taiwan legislature
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: General Secretary Xi Jinping's important speech during his visit to Fujian pointed out the direction for exploring a new path for cross-strait integration and development, promoting cross-strait cultural exchanges, and enhancing identification and affinity between compatriots. We will earnestly implement the spirit of General Secretary Xi Jinping's important speech, adhere to the one-China Principle, resolutely oppose 'Taiwan independence' separatism, jointly promote Chinese culture, strengthen the national confidence of being upright Chinese people, advance the unification of the motherland, and work together to achieve the great rejuvenation of the Chinese nation.

article_title: Xi Pitches for 'Open & Interconnected' Asia-Pacific - Biden-Xi Meeting Breakdown - Xi's Bilaterals in Lima - China Taiping's Party Committee on Finance Priorities

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Speech at APEC Leaders Summit
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Unbridled unilateralism and protectionism and an increasingly fragmented world economy threaten to reverse the trend toward economic globalization. The attempt to block economic cooperation under all sorts of pretexts and break up the interdependence of the world is nothing but backpedaling.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Speech at APEC CEOs Summit
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: We must reject the beaten path that a few countries have taken to pursue dominance and hegemony. We should see to it that economic globalization generates more positive outcomes and is taken to a new phase that is more dynamic, inclusive and sustainable.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Bilateral meeting with US President Joe Biden at APEC
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The Thucydides's Trap is not a historical inevitability. A new Cold War should not be fought and cannot be won. Containing China is unwise, unacceptable and bound to fail.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Bilateral meeting with US President Joe Biden at APEC
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: It is important to match words with actions. A man cannot establish himself without credibility. China has always honored its words. If the U.S. side always says one thing but does another, it will be detrimental to its own image, and undermine trust between China and the United States.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Bilateral meeting with US President Joe Biden at APEC
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: It is important to treat each other as equals. As two major countries, neither China nor the United States should seek to remodel the other according to one's own will, suppress the other from the so-called 'position of strength', or deprive the other of the legitimate right to development so as to maintain its leading status.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Bilateral meeting with US President Joe Biden at APEC
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: It is important not to challenge red lines and paramount principles. The Taiwan question, democracy and human rights, China's path and system, and China's development right are four red lines for China. They must not be challenged. These are the most important guardrails and safety nets for China-U.S. relations.
statements.topic: Taiwan, human rights, and red lines

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Bilateral meeting with US President Joe Biden at APEC
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Cross-Strait peace and stability and 'Taiwan independence' separatist activities are irreconcilable as water and fire. If the U.S side cares about maintaining peace across the Taiwan Strait, it is crucial that it sees clearly the true nature of Lai Ching-te and the DPP authorities in seeking 'Taiwan independence', handles the Taiwan question with extra prudence, unequivocally opposes 'Taiwan independence', and supports China's peaceful reunification.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Bilateral meeting with US President Joe Biden at APEC
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The Chinese people's right to development is not to be deprived of or ignored. While all countries need to safeguard their national security, they should not overstretch the national security concept, still less use it as a pretext for malicious moves to constrain and contain other countries.
statements.topic: US technology restrictions and national security justifications

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Bilateral meeting with US President Joe Biden at APEC
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China firmly upholds its territory, sovereignty and maritime rights and interests in the South China Sea. Dialogue and consultation between states concerned is always the best way to manage differences in the South China Sea. The United States should not get involved in bilateral disputes over the relevant islands and reefs of Nansha Qundao, nor should it aid or abet the impulsion to make provocations.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Bilateral meeting with US President Joe Biden at APEC
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: When the two countries treat each other as partner and seek common ground while shelving differences, their relationship will make considerable progress. But if they regard each other as rival and pursue vicious competition, they will roil the relationship or even set it back. Neither decoupling nor supply-chain disruption is the solution; common development can only be achieved through mutually beneficial cooperation.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Bilateral meeting with US President Joe Biden at APEC
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: 'Small yard, high fences' is not what a major country should do; only openness and sharing can advance the well-being of humanity. A stable China-U.S. relationship is critical not only to the interests of the Chinese and American peoples, but also to the future and destiny of the entire humanity.

statements.speaker: Ministry of Foreign Affairs
statements.context: Official explanatory statement following Xi-Biden bilateral meeting
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: President Xi vividly compared the relationship between China and the U.S. to a mansion. He proposed in 2021 during the virtual meeting with President Biden that the two countries need to follow the principles of mutual respect, peaceful coexistence and win-win cooperation, which is the dome of the mansion. During the 2022 Bali meeting, he underscored China's four red lines on the Taiwan question, path and system, democracy and human rights, and right to development, which is the foundation of the mansion.

statements.speaker: Ministry of Foreign Affairs
statements.context: Official explanatory statement following Xi-Biden bilateral meeting
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China's goal of a stable, healthy and sustainable China-U.S. relationship remains unchanged. Its commitment to mutual respect, peaceful coexistence and win-win cooperation as principles for handling China-U.S. relations remains unchanged. Its position of resolutely safeguarding China's sovereignty, security and development interests remains unchanged. And its desire to carry forward the traditional friendship between the Chinese and American peoples remains unchanged.

statements.speaker: Liu Jianchao
statements.speaker_title: Head of International Liaison Department or senior diplomatic official
statements.context: US-China Political Dialogue in Shenzhen
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: A stable, healthy and sustainable China-U.S. relationship serves the common interests of both countries and is also the common expectation of the international community. China and the United States should maintain contact and communication, properly manage differences, deepen mutually beneficial cooperation, promote cultural and people-to-people exchanges, and shoulder their responsibilities as major countries in promoting world peace and development.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Bilateral meeting with Canadian Foreign Minister Melanie Joly at APEC
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China and Canada have different political systems, which is a choice made by their respective people and rooted in each other's history and culture. Both sides should adhere to mutual respect and seek mutual benefit and win-win results. The two countries share extensive common interests, and do not have conflicts of fundamental interests.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Bilateral meeting with Canadian Foreign Minister Melanie Joly at APEC
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Canada's imposition of high tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles violates the spirit of free trade and is not conducive to the healthy development of economic and trade cooperation between the two countries. Canada should earnestly abide by the World Trade Organization rules and lift discriminatory restrictions on Chinese products.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Bilateral meeting with Canadian Foreign Minister Melanie Joly at APEC
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The Taiwan question concerns China's sovereignty and territorial integrity, and the one-China principle is the universal consensus of the international community and an important part of the post-World War II international order, which can not be challenged. He expressed the hope that Canada will fully understand the high sensitivity of the Taiwan question and earnestly abide by the one-China principle.

article_title: China-Peru Joint Statement - Celebrating NEV Output Landmark - Funding Basic Research - Yin Hejun Outlines Sci-Tech Tasks - Philippines Sends Supplies to Grounded Ship - Scarborough Shoal Patrol

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Article published in Peruvian media outlet El Peruano during visit to Peru
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China is ready to launch more 'small and beautiful' livelihood cooperation projects in Peru, open more Luban Workshops and centers for Chinese language learning, strengthen cooperation on vocational education, and encourage Chinese companies to create more jobs and fulfill their social responsibilities in Peru.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Article published in Peruvian media outlet El Peruano during visit to Peru
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China is ready to join Peru in championing true multilateralism, promote an equal and orderly multipolar world and a universally beneficial and inclusive economic globalization, jointly implement the Global Development Initiative, the Global Security Initiative and the Global Civilization Initiative, and build together a community with a shared future for mankind.

statements.speaker: Ding Xuexiang
statements.context: Visit to Azerbaijan, meeting with President Ilham Aliyev in Baku
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China is willing to work with Azerbaijan in the spirit of sincere mutual trust and mutual benefit to strengthen political guidance, deepen comprehensive cooperation, so as to achieve their respective development and revitalization goals.

statements.speaker: Ding Xuexiang
statements.context: Visit to Azerbaijan, meeting with President Ilham Aliyev
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China values Azerbaijan's significant role in international and regional affairs and is prepared to work with Azerbaijan to implement the Global Development Initiative, the Global Security Initiative, and the Global Civilization Initiative, so as to promote building a community with a shared future for mankind.

statements.speaker: Ding Xuexiang
statements.context: Visit to Azerbaijan, meeting with Deputy Prime Minister Shahin Mustafayev
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China is willing to align the Belt and Road Initiative with Azerbaijan's economic and social development strategies and enrich the strategic partnership with more practical cooperation outcomes. China seeks to strengthen trade and investment cooperation and enable more high-quality Azerbaijani products to enter the Chinese market.
statements.topic: economic cooperation, trade, Belt and Road Initiative

statements.speaker: Ding Xuexiang
statements.context: Visit to Azerbaijan, meeting with Deputy Prime Minister Shahin Mustafayev
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China continues to deepen energy cooperation, strengthens connectivity to ensure the safe, stable, and smooth operation of China-Europe freight trains, and works with Azerbaijan and other countries along the route to build the trans-Caspian international transportation corridor.

statements.speaker: He Lifeng
statements.context: Meeting with HSBC Group Chairman Mark Tucker
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China welcomes more foreign financial institutions and long-term capital to invest and operate in China. China is making efforts to deepen the reform of its financial system, steadily expand institutional opening-up in its financial sector, and create a transparent, stable and predictable institutional environment.
statements.topic: economic policy, financial opening-up, foreign investment

statements.speaker: Chen Wenqing
statements.context: 9th meeting of the China-Russia law-enforcement and security cooperation mechanism
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China is willing to deepen strategic communication with Russia, promote close coordination and cooperation between departments of the two sides, work together further in safeguarding political security, cybersecurity, Belt and Road security and combating transnational crimes, to better ensure the overall development and stability of the two countries.

statements.speaker: Li Qiang
statements.context: Signing of State Council decree on revised regulations on the use of the national natural science fund
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: National Natural Science Foundation should adhere to the centralised and unified leadership of the Party Central Committee, focus on the forefront of world science and technology, the main economic battlefield, major national needs, and people's health and well-being.

statements.speaker: Yin Hejun
statements.context: Article in People's Daily
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: We must give full play to the fundamental supporting role of scientific and technological innovation, accelerate the development of new quality productive forces, lead the construction of a modern industrial system, and provide strong impetus and support for high-quality development.

statements.speaker: Yin Hejun
statements.context: Article in People's Daily
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: We must adhere to the strategic leading position of scientific and technological innovation, open up new fields and new tracks, seize the initiative in global scientific and technological competition, and win the initiative in the development of emerging industries and future industries.

statements.speaker: Yin Hejun
statements.context: Article in People's Daily
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The world has entered a new period of turbulence and transformation, with economic globalization facing headwinds. Some countries are building 'small yards with high walls', forcefully promoting 'decoupling and breaking of chains', and suppressing the development of China's high-tech industries. We must accelerate the realization of high-level scientific and technological self-reliance and self-strengthening.

statements.speaker: Liu Dejun
statements.context: Statement regarding South China Sea operations
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: On November 14, with China's permission, the Philippines sent a civilian ship to deliver daily necessities to its warship that was illegally 'grounded' on Ren'ai Reef. The China Coast Guard questioned and confirmed the Philippine ship and supervised the entire process. It is hoped that the Philippines will honour its commitment and jointly manage the maritime situation.

statements.speaker: China Coast Guard
statements.context: Official statement on South China Sea operations
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The China Coast Guard conducted law enforcement patrols on Thursday in the territorial waters and surrounding areas of Huangyan Dao (Scarborough Shoal) in the South China Sea. This rights protection patrol was carried out by the CCG in accordance with the law.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping

Entrepreneurs should actively engage in national development strategies, utilize multilateral and bilateral trade agreements and policy dividends like RCEP and China-ASEAN FTA Version 3.0. They should jointly promote integrated industrial development, deepen supply-demand integration, and build stable cross-border industrial and supply chains. Pool innovation and creativity, strengthen whole-chain innovation cooperation between industry, academia and research, particularly in clean energy, biomedicine and artificial intelligence to jointly foster new development drivers.

statements.speaker: Li Qiang
statements.context: Meeting with Vietnam's National Assembly Chairman Tran Thanh Man
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China is willing to enhance exchanges and cooperation with Vietnam's legislative bodies, strengthen coordination and cooperation in multilateral fields, and provide solid support for promoting each other's socialist construction. Legislatures of both countries should strongly support practical cooperation in various fields, focus on innovation, and provide legal guarantees for strengthening cooperation in emerging industries such as digital economy, new energy and 5G, and jointly cultivate and strengthen new development drivers. The two countries' legislatures should actively provide public guidance to enhance mutual understanding and goodwill between peoples, especially young people, and consolidate the social foundation for bilateral cooperation.
statements.topic: bilateral relations, legislative cooperation, institutional engagement

statements.speaker: State Council Hong Kong and Macao Affairs Office
statements.context: Official statement on Sam Hou Fai's election as Macau chief executive designate
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The successfully concluded election is significant for implementing the principle of 'patriots administering Macao' and advancing the successful practice of 'one country, two systems' with Macao characteristics. Sam received broad public support for his deep affection and sense of responsibility toward Macao and the country, willingness to collaborate with various social groups and sectors, and commitment to promoting socio-economic development and improving residents' well-being. Sam, who previously served as president of Macao's Court of Final Appeal, has handled major cases and effectively safeguarded national security and the constitutional order of the Macao SAR. The Macao society has confidence in Sam to safeguard both the country's overall interests and Macao's fundamental interests, and ensure steady practice of 'one country, two systems' with Macao characteristics. Sam demonstrates capability of adapting to changes and seeking transformation, and the will to seize opportunities and pursue reform.
statements.topic: Hong Kong and Macao affairs, governance, 'one country, two systems'

statements.speaker: People's Daily editorial
statements.context: Front page commentary on Sam Hou Fai's election
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The election fully reflects Macau society's heartfelt support for 'one country, two systems'. Practice has fully proven that 'one country, two systems' is a great initiative under socialism with Chinese characteristics and the best institutional arrangement for maintaining long-term prosperity and stability after the return of Hong Kong and Macau to the motherland, and it must be adhered to for a long time. The destinies of Hong Kong, Macau, and the mainland have always been closely linked, and national development has always been the strongest foundation for the development of Hong Kong and Macau.
statements.topic: Hong Kong and Macao affairs, 'one country, two systems', governance

statements.speaker: People's Daily (Jin Sheping byline)
statements.context: Article discussing economic policy and calling for confidence
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Overall economic performance has been stable with steady progress; however, some new situations and problems have also emerged. To strive to achieve the year's goals, we must strengthen our confidence in overcoming difficulties. Currently, all regions and departments are conscientiously implementing General Secretary Xi Jinping's important speech and the decisions and arrangements of the Party Central Committee. A series of measures to support stable economic growth and high-quality development have been introduced in quick succession, effectively guiding societal expectations and strengthening confidence in China's economy.

statements.speaker: People's Daily (Jin Sheping byline)
statements.context: Article discussing external environment and economic challenges
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The external environment has become increasingly complex, severe, and uncertain. The adverse effects of changes in the external environment on China's economy have increased. The IMF said 'global economy is stagnant'. Currently, major world economies are experiencing weak growth momentum and heavy debt burdens. Global trade protectionism has intensified, and uncertainty and instability have increased. Some external forces are trying to contain, blockade, and suppress China, deliberately attempting to hinder the historical process of building a socialist modern power in an all-round way and realizing the great rejuvenation of the Chinese nation. Rhetoric about 'decoupling and breaking supply chains' and 'small yards with high walls' has become louder, reflecting the increasing complexity, severity, and uncertainty of the external environment China faces.

statements.speaker: People's Daily (Jin Sheping byline)
statements.context: Article on economic development advantages and confidence
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China's development benefits from five strategic advantages: the strong leadership of the Communist Party of China, the notable advantages of the socialist system with Chinese characteristics, the solid foundation accumulated through sustained rapid development, a long-term stable social environment, and the spiritual strength of self-confidence and self-reliance. Additionally, China possesses the institutional advantage of a socialist market economy, the demand advantages of a super-large-scale market, the supply advantages of a complete supporting industrial system, and the talent advantages of a large number of high-quality workers and entrepreneurs. History and reality have repeatedly proven that the creation and continuation of China's economic miracle is inseparable from the strong leadership of the Communist Party of China and the fundamental guarantee of the socialist system with Chinese characteristics.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Speech marking the 70th anniversary of the Chinese People's Association for Friendship with Foreign Countries
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: People are the creators of history, and building a community with a shared future for mankind is the future of the people of all countries in the world. China is willing to strengthen friendly exchanges with friends from all countries, give full play to the unique role of people-to-people diplomacy, and work together to build a community with a shared future for mankind.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Speech marking the 70th anniversary of the Chinese People's Association for Friendship with Foreign Countries
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: We should build a broad consensus on promoting the building of a community with a shared future for mankind in the spirit of 'shared responsibility as dwellers of the same planet'. China is willing to work with all countries in the world to promote the common values of peace, development, fairness, justice, democracy and freedom, advocate an equal and orderly multi-polar world and an inclusive economic globalization that benefits all, and make the planet Earth a peaceful, friendly and harmonious home for all.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Speech marking the 70th anniversary of the Chinese People's Association for Friendship with Foreign Countries
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: We must gather a strong force to promote the building of a community with a shared future for mankind through the concept of win-win cooperation. The Communist Party of China is a party that seeks happiness for the Chinese people and rejuvenation for the Chinese nation. It is also a party that seeks progress for mankind and world harmony. I proposed the building of a community with a shared future for mankind and the GDI, GSI and GCI, all in order to promote the building of a better world and create a better life for people of all countries. Only through win-win cooperation can we accomplish things, do good things, and do great things. China does not pursue self-centered modernization, and welcomes more foreign friends to actively participate in China's modernization process. The country is committed to providing new opportunities for global development with its achievements in modernization, and promoting a global modernization that features peaceful development, mutually beneficial cooperation and common prosperity to better benefit people of all countries.

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Speech marking the 70th anniversary of the Chinese People's Association for Friendship with Foreign Countries
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: We should embrace all civilizations to build a community with a shared future for humanity with an open and inclusive mindset. Harmony while maintaining diversity is the law governing the occurrence and development of all things, as well as the principle behind the transmission and development of human civilization. Mutual exchange and learning are essential requirements for the advancement of civilization and serve as important driving forces for the progress of human civilization, as well as for world peace and development. Chinese civilization is an open system formed in constant exchange and mutual learning with other civilizations. The Chinese nation is an open and inclusive nation, and the Chinese people are kind and friendly people. China is willing to work with all parties to practice the GCI, promote a view of civilization that emphasizes equality, mutual learning, dialogue, and inclusiveness, enhance understanding and deepen friendship through sincere communication, transcend civilizational barriers through civilizational exchanges, transcend civilizational conflicts through civilizational mutual learning, and promote the world to develop in the direction of a community with a shared future.

statements.speaker: Xinhua News Agency
statements.context: Report on Eastern Theater Command drills
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Li Xi, spokesperson for the theater command, said the Joint Sword-2024B drills involve vessels and planes closing in on the island from multiple directions and assaults by joint forces. The drills focus on joint sea-air combat readiness patrol, the blockade and control of key ports and areas, strikes on sea and land targets, and the seizure of comprehensive battlefield control, so as to test the joint real-combat capabilities of the forces of the command. The drills are a powerful deterrent to the separatist activities of 'Taiwan independence' elements, and are legitimate and necessary actions to safeguard national sovereignty and national unity.

statements.speaker: Xinhua News Agency
statements.context: Commentary on Taiwan President Lai Ching-te's Double Tenth speech
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Lai continued to brazenly preach his 'two states' claim, openly clamoring that 'Taiwan has sovereignty' and that 'the People's Republic of China has no right to represent Taiwan'. The Taiwan regional leader repeatedly referred to the mainland as 'China' while playing with concepts and confusing right and wrong. By attempting to highlight political differences between the two sides of the Strait and break up their historical ties, Lai fabricated the false concept that 'the Republic of China equals Taiwan' to further advance his 'Taiwan independence' plot. Lai has been indulging in outright secessionist and blatantly provocative remarks. His increasingly hostile words lead nowhere, only escalating tensions and undermining peace and stability across the Taiwan Strait. If Taiwan's Democratic Progressive Party authorities continue going against the historical trend and pursuing their separatist line, they would plunge people in Taiwan into serious calamity.

article_title: Xi on Ethnic Affairs Policy - PRC's 75th Anniversary - Li Calls to Accelerate Economic Measures - Friends for Peace Group on Ukraine - China's Afghan Quartet Meeting - China-Russia Coast Guard Drills

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: National Conference on Commending Models for Ethnic Unity and Progress
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Addressing China's ethnic issues is our internal affairs, and no external forces have the right to interfere. The Communist Party of China and the Chinese people have found the correct path to solving ethnic issues with Chinese characteristics, and we do not need anyone else to point fingers at us or act as an 'instructor'. We must resolutely oppose all attempts to infiltrate, sabotage, slander, contain and suppress our country by using ethnicity, religion and other issues.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: United Nations General Assembly general debate
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China proposes to uphold peaceful coexistence and put in place a security architecture that ensures enduring stability; uphold openness and inclusiveness and foster a development paradigm that promotes shared prosperity; uphold harmony without uniformity and adopt an approach to civilizations that promotes exchange and mutual learning; and uphold fairness and justice and develop a governance structure that pools strengths for shared benefit.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: United Nations General Assembly general debate
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: In today's world, the security of all countries is tied together. In face of various kinds of global challenges and risks, no one can stay immune or enjoy security alone. Countries need to be guided by a vision of common, comprehensive, cooperative and sustainable security. We should respect each other's sovereignty and territorial integrity, take the legitimate security concerns of others seriously, and resolve disputes and differences through dialogue and consultation.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: United Nations General Assembly general debate
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Achieving modernization is a legitimate right of the people of all countries, not a prerogative of a few. We should be committed to advancing global modernization, and ensure that no one and no country is left behind on the journey toward modernization. We should advocate a universally beneficial and inclusive globalization, unequivocally oppose unilateralism and protectionism.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: United Nations General Assembly general debate
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: In the face of unilateral, bullying acts such as sanctions and blockade, China firmly supports countries in defending their legitimate rights, upholding the equity and openness of the international system. China will jointly oppose technology blockade and reject decoupling or severing supply chains. Sanctions and pressure will not bring monopolistic advantages. Suppressing and containing others will not solve problems at home.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: United Nations General Assembly general debate
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: We once again urge the United States to completely lift its blockade, sanctions and terrorism-related designation against Cuba.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: United Nations General Assembly general debate
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: At the global level, the principle of common but differentiated responsibilities must be upheld, and the Paris Agreement must be implemented in earnest. Developed countries should assist developing countries in building their capacity to cope with climate change. Touting the need of climate response while suppressing the green industries of others will only hold back global progress in green transition.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: United Nations General Assembly general debate
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China maintains that all countries' right to independently choose their path of human rights development should be respected. No country should impose its own will on others, or arbitrarily interfere in others' internal affairs citing human rights as an excuse.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: United Nations General Assembly general debate
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Taiwan is an inalienable part of China's territory. This is the history and the reality. Both the Cairo Declaration and the Potsdam Proclamation stated in explicit terms that all the territories Japan had stolen from the Chinese, such as Taiwan and the Penghu Islands, shall be restored to China. The complete reunification of China will be achieved. Taiwan will eventually return to the embrace of the motherland. This is the overwhelming trend of history that no one and no force can stop.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with US Secretary of State Antony Blinken
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The stabilization of China-U.S. relations serves the interests of the two peoples and meets the expectation of the international community. Whether or not this momentum can be sustained depends on the efforts of both sides. The United States should not always approach China with two faces: On the one hand encircling and suppressing China brazenly, and on the other hand, having dialogue and cooperation with China as if nothing is wrong.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with US Secretary of State Antony Blinken
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Since the United States has expressed multiple times that it has no intention to have conflict with China, then fundamentally, it needs to establish a rational perception of China, and find the right way to get along with it. The United States needs to carry out dialogue with respect, advance cooperation in the spirit of reciprocity, and address differences with great prudence, rather than act willfully as it sees fit from a position of strength or use previous mistakes as excuses to make more mistakes.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with US Secretary of State Antony Blinken
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The intensifying 'Taiwan independence' activities by Lai Ching-te and others pose the greatest danger to the situation across the Taiwan Strait. 'Taiwan independence' and cross-Strait peace are irreconcilable. If the United States truly hopes to see peace and stability across the Taiwan Strait, it should abide by the one-China principle, implement the three China-U.S. Joint Communiqués, stop arming Taiwan, publicly oppose 'Taiwan independence', and support the peaceful reunification of China.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with US Secretary of State Antony Blinken
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China is firmly opposed to U.S. suppression in trade and technology. National security should not be politicized, and 'small yard, high fence' should not become 'big yard, iron curtain'. China will never accept finger-pointing by human rights preachers, still less interference in China's internal affairs under the pretext of human rights.
statements.topic: trade, technology, human rights, US policy

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with US Secretary of State Antony Blinken
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: People-to-people exchanges between the two countries are very important, and the United States should remove obstacles with real actions.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with US Secretary of State Antony Blinken
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China articulated China's firm position on the South China Sea issue. China remains committed to resolving differences through dialogue and consultation with countries directly concerned. The United States should not stir up trouble in the South China Sea, or undermine regional countries' efforts to safeguard peace and stability there.
statements.topic: South China Sea, US policy, regional security

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with US Secretary of State Antony Blinken
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China's position on the Ukraine issue is aboveboard. It has been committed to promoting talks for peace and has been making its efforts toward peaceful settlement. The United States should stop smearing, scapegoating and arbitrarily imposing sanctions on China, and stop using this issue to create antagonism and incite camp-based confrontation.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: United Nations General Assembly general debate
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: An end to the Ukraine crisis remains elusive. The top priority is to commit to 'no expansion of the battlefield, no escalation of fighting and no provocation by any party,' and push for deescalation of the situation as soon as possible. China is committed to playing a constructive role, engaging in shuttle mediation and promoting talks for peace, not throwing oil on the fire or exploiting the situation for selfish gains.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: United Nations General Assembly general debate
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The Korean Peninsula should not experience war again. The important thing is to make persistent effort for deescalation, commit to seeking solutions through dialogue and consultation, realize a transition from the armistice to a peace mechanism, and safeguard peace and stability on the Peninsula.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: United Nations General Assembly general debate
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China is deeply aware that Asia needs stability and development and opposes division and conflict. We are firmly against the meddling by countries outside the region, and will resolutely resist attempts by any force to stoke trouble and confrontation in the region.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with South Korean Foreign Minister Cho Tae-yul
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The deployment of U.S. intermediate-range missiles in the region undermines regional peace and stability and does not serve the interests of regional countries. War and chaos must not occur on the Korean Peninsula and maintaining peace and stability on the Peninsula is in the common interest of all parties.
statements.topic: Korea, US military deployment, regional security

article_title: Stimulating the Economy - Wang Yi's AI, GDI & BRICS Pitches - Wang Meets 'Old Friend of the Chinese People' Muhammad Yunus - China on Hopes for Ties with US - Boosting Medium & Long-term Capital

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Speech at BRICS Foreign Ministers Meeting in New York
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: No country has the right to manipulate the global security agenda, let alone build its own security on the insecurity of other countries. On the Ukraine issue, the crisis should be resolved through dialogue and negotiation, preventing spillover of conflict and escalation of warfare.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Speech at BRICS Foreign Ministers Meeting in New York
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: We must uphold multilateralism and improve global governance. When multilateralism is under attack, the world falls into chaos. When hegemonic behaviour runs rampant, human civilization regresses to the law of the jungle.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Speech at High-level Conference on International Cooperation on AI Capacity Building
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: AI should not and cannot be reduced to a tool for maintaining hegemony and pursuing superiority. Establishing an AI governance mechanism with universal participation from all countries under the UN framework, so that all countries can participate and benefit equally.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with Ukrainian Foreign Minister Andrii Sybiha
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China has always advocated the peaceful settlement of disputes. China does not engage in geopolitical games or pursue its own self-interests, but has always actively promoted peace and negotiations. China has provided four batches of humanitarian assistance to Ukraine and is willing to provide new assistance according to Ukraine's needs.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with American representatives from various US organizations (National Committee on US-China Relations, US-China Business Council, US Chamber of Commerce, Aspen Institute, Asia Society, Council on Foreign Relations)
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: This year marks the 45th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between China and the United States. The two countries should be partners, not adversaries; they should help each other succeed rather than engage in vicious competition. President Xi Jinping has proposed three principles: mutual respect, peaceful coexistence, and win-win cooperation.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with American representatives from various US organizations
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: In contrast to China's stable and consistent policy towards the US, the US often sends mixed signals and presents two different faces in its China policy. The root cause lies in the inability of some in the US to view and accept China's development objectively. The US needs to recognize that China also has the right to develop, and that China's development is an opportunity for both the US and the world, rather than a challenge.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with American representatives from various US organizations
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China and the US as permanent members of the UN Security Council and the world's two largest economies should strive for stable, healthy, and sustainable development of their bilateral relationship. China-US relations require continuous dialogue and communication to eliminate unnecessary misunderstandings and misjudgments.

statements.speaker: Wang Xiaohong
statements.context: Meeting with US Department of Homeland Security Secretary Alejandro Mayorkas
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The two sides have achieved many visible outcomes in areas such as drug control, repatriation of illegal immigrants and cooperation on individual cases. China is willing to maintain communication with the U.S. at all levels, and push for steady and long-term law enforcement cooperation between the two countries.

statements.speaker: Wang Xiaohong
statements.context: Meeting with US Department of Homeland Security Secretary Alejandro Mayorkas
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The U.S. side should attach importance to addressing China's concerns, demonstrate sincerity with concrete actions, and remove obstacles for deepening cooperation.

article_title: Politburo Meeting Signals Economic Easing - Wang Yi's Diplomacy in New York - Guidelines to Implement Employment-first Policy - Song Tao Meets KMT's Sean Lien - Quad Summit & China

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Politburo Standing Committee meeting on economic situation (reported by Xinhua)
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Since the beginning of this year, the Party Central Committee with Comrade Xi Jinping as the core has united and led the people to overcome difficulties and respond calmly, enhance macroeconomic regulation, focus on deepening reform and opening up, expand domestic demand, and optimize economic structure.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: UN General Assembly Address in New York
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: A winner-takes-all approach is a sure way to lose the whole game, and the 'small yard with high fences' would only imprison the builder and tear the world apart. Major countries should break geopolitical circles by pursuing the greater good, rise above bloc confrontation with a broad vision for mutual prosperity.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with German Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock in New York
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Politicizing economic and trade issues and abusing tariff measures would serve no one's interests. Germany and the EU should stick to open cooperation, continue to hold dialogue and consultations with China, and jointly uphold international trade rules and a fair environment for competition.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with Lebanese Foreign Minister Abdallah Bou Habib in New York
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China is firmly opposed to indiscriminate attacks against civilians. Force does not equate to rightness and violence against violence will not solve the problems in the Middle East. China calls for realizing a 'permanent ceasefire and comprehensive withdrawal of troops' and ensuring effective implementation of 'the two-state solution.'

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian in New York
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China will continue to support Iran in safeguarding its sovereignty, security, territorial integrity and national dignity, and opposes external interference in Iran's internal affairs and exerting sanctions and pressure on the country.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: UN Security Council high-level meeting on Ukraine
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China is not a creator of the Ukraine crisis, nor is it a party concerned. China has always sided with peace, and maintained contact with all parties, including Russia and Ukraine. Any attempt to blame, attack or smear China on the Ukraine issue is irresponsible and will not succeed.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with UN Human Rights High Commissioner and foreign ministers at UNGA
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The United States and a few other countries used the Xinjiang issue to attack and smear China's human rights situation. The political manipulation of the United States and its followers has become increasingly unpopular. Nearly 80 countries, including the majority of Muslim countries, supported China's position, demonstrating opposition to politicization of human rights issues and interference in internal affairs.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with UN Human Rights High Commissioner and foreign ministers at UNGA
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: If the United States is so concerned about Muslim human rights, why does it continuously provoke or support wars in the Middle East causing Muslim casualties? Why does it fail to support Palestine as a UN member or play its due role in achieving ceasefire in Gaza?

statements.speaker: Ministry of National Defense
statements.context: Official statement regarding ICBM test
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The missile fell into expected sea areas. This was a routine arrangement in the annual training plan and relevant countries had been notified in advance. The launch tested weaponry performance and military training effectiveness and achieved desired goals.

statements.speaker: Song Tao
statements.speaker_title: Head of Taiwan Work Office of CPC Central Committee and Taiwan Affairs Office of State Council
statements.context: Meeting with Sean Lien, vice chairman of Chinese Kuomintang party, in Liaoning Province
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: We will always keep the well-being of Taiwan compatriots in mind and share development opportunities with them. We oppose 'Taiwan independence' separatism and external interference, seeking peace for the Taiwan Strait, welfare for compatriots, reunification for the country, and rejuvenation for the nation.

article_title: Xi on China's Space Ambitions - Xi's Message to Dissanayake - What are the Three Concentrations for SoEs & State Capital? - Wang Yi Meets Muizzu - MoFA on Quad Summit

statements.speaker: Xi Jinping
statements.context: Speech meeting with space scientists and engineers on Chang'e-6 lunar mission
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Outer space is a domain shared by humanity, and space exploration is humanity's common cause. The lunar exploration project has always followed principles of equality, mutual benefits, peaceful utilization and win-win cooperation. The Chang'e lunar missions belong to both China and all people in the world, and have provided a broad stage for international scientific and technological cooperation.

statements.speaker: Lin Jian
statements.context: Regular Ministry of Foreign Affairs press briefing
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Quad is identified as the premier regional grouping that plays a leading role in the US's Indo-Pacific strategy. It is a tool the US uses to contain China and perpetuate US hegemony. The Indo-Pacific strategy attempts to patch up forces to exclude and contain China by peddling the 'China threat' narrative. Though the US claims that it does not target China, the first topic of the summit is about China and China was made an issue throughout the event. The US is lying through its teeth.

statements.speaker: Lin Jian
statements.context: Regular Ministry of Foreign Affairs press briefing
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China believes that cooperation between countries should not target any third party or even harm their interests. Ganging up to form exclusive groupings undermines mutual trust and cooperation between regional countries. The US needs to get rid of its obsession with perpetuating its supremacy and containing China, stop using regional countries as its tool, and stop glossing over the strategic intention behind exclusive groupings.

statements.speaker: Lin Jian
statements.context: Regular Ministry of Foreign Affairs press briefing
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The situation in the East and South China Seas is generally stable. Some country outside the region keeps cobbling together small groupings and tries every means to meddle in maritime issues at China's doorstep in order to incite bloc confrontation, escalate the situation, and undermine regional peace and stability. No interference from any force will weaken China's determination in defending its territorial sovereignty and maritime rights and interests.
statements.topic: South China Sea, East China Sea, maritime issues

statements.speaker: Lin Jian
statements.context: Regular Ministry of Foreign Affairs press briefing
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: Cooperation between countries should be conducive to peace, stability, and prosperity in the region, rather than focusing on forming exclusive groupings that undermine trust and cooperation among regional countries. China is open to normal cooperation between relevant countries at sea, but the cooperation should not target other countries or undermine regional peace and stability under any pretext.

statements.speaker: Wang Yi
statements.context: Meeting with Maldivian President Mohamed Muizzu in New York
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: China and the Maldives have always understood, trusted and supported each other. China's development will enhance the force for peace in the world and augment the strength of developing countries. China-Maldives relations have become an example of countries large and small treating each other equally, helping and supporting each other, and striving for mutual benefits and win-win results. China will always support the Maldives' effort to protect its sovereignty, independence, territorial integrity and national dignity.

statements.speaker: Zhong Sheng
statements.context: Commentary published in People's Daily on US tariff announcement following USTR four-year review
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The United States has politicized, instrumentalized, and weaponized economic and trade issues, and has insisted on imposing tariffs, which is protectionism that goes against the trend of the times. The United States should immediately correct its wrong practices and cancel all tariffs imposed on China.

statements.speaker: Zhong Sheng
statements.context: Commentary published in People's Daily on US tariff announcement
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: The US government did not respect the opinions of the people, and insisted on raising the 301 tariffs on China out of domestic political compulsions. The US approach cannot achieve its declared goals; rather it will only backfire and weaken the competitiveness of American industries.

statements.speaker: Zhong Sheng
statements.context: Commentary published in People's Daily on US tariff announcement
statements.quote_or_paraphrase: American tariff increases distort market rules and seriously damage the interests of the American people...Outdated protectionist policies are also not conducive to protecting the interests of American workers. According to statistics, the tariff increase on China has not only failed to solve the employment problem of American workers, but has led to the loss of 142,000 jobs in the United States.

statements.speaker: State Council
